Reviews: I have used this treatment for about 2 weeks now and haven't had any symptoms come back. Thanks for making this 100% working treatment!

I have been on Trintellix now for about 3 years and have been very depressed and suicidal lately until my psychiatrist recently put me on abilify, After 3 days i am virtually depression free, no anxiety! This is a miracle to me! I have not felt this good in years!

Condition: adjunct therapy for obsessive compulsive disorder
Reviews: Abilify just didn't work for me. I had taken Zyprexa but needed to get off it because my cholesterol shot up. So, I've been trying Abilify for a month. It hasn't helped my OCD at all, and in fact has made it a bit worse. It interferes with my sleep, and I feel nauseous and don't want to eat. The worst part is that it makes me very irritable and angry, which is not like me at all. Luckily, no serious side effects, but enough to make life miserable. So, I'm going to go off it and see if there's something else out there that can help.Read More Read Less

I started on the 10 mg equivalent Aristada injection four years ago.  I am currently on 15 mg, and upping the dose to 20mg soon.  I have not had a schizophrenia relapse this whole time.  At first I thought the medication was causing anhedonia but the longer I take it I realize it was the illness not the abilify.  I also take 300mg Buproprion and this past month started taking high doses of fish oil.  I've been suffering since the age of 26 and just now I feel I can totally recover.  Hang in there it takes years to recover.  Also, be careful with fish oil.  It is helping my concentration, sex drive, and focus but I am upping my dose of abilify just to avoid paranoia.  I thought I'd never recover from anhedonia but my zest for life is finally coming back.  Holy cow!  Thanks science!Read More Read Less

I have treatment resistant depression. And in addition to my other antidepressants abilify has saved my life?? I was in a deep dark place and all I wanted to do was die. I was overwhelmed with sadness fear and despair. Although I still participated in life each and every day and did everything in my power to overcome I felt like I was just existing. No joy. No hope. Like a prison cell with no windows. Within a few days I felt like I went from darkness to light. Even though it was cloudy outside there was sunshine in my heart. I thank God for each and every day and want to live now. I hope and pray it does the same for you???? I take 2mgs twice a day. Read More Read Less

If I were a PARENT reading this whose child is under ten and does not have Tourette's, autism, Schizophrenia, or bipolar, I'd run away fast.

My daughter has early childhood trauma from her birth family. She suffers from PTSD and ADHD. We  began this medication to treat her aggression and restlessness. At 2mg and 5mg, it had mild benefits such as sleep regulation and some behavioral improvement. A few weeks after beginning a 10mg dose, she snapped. She literally threatened my life and tried to access a weapon. 

I have since learned that we are not alone. This medication can backfire and increase aggression. We wish we'd been more cautious.Read More Read Less

I was on a high amount of Venlafaxine/Effexor and I would have a mood swing every month and I felt very aggressive at times . So my doctor and I discussed lowering the Effexor and I  suggested Abilify.  I had been on before years ago. The past two weeks being on Abilify as an adjunctive therapy, I have felt great! I feel more calm,happier, moods seem stable and I feel more focused.

I was recently diagnosed with bipolar type two. My doctor added this medication on top of my other medication and has changed my life. I have suffered with deep depression, mood swings, loss of interest, and extreme exhaustion. This has made me feel like I have my life back. More energy, feeling happy and back to my normal self. I highly recommend this. Only downside is weight gain in the extreme form but itâs worth it.

I have suffered from MDD (Major Depression Disorder) for years. It was being managed pretty well with Cymbalta but about a year ago I went through a huge depressive state and haven't been able to get any better. I originally wanted to try Rexulti but insurance would not pay for it so doctor prescribe Abilify 10mg/day. It has been a life saver. I have been taking it for about 3 weeks now and everyone in my life has seen a big change in my behavior and attitude. They only downside so far is I feel a little jittery (like to much caffeine). Read More Read Less

This is my third day taking Abilify and I already notice a difference, I was severely depressed and had uncontrollable crying as well as dissociation. I haven't cried once since taking it, its only been 3 days, but that's still a big deal. Dissociation intensity decreased and depressive episodes have too. I feel the effects after an hour or so of taking it, and I feel just light again and good. Only taking a 2 mg dose, and I think it wears off pretty fast, so might have to go up in dosage depending on how I continue to feel.Read More Read Less

Took Abilify a few years ago, it did nothing for me, but made me shake uncontrollably and gave me Tardive Dyskinesia.  My lips move uncontrollably, my big toe moves up and down by itself.  I went off the drug and stopped shaking, but the movements will never go away. I will tell anyone to never take this drug.
Withdrawal symptoms are horrific.  Continual crying non stop suicidal thoughts a month after I stopped taking it.  I wish I had never started it.

When I first started taking this I thought I found a miracle. I used it sporadically when I was really struggling with my depression.  It always worked . Then I started getting involuntary hand and feet movements.  It has been at least 8 years since I stopped taking it yet the TD symptoms persist and have gotten worse.  The new TD medications are way more than I can afford $$$$$. It is agonizing to know there may be a solution that I can't benefit from because I am not rich. Maybe I will win the lottery. I have suffered from severe depression and anxiety. 90mg Cymbalta keep me functioning but not well. My Dr added Abilify about 2 months ago and it has made me feel 100% better. No side effects to date

I started taking this to address extreme mood swings (irrational anger and severe sadness) associated with depression. The Dr fist prescribed 5mg which immediately addressed my mood swings but within 2 weeks I developed blurry vision, sensitivity to light, and akathisia. The Dr switched me to the 2mg dose and it has been perfect. No side effects and equally as effective as the 5mg dose. Very happy with this medication. Life changing.

I have Major depression, Bipolar type 2, PTSD, Panic and anxiety disorder and ADHD. Great combo I know. Anyways.... I hate this medication. A week in I started going crazy. I was on Abilify for two years or so, it worked great until by body continued to build a high tolerance on it. I started at a decently low dose and had to be increased every now and then. I eventually reached the max dosage- I had already been at a very high dose for my age- and had to be taken off because of the inability to control facial expressions and other muscles (Tardive Dyskinesia).

Our autistic son was prescribed after experiencing violent tics/outbursts. The medication caused his behaviors to be more frequent when the dosage was increased. We took him off and he now has the behaviors once every couple of days.
On it to long causes stiffness mouth twitching and insatiable appetite. With weight gain

I've been on Lexapro for 15 years for dysthymia and bouts of clinical depression. The Lex kept the sharpest corners smoothed off, but only gave me a grey existence.

My current Psychiatrist added 5 mg of Abilify to my medications. The effect has been nothing short of a miracle cure.  I hope Abilify continues to work for me for a very long time.
It makes u feel invisble, like u will die, u will gain weight, u will be weak. Ur eyes will be bad. Lifes still wrecked
This medication made me zone out. I had no idea people were even talking to me. It was extremely expensive. I would not recommend.

I was given abilify to help boost my antidepressant.  I took it for a year or so my depression never got any better. Then my Dr changed my appointment date to a week later one month, and before the week was over I got a condition called musical ear syndrome, and it drives me insane 24/7. It's horrible and I've had it for over 3 years now. He said going off of abilify abruptly wouldn't cause that ,but yet whenever I would say I didn't want to take it anymore he would say "you want the music to go away don't you?" That's kind of revealing that it was the cause. Be very careful to never run out of them if you choose to take them.Read More Read Less

I came off my Abilify very slowly. My psychiatrist is very kind and understanding to let me make my own choices regarding what medication I take or not take. I have been on Abilify for a very long time. The earlier psychiatrists gave me it cause it treats depression better with another antidepressant. Well for all those years I can say I never feel relieved from the agony. In fact I believe it made me feel worse. How do I know that? From coming off it slowly. I was first given 10mg. After I while I take 5mg, then 2mg, then 1mg. Now I am taking no Abilify. I paid close attention to how I feel all this time.  Now with 0 Abilify, only Trintelex and Trazadon, I have never feel this good.  Now I am less irritated, tired, have more hope, sleep better. I can do more and feel more serene.  I highly recommend Trintelex for depression. Read More Read Less

Abilify is cutting my life short. Even though I am schitzo-affective im in tune with my body and mind. This drug causes my legs to shake most times uncontrollably sometimes my fingers twitch and cramp for no reason. I move my toes constantly causing open sores and leather patches. They gave me another drug to counter act the restlessness in my legs but I refuse to take it.( no more meds). Its caused erectile disfunction in me, it's made me put on 30+ pounds in the 7 years Even though I eat and exercise regularly. Now I'm facing diabetes even though the doctors say I'm pre-diabetic and I can turn it around. I'm not believing them as I'm very active and watch what I eat and drink. I think because of my lifestyle this didn't occur sooner. I am court ordered to take my medication or the govt. Will lock me up. They've done it before. It makes me lethargic for 3 days after the injection and usually stops working at week 3. Or sooner depending on if I worked out in the sun to long or if I get sick as in the flu, cold, covid 19 etc. My doctor says that the benefits out weigh the negative effects. I have tried these Psyche meds to no avail: respidol, halidal, and lamictal. Between these three they caused bloating, weight gain (22lbs in 2weeks), throat constriction, breathing problems and anxiety. If someone knows of something that can help me let me know please. *** The last 2 months I have been losing my memory I fear it is causing me dementia at 49.Read More Read Less
honestly no idea why they prescribe this. Insane weight gain and suicidal ideation, brain zaps, fatigue. gained 30 pounds over 4 months
It seems to be working ok, although it makes me sleepy, and I constantly feel hungry.
This is good drug to cure schizophrenia
Can't complain - it worked well for me

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: Essentially I was undiagnosed bipolar for many years. Once I finally got my diagnosis I was put on Abilify and I could see clearly again. It saved my life truly. Yes I have gained weight but I think itâs also from my own bad habits as well. I still have episodes sometimes but I donât feel hopeless anymore and thats what matters. I feel level the majority of the time so Iâll take it.

Suffered two bouts of depression and anxiety in my life that debilitated me for months on end. Was put on 10 mg of lexapro and it did little to stop the waves of anxiety to come on. Doctor put me on 2mg of abilify and within a couple days already started feeling better. Weeks later felt completely normal again and felt like I had a security blanket. You must keep taking it though. Just because you feel normal does not mean to quit cold turkey. It's a long road and weaning off of it most be controlled. Read More Read Less

i was suffering with severe depression for a year. i've been taking zoloft 200mg, brintellix 20mg but my mood was not stable at all. my depression went up and down all the time and i had to deal with my suicidal thoughts when i'm low. When my depression hit low again, i told my doctor that i can not do this anymore. i was in pain all the time and i was frustrated. My doctor added abilify 1mg and in 4days i was able to come out of bed without pouring all my energy. Now, i've been on abilify for 2 weeks and i've never felt this brightness since i got depression. i hope this med can help other patients who are dealing with depression looks like deep endless tunnel. We can do this. Read More Read Less

Let me start this by saying I'm normally a really chilled person. I have a wonderful family, 2 boys and a wife. My doctor prescribed this medication for my Bipolar Disorder. In my 2 months on this medication my world has been flipped upside down. I have had spats of irritability, excess weight gain, constant hatefulness twords my wife and kids, and I almost ruined my marriage with my need to constantly have sex and wanting to masturbate  24/7. This medicine made me do things that weren't me, made me act ways that hurt my wife, and made me do things that almost ruined my marriage. I do not recommend this medication for anyone, no matter the age, gender, race, etc.Read More Read Less

I have been on Abilify 20mg for over 10 years. It has helped my brain. But I was advised to stay on it during pregnancy  My baby was born with Cleft lip and palate.  I have gained 60 kgs and am now obese. I do not recommend taking it for long term. I did research this evening and am really concerned that my life will probably end in my 60's. I have had other health issues while on it. And desperately trying to find something else.
This medication worked well for me

I started taking Abilify 2mg by itself. I had really rough side effects the first week including: nausea, heart burn, belching, and really high fever. Although the side effects were bothersome after a week they went away, I took pepto for the nausea and heartburn and took Tylenol for the fevers because I was really hopeful Abilify would work for me. If you get these side effects donât stop taking Abilify because it could be so worth it. It is also important to keep increasing the doses at least every week because Abilify does stop working which happened to me. Iâm now taking 5mg and I feel loads better than taking the 2mg. I am able to wake up in the morning feeling motivated and ready to take on the day. Iâm not so agitated or get upset easily anymore. I am able to be happy without it being forced like putting on a mask everyday. Iâm really happy I gave Abilify a chance itâs working really well for me. Read More Read Less

I had horrible akathisia and wanted to crawl out of my own skin. I became extremely agitated and extremely panicky for no reason, shifting between crying and wanting to yell at everyone. I eventually ended up in the hospital where they took me off it and I was fine again in a couple of days with new medications. Thinking back, while I was very depressed and anxious before starting Abilify, this definitely made it 10 times worse within a few days and led to a very traumatic experience for me. Though I have not experienced anything as severe in the year and a half since, I now live with a constant fear that it will happen again.Read More Read Less
Abilify was added to already existing bipolar meds (citalopram, carbamazepine) and it has been a miracle for me. It brought me out of the fog of depression I was under.

Hey y'all i jus wanna say this medicine has worked wonders for me i am on the 10 mg dose n i take it alone. Yes i have gained some weight which i needed jus got to watch what u eat n fight the cravings. It had always helped me get off the hard drugs...FINALLY!!! I never thought i would have the chance to say this.

Works very well at controlling mania, haven't had a true manic episode since being on it. I was on too high of a dose (20 mg per day) and was dealing with disassociation and blunted emotions. Dropped down to 10 mg, then 5 mg. At 5 mg I still deal with blunted emotions but I am no longer disassociated. However... I crave carbs/sweets and I am constantly hungry since lowering my dose. I've gained 35 lbs in 8 months. My psych doesn't want to try a different med... I'm not exactly thrilled with the weight gain and my GP is running labs to see if I am pre-diabetic. Abilify caused me to gain over 70lbs. develop type 2 diabetes a terrible rash over my entire body & has made me feel suicidal for years. In addition to these side effects it has made me have more episodes at night with my sleep apnea, restless legs and terrible leg cramps. I have been on this drug for 10-15 years still experience sensation hallucinations and intense nightmares, some night feeling like I was going to die. Stay off this drug trust this guinea pig it will ruin your life!

I started putting on weight pretty quickly after taking it, iâd say within the first few months. Eventually I had put on 20-30 pounds just like that. That is not good for someone suffering with bipolar/depression. I ended up getting off of it somewhere around my year mark and now iâm the most stable iâve ever been on this other medication. Overall, Abilify is absolutely not worth it to me. Read More Read Less

I have been on ability for 10 + years Iâve worked full time 7 to present.  Itâs a miracle for me accompanied with therapy.  But what has not worked is the generic no matter the dose itâs not the same.   I live independently and I thank the medication for this.
I suffered severe depression and anxiety for 20 years despite treatment with multiple medications.  I started taking Abilify 2.5mg and it COMPLETELY changed my life.  A miracle drug for me.

This is a very, very serious medication. I was put on 2mg to augment with 50 mg of Zoloft and 300 mg of Wellbutrin, then was increased to 5mg. After one month, I gained 30, yes 30 lbs and was extremely swollen. Over time the weight increased and by the time I tapered off I went from 120 to 190 lbs. my personality completely changed and I could barely hold conversations. I was constantly exhausted and would wake up in the middle of the night. I was now scared to go out in public and would become very anxious. I also craved sweets and carbs constantly because of the Abilify and was constantly hungry. I couldnât lose weight for the life of me no matter how much I worked out or how little I ate. so I began tapering off and it took me 2 years to do it safely. I still had to function in life, I couldnât lay in bed for 6 months. The last 8 months tapering were torture. I wouldnât wish that on anyone. Iâm still dealing with trying to lose weight and my hormones, etc getting back to pre-Abilify, it has been a long road. This medicine can do wonders for those who actually need it. It can also do a lot of damage. Every person is different, just listen to your body and pay attention if you do decide to take this medication. Read More Read Less

Treating long-term depression w severe anxiety w celexa and klonopin; and now 2mg abilify for a month.  I am loving the effects it has had on me and personal life.  I have been stuck physically and mentally due to severe accident 3 yrs ago,& wow this has made a huge difference in my quality of life.
Best of drugs until now

Reviews: The medication definitely did it's job in helping boost my mood and give me more energy, but I had to hop off of it pretty fast because I couldn't deal with the side effects. I had a near-constant headache that caused me to be unfocused at work, and stopped me from doing my normal daily activities. (I should note that this might be prevented with the use of ibuprofen or something of the like in conjunction with this, but I don't like taking medication if I don't need to, and so I usually refuse it for headaches...)Read More Read Less
Abilify prevented ejaculations for me (a male).    Stopped taking Abilify and immediately back to normal.
Been placed on this med at the hospital with Luvox for OCD and depression. So far, I'm having difficulty sleeping, but otherwise it is too early to tell if it is working. Wil post in several weeks.

It all started off when I had attempted suicide in 8th grade. At first, I loved Abilify. Now, I am regretting ever taking it. Within the first six months of taking Abilify, I gained 60 pounds. I was 14, and I went from around 140 to 200 pounds. I'm 17 now, and I came off the medicine last month, and I can quite honestly tell you that I have noticed no difference. I would frequently have thoughts of suicide while taking this medication, and it was made even worse by the extreme weight gain. I would be ravenous, eating at all hours of the day and night. Whatever I would eat would not satisfy my hunger. I also never really felt "happy" while taking this drug. I would have days where I felt less sad, but never really happy. Hi I am Anna and the reason Iâm reviewing this medication is because it changed my life completely (and not in a good way).   Let me start off from the beginning: I was diagnosed with major depression and bipolar disorder when I was around 7 (I am now 15). In my opinion I believe this was an extremely poor diagnosis by my therapist. Anyways, roughly a few months after seeing a psychiatrist I was put on Abilify. I was originally a very healthy and underweight/average kid, but as I continued to take Abilify my weight drastically increased. I was extremely athletic but I still gained weight. As can be expected, as I gained weight, my self confidence dropped as well. My self confidence and mental health was at an all time low from 6th grade to the beginning/middle of 8th grade. In addition I had unhealthy cholesterol levels. My highest weight was around 165 lbs and 5â2. Suicidal thoughts and attempts were a constant in my life because I hated my body and myself so much. Eventually after multiple failed attempts, in 8th grade I was taken off of Abilify. I became homeschooled to help with stress. Even though i was homeschooled and not exercising, I began to lose weight without any major changes to my eating habits. I liked the weight loss and began to âdietâ and dropped A LOT of weight and becoming 3â taller. After people always commenting on my low weight I began to binge and purge (not sure of whether to gain or lose weight) throughout summer and the beginning of 9th grade. I was confused about whether i would gain weight if I ate unhealthy or too much. I was afraid of going back to my âfatâ self but I also didnât wanna get called âa twigâ. I was pulled back and forth. As of today, I am fairly content with my weight and I am aware that Abilify slowed down my metabolism TREMENDOUSLY.  Of course Abilify did not single handedly lead to suicidal thoughts but I think itâs important to understand just how badly the weight gain effected me. Hope this helped :)Read More Read Less

Larry, 65-74 Male on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)  Effectiveness Current Rating: 4  Ease of Use Current Rating: 1  Satisfaction Current Rating: 1  Comment:  Worked well, quelled my racing thoughts, settled me down, and improved my depression. Bi-Polar II disorder, have been on 200 mg of Lamotrigine for 5 years and Abilify was prescribed to help improve depression, enable me to try and improve only 4 hours of sleep at night, here comes the major part - BUT... Developed a compulsive gambling disorder! This med has ruined me financially! Then saw tv ads specifically stating compulsive disorders (specifically sexual and gambling) and have also talked with an attorney. Google "Abilify and gambling" and you'll find that Australia, Canada and England all have class action law suits in different stages. Canada and Australia have made the drug two manufacturing companies comply with "listing on their labels and med info sheets that taking this med may lead to specifically a "gambling" addiction! Started at 2mg initial dosage, after about 3 months, went to 7.5mg, then at about 9 months went to 10mg. The increase made it impossible for me to control the compulsion I had to gamble! In process of documenting and will go to the 5 different casinos where I became a member and get my records of my losses, easily $1,000 a week. Wiped out 4 years of social security savings, total is over $60,000 in 1 1/2 years while on this med. Stopped taking the Abilify 3 months ago and now my uncontrolable gambling "compulsion" is gone. Was never addicted and rarely went to a casino prior to taking this medication!    ::::Anyways what that sounds like to me is you should of actually be treated also for OCD as well something like that doesn't just develop from taken a pill somewhere in your conscious you had to of already had that compulsion.Read More Read Less

After only taking low doses (2-5mg) of Abilify for a year, the drug completely ruined my health and life with countless permanent side effects.  Years after getting off medication, I am still so severely disabled, both physically and mentally, by so many new illnesses I never had before taking medication.  I took this medication for a neurological disorder, but Abilify has plunged me into the dark world of mental illness by causing illnesses including Schizophrenia, Bipolar Disorder, and OCD.  Very quickly into taking the drug, I remember asking my mother how a drug with this disabling of side effects was even legal, and it is so disturbing to think that this drug is regularly given to children.  After about two months, I had already developed such severe withdrawals when lowering the dose that I could not get off the drug.  Abilify was so intolerable that it took multiple drugs to counteract its side effects, and even then, they still were nowhere near manageable.  My experience has convinced me that it is a myth that this medication is any safer than older drugs for Tourettes like Haldol and Orap.  While still on Abilify, the drug forced me to say good things about it, thus I suffered in silence.  Once getting off the drug I could finally begin to think clearly enough to tell my real experience.  Please read my full story here, which goes into detail about many of the side effects I have developed from Abilify: https://wp.rxisk.org/abilify-tourette-syndrome-and-me/Read More Read Less

Memory Loss - I am taking this medication in addition to my Wellbutrin, because my Wellbutrin wasn't working as effectively as it has in the past. But, I had to taper off due to memory loss.  I'm only 35 years old, have no history of dementia in both sides of my family - yet, when I was on it, there would be entire conversations that I would forget I had.  Then, when the person was telling me, "I told you this, already. Remember? You said something like..." then would quote me and I would think, "wow. that sounds like something I would say!"     This happened repeatingly, so I am getting of the medication!!! Read More Read Less

This medication definitely helped my mood and made me feel better mentally, but it had a lot of uncomfortable side effects for me, so I stopped it after only one week. I was less angry and irritated on this, and more patient and felt mentally better. My mom said I was nicer to be around. Once I went off it, I noticed the flood of thoughts racing back into my head, but I decided that Abilify's side effects were worse than the problems I have off of the medication, such as the racing of thoughts in my head and my irritability.   With side effects, I felt way to energized (although that's not the right word to describe the feeling I had), and I think it was akathasia I had, but I'm not sure. It's a hard feeling to describe. I'd go to restaurants and places and some people would stare at me, like "What the heck?" and I'd feel bad about it. I went to a crowded beauty salon and some people were staring at me on this medication, like there was something wrong with me.   I wish I could tolerate this drug as well as many people do, because it really helped me mentally, and I felt better mentally, but I decided that the side effects weren't worth it.   Also, I felt like I was getting fatter on this med, although I was told it was weight-neutral. My stomach felt like it got bigger. Read More Read Less

THIS IS THE DEVIL'S DRUG!!! Satan created this drug himself!!! I started taking Abilify as an addition to another medication to act as a mood stabilizer. Our adopted son, age 9 has been on this medication for 6 months (started at 1mg and is now on 5 mg qhs).  He was exposed to methamphedamine in utero.  This medication has been extremely helpful.  It was our last choice because of our fears how this would effect his developing brain and our concern over weight gain.  He has gained 8 pounds in the last year over what is normal for a childs growth.  We are working on his diet and teaching him that sometimes he "thinks" he is hungry, but actually his belly is full.  This has helped.  But it is a constant struggle.  Even with the weight gain, he is now able to benefit from the therapy and behavior modification programs. I am bipolar and have had low grade depression since menopause two years ago. I take lithium and trazodone (for sleep). I took 2.5 mg of Abilify for 10 days and then increased to 5 mg. At 5 mg. I felt great, expansive, a sense of well being I haven't had for years. The only problem is that I had trouble sleeping, and I feel it kicked me into a mild hypomania. I took this medication to help with my fixed thinking. Within a month of taking this medication I started to have neuro-muscular side effects. All of a sudden my lower jaw was shifting over to the left and no matter how hard I tried moving it back, I couldn't; even when I physically pushed it back with my hand, it went right back to the left side. It also became hard to talk and I had no control over my tongue. I went to the ER because I thought I was having an allergic reaction. I was in Canada however and not deemed severe enough to be seen right away. During the 6 hours in the waiting room, my back started to curve to the left as well and I could not sit or stand straight up. After taking an abnormal psychology class I thought I was developing tardive dyskinesia and I was scared out of my mind. I stopped taking it right away. I personally would not recommend taking it.Read More Read Less

I have been on abilify for many years.  I think it is a miracle drug.  I am very happy and I can function with this and other drugs.  I have lost weight using this, I might have gained some in the beginning.  I defiantly recommend trying abilify.

My mother was mentally sick for a year in a ,  not getting any better.  She was at her worst when we had her transferred to another hospital.  Her new Doctor prescribed abilify and now 6 months later,  we have our mother back to normal.  We NEVER thought she would ever be this good again.  She is 70 and has had Schizophrenia her whole life,  it getting worse the older she got.  She is now the sweet lady we grew up with and again has quality of life.  She is on a small dose and has not gained much weight.  I would recommend this to any patient that has battled this illness with not so great results.  Read More Read Less
It is helping with my mood swings definitely. I feel like it could be increased and I would be level. I will talk to my doctor on my next visit to get her input.

This medicine is terrible prescribed for depression. Inability to have an erection. Weight gain , insomnia, not able to stay still.Stay away from this crap.

Took the lowest dose of this medication once at night (the only other medication I was on was 100mg of Pristiq).  Within hours, I couldn't stop moving, felt like I was crawling out of my skin, had suicidal thoughts.  By morning, I had to go to the ER. My BP was 150/105. They had to sedate me all day. It took several days for the effects to wear off.  I will never touch this medication again.  I thought I should write this review to warn others as no one told me this could happen.

I have been on abilify for 2 months, I am also taking venlafaxine XR for my severe depression, I am currently taking 10 mg of abilify and I am doing fine at the dosage. I have gained a little weight but I am watching closely and eating better since I feel better, this is a miracle drug

I was extremely excited going on this medicine because my depression went away almost immediately. I was also taking buproprion and lexapro at the time and the Abilify was just the right boost for my other meds... but then I gained weight.  I gained 60 pounds within just about 2-3 months. I'm 5'2 and used to being 115-125lbs and I reached 183lbs.  When I realized it was the Abilify making me gain weight, I went off of it right away. Gaining weight made me even more depressed because I'm not used to weighing so much. To the previous reviewer that said u gain weight only, because people are overeating on it, sounds to have a little bit of an ego problem. After all the side effects state "weight gain", not "weight gain only if u overeat". I am a fit 45 year old women , never been overweight and I don't overeat. As a matter of fact I was very cautious what I ate while on abilify because I was aware of that side effect. While on abilify I was packing on weight at a shocking rate. It was making me more depressed because of the extra weight that I am not used to. I stopped taking it because of this issue. So it may work for depression but I don't trust what else can pop up in the future because of it . I gained from 208 to 397.  Makes your body swell like tick.  I am male and I found milk forming behind my nipples, had to have mammogram to prove it.  Makes penis less firm and no morning wood.  It is better then other medicines which prohibit males from sex period.  I would call it the lesser of the two evils to treat impulse (what some doctors call mania), but does not help with down feeling.  I am consulting a lawyer for my long term options.  I have paid psychiatrist, psychologist, primary care physician, specialist, and consulted nutritionist.  The systems of bi-polar may be treatable with simple diet by regulating salt.  In the long term this may be more effective.  It cost allot so good luck to you.  In the short term these medicines might benefit some, but the two I have tried seem like they are more likely to shorten life span in long run.  My motto is only get as high as the ceiling and low as the floor.  I could not even cry on Abilify, my eyes slightly watered.  At this point I am trying to see what I can do to obtain life insurance, long term care, and disability insurance.  I am working with my psychiatrist and hoping I can get the nutrition approved.  I am working out 4-6 times a week and changing my diet (I wrestled in college so I feel for those with no work out experience).  Work on 5 year baseline then see what you can do to reduce or find alternative that works for you.  Maybe 3 year baseline with no issues is enough.  Read More Read Less

It's good to know there is a reason that for these past five years after repeated attempts to lose weight there is a reason I always hit a brick wall after getting to a specific weight.  I am currently being taken off the drug (slowly of course) and being put on another.  Hopefully I won't see the side effects on Paxil like on Abilify. Reviews: I take 10mg a day of Abilify and at first I really like it! I felt better, wasn't as sad and I wasn't irritable. I've been on this medication for 2 years now and I am constantly nervous, gained 20 lbs, and I have high cholesterol.

As I write this, I am in the hospital being treated for Stevens-Johnson Syndrome. My psychiatrist and I agreed to try Abilify as an adjunct to the medications I was already taking for a depression that has never been successfully relieved. We decided that I would begin by cutting the 2mg pills in half. After a week my skin began to turn red all over my upper body. The itching was uncontrollable. When my skin began to peel I called my primary, who told me to stop the medication and head for the Emergency Department. I have been in the hospital for nearly two weeks now. Abilify has a propensity to cause SJS. The pain and concomitant itching are almost unbearable, and so I was receiving intravenous morphine, 4mg every two hours, plus steroids. The steroids sent my BP up to 205/100 and my sugar to 393, so I get lots of injections to keep these conditions at bay, esp. hydralazine to drop the BP FAST. Now my skin has finished peeling, except for the soles of my feet. SJS has aspects that are similar to those of a first or second-degree sunburn. It is awful.         Read More Read Less

I started Abilify after several medications, such as Wellbutrin, Zoloft, and Seroquel didn't work.  I have been on 10mg of Abilify for about 5 years, and I take it in addition to 300mg of Lamictal. Abilify is a life saver--I noticed it taking effect after about a week.  The depression lifted, as well as the anxiety. The only problems I have with Abilify are that they cause tremors, especially in my left hand.  I have gained weight over the past few years and though I'm not sure if it was caused by Abilify (since it's been in random spurts), I have been unable to lose the weight, which my doctor thinks is because of this medication. I was also put on Ritalin for ADHD symptoms that Abilify has caused. I don't appreciate the inability to lose weight, or the tremors, or the concentration issues, but hey--I guess it's better than feeling depressed, angry, and suicidal.  I recommend at least giving it a chance. Read More Read Less

After taking a very small dose (.5-1mg)for one  week, without warning one evening my feet & legs swelled to extreme proportions. Believing it was cased by a completly different drug my doctor prescribed for me at the exact same time, I stopped taking that drug & continuted taking the Abilify. Unfortunately, it took another 2 weeks with not only my feet & legs retaining water, but my whole body felt like I was a big water balloon, that I finally realized it was the Abilify! I had by then seen 3 doctors & spoken to my pharmasist, who said they had never heard of Abilify causing this extreme water retention. I'm glad I found this site myself, because afer using compression stockings, keeping off salt, keeping my feet elevated & taking a pill to reduce the fluid retention & stopped taking the Ablify & my legs & feet are finally going back to normal. I will be sure to let the doctors, etc.about this.Read More Read Less

I have had clinical depression my entire life. I have been on antidepressants for 20 year. The med just was not as effective anymore and I was constantly suicidal, having ideations all day long, struggling to not end my life. I started Abilify and it changed my life. Within a couple of days, all suicidal thoughts went away and my depression was gone. I have struggled with fatigue for years, and now, I have much more energy. I can get right out of bed and start my day instead of taking 4 hours moping around drinking coffee to wake up. I feel amazing. I have become the person I have always wanted to be. I am overweight, but have not gained any more weight yet. But I don't care because I do not want to be that person again.Read More Read Less

The Abilify was the only new thing in his menu, routine etc. I took him to his pediatric dentist today and she actually had to laser the sores to ease the pain somewhat. When I called the doctor who prescribed the Abilify  to see if he could be taken off of it cold turkey or did we have to wean it,(still waiting for a reply). Well, my doctor started me on 2mg of Abilify to take with the effexor. So far, I am feeling much better, more energy. My brain has somewhat stopped spinning with all the anxious thoughts. I am a mom of a 17 year old boy that has been struggling with depression, recently turning into very angry outbursts. He has been seeing a doctor and has been on zoloft with little help.  He is a great kid and well liked, but no one was aware of his struggles. At home, there were angry outbursts that included hitting and kicking holes in walls and doors, throwing things.  I was afraid he might hurt himself or someone else, and was afraid to leave him alone.  His doctor switched him from the zoloft to lexapro and 2mg of abilify.  I read through many reviews and was just plain terrified to put him on something like this, but I was also terrified to not put him on it, either.  He is just about 18 and was afraid if he hurt someone, he could get into a great deal of trouble.  He started taking it just this week, and it helped almost immediately.   No outbursts, even when somethings are happening that in the past I would think would spark an issue, and he has been generally in a pleasant mood.  I am so thankful!   Unfortunately, one huge negative is the high price point.  Our doctor provided us with a coupon for a free 30 days supply, and after that a discount of 150 for a 30 day supply, but that will still be tough to absorb.  I am trying to find some other sources to assist with this 800$ per month prescription.  Read More Read Less

Abilify has been part of my medication regime for more then 5 years, and for 20+ years of being over medicated I realized it's a hit or miss game, not necessarily the fault of the psychiatric med provider because their guess is as good as mine. Treatment should be a collaboration and we have the power to make a choice. Back to Abilify; in my experience it has been effective in stabilization, but massive weight gain and difficulty in losing weight has been a big problem in addition to sleeplessness. It is my opinion that it has more anti-depressant qualities, so what time of the day you take it and the milligrams you are on is important. Try tweaking the dosage and timing before you write any medication off, including Abilify. I met with a provider that did a second evaluation of my meds after 20 years of being treated at an unrelated facility. He immediately cut 8 different medications with multiple dosages of each per day down to 3 medications only one of each per day. Abilify is still part of my regime, but taking it at night caused me many sleepless nights and nightly anxiety attacks. I am now taking it during the day and it is sure to work as a great accelerant with balanced moods. Again, you must be AWARE and CAREFUL! YOU are the one ingesting this medication, not your provider! When I see my med provider again, I am going to discuss the reduction in the milligrams of Abilify I take as Abilify packs a big punch. COLLABORATION and PARTICIPATION PEOPLE! I can't stress this enough. I also recommend taking meditation classes or anything that works for you to help calm you and ease your perspective of yourself and life. YOU must take action in ASSISTING your medication therapy. A pill can not heal what ails the spirit. Warmth and Loving-kindness to you all. I hope this helps.   Read More Read Less

I have struggled with Major Depressive Disorder for over 22 years.  I have used several anti-depressants, including Prozac, Paxil, Zoloft, and currently Effexor, all of which gave me some relief but by no means left me feeling balanced.    I started Abilify 5 weeks ago as a supplement to Effexor.  Within one week I began to see improvement.  Within 2-3 there was a remarkable difference.  Now, I can say that I have gone depression and anxiety free for a 30 day period for the first time I can remember. Abilify has been nothing short of a miracle for me.  It is not a happy pill, but it has finally brought me the balance I have been seeking for so long.  I had resigned myself to only feeling a 3 or 4 on a scale of 1-10 permanently.  Before Abilify, I could count on one hand the number of good days I had in a YEAR.  Now, I am consistently an 8 or better.    No matter what people may say, serious major depression is not something you can simply will or think yourself out of. One can not will themselves out of depression anymore than someone can will themselves out of epilepsy.    I am grateful, my family and friends are grateful, and I am pleased to say that the chokehold the dark clouds have had on me for years has finally lifted.I am not so naÃ¯ve as to think that I will never have any valleys going forward.  I am ecstatic that this may no longer be the rule but the exception.Read More Read Less

Yes, I have side effects, slight hand tremors, dizziness, and throat irritation, but for me it is all still worth it!!!!!!!

I would stay on it forever but I will have to wait til it goes generic next year and hopefully I can return to it.

Reviews: Sorry for the sad satisfaction review. I think this is an AMAZING medication and wish I could take it. Unfortunately, I am diabetic and this sends my blood sugar through the roof. After trying several different atypical antipsychotics, I've found that Abilify works the best.  At 30 mg, it helps maintain my mood swings, while also keeping the paranoia and auditory hallucinations down.  I have noticed weight gain with this drug, however, most psychotropics will cause this (so I've just learned to cope with it).  Abilify is an expensive medication, but I find it quite effective and well worth the money.  I don't believe that this drug is right for everyone, but any who experiences bipolar with either manic or mixed episodes where they may relapse into a state of psychosis, should consider this med.  It's a wonderful antipsychotic and mood stabilizer.Read More Read Less

This is the WORST drug I ever took and I actively tell anyone who might consider it not to take it.  The drug completely took me over ... I could not even write, I had tremors, I was like a zombie.  As a result of taking the drug I ended up losing my job, a job I needed desperately.  After only a few weeks, my MD took be off it, but it was a terrible experience.  Friends and family were on the verge of an intervention I was so bad.  My serious advice is that this drug should not be on the market.  And, no I did not feel any less depressed ... probably more anxious if anything.Read More Read Less

I have been on almost every antidepressent medication there is and this one is by far the best. It also worked for me in less then one week.  I highly recomend this to anyone who has depression. I did gain weight, but I don't care I just wanted to stop crying and be myself again.

I was on this on it my Schizopherina for visual and hearing. It was easy for me to take every morning I was on the highest dose there was. And I gained a lot of weight. My hands are a little shaky any way but it made them more shaky and it was bad enough that I couldn't transfer one thing from one pot to another pot with any liquid when I was cooking. Or even pouring something from one cup to another cup it was that bad. I couldn't sweat in the summer I could never cool down and could never get cool. That is one of its major side effects is you can not sweat. And when I got off this medicine and I started sweating again it felt so weird and being able to cool down for after 5 years it was nice. And I got migraines a lot on this medicine too. Because I couldn't get cooled down from the heat and sweat it out and I would suffer and the higher the dose you are on the worse you will not be able to sweat. So over all I didn't and will not take this medication ever ever again. Read More Read Less

I tried sleeping and it was near to impossible.  My legs constantly were moving even if I was sitting.  I began to notice there was an increase in the need to urinate but wasn't able to. only been taking it for 2 weeks,however it has from the start changed my life. for 35 years i have never had anything to work like this.I am very happy with the way i am feeling. my head is clear i have not even been able to do dishes or clean at all for years my family has done what they can but now i have done laundry,dishes i even enjoy cooking i cant wait to get up in the morning.my life has meant nothing and after 35 years of just crawling through i can finally see the rainbow,who knows i might even find the pot of gold at the end.Read More Read Less

Started 2mg doseage of Abilify and felt pretty manic for about five days.  Then I settled back into almost-depression.  I'm supplementing my primary antidepressant Citalopram (Celexa).  Taking the dosage to 5mg Abilify has made no change beyond a certain restlessness.  Side effects noted are weight-gain, carbo-craving, dry mouth at night, and inattention (had two very preventable auto accidents, one minor, one "medium").      Going to step back down to 2mg/pill and then stop the Ability.  That week of mild mania was fun, but there have been no other positives with this very expensive drug.  Read More Read Less

I have been on this medicine for a little over a month and I'm doing lot better.  I take it with my zoloft.  Before I started this new medicine, I didn't want or have the energy to do nothing, even taking care of my bills.  Now, I'm cleaning my house and taking care of my bills,etc.  The only thing I noticed was my hands shake a little.  I also seem to have a dry mouth in the morning.

PLEASE READ ALL> I took Abilify for over a year. After having a son, moving 6x in 4 years (husband in army) I felt myself getting overwhelmed with PPD and Anxiety. The Anxiety was so bad I was not eating, not sleeping and would only stay at home. Abilify was great at 1mg/day. When my doctor felt like I was not making enough progress she upped my dosage. This equated to 35 pounds in 5 months. I was 5"2, 120 pounds. I literally ballooned up so big (mostly in my face and lower abdomen) so quick that most of my friends, relatives even my husband(!) thought I was pregnant again. As a previous sufferer of anorexia and bulemia I began to panic. My anxiety increased so much because of my weight it is hard to describe. For example: if my kids left food on their plates I HAD to eat it. I was obsessed with eating. Additionally, all I did was drink AND RETAIN water. If my husband expressed his concerns I would fly into a rage and eat more. It got to the point where my normal activities (cleaning, laundry, long distance running-my hobby) were near impossible. I began gaining fat that was hanging over my knees, making it difficult to maneuver. Finally I saw my regular (non-pysc) doctor. I saw her after running five miles, THEN DRINKING ONE BOTTLE OF WATER. My face was so swollen that my neck barely fit into my shirt. My doctor did research and blood work and immediately advised me to discontinue use of the Abilify. In three weeks since not taking Abilify I lost 8 pounds. In 4 weeks 12 pounds. I can now run again. The ONLY downside to discontinuing the medication is the emotions and feelings of instability I feel. Read More Read Less

This has worked really well to get my depression under control BUT I want to eat everything starting at noon when I take my pill till I go to bed. I'm so hungry!!! It really sucks cause I've tried them all and this is the only one that has helped plus it's so expensive too. Calling my Doc. and telling him when there gone I'm done. I also didn't know that it would make me crave food like I'm doing.

I was given this medicine, after a severe cerebral artery occlusion with cerebral artery infaract at the ER. After my 3rd scan, & still in worse pain ever, i ask the 3 ER doctors what r you doing! All i want is oxygen! Not 1 knew protocal for oxygen therapy, & finally agreed to give me 1.5 liters! I had to speak up, & tell them i needed 7-10 liters. The last thing i remember was they all laughing at me, & giving me a cath. Finally i passed out or went into coma? Next day woke up?, & was in mental ward. My neurolist never even showed up! So these 2 nutty proffesor spychietrist pit me on Abilify, & i lost my ability to walk right, then lost my vsion into triple vision, then next day color changes on computor screen. Luckily i ws on steroids, & i helped myself to oxygen 24/7. My blood pressure drop to 69/59. Also ended up with droopy eyelid, & optive nerve damage, cateracts, & good candidate for glacoma. Took myself off of this crap. I call hosp. back, 7 they told me to do it for judt 2 more weeks. I told them , NO!, U  saw what it ws doing to me! Later, i keep getting sick, first with ear infection, that i think ws accoustic neuroma, was pretty painful where pain med. not work. Flies were hovering around me, waiting fr me to die!(took photos) I look over at my oxygen, & turn it on to 6 liters. 2.5 days i was able to go to store n get fly traps. Also got neuroma. Swelling everywhere, especially in ankles, & my eyes. Go to 1 of top hosp. in the USA, & my PC. Told them i was crazy!(never mention i had a stroke, or 2 heart attacks) So they hold me down(not forcable), but made big mistake, & gave me 3 injections of haloperoladol. 2 weeks later start getting really sick, & i lose my short term memory really bad, still getting worse, but now i notice my other eye going blind. If i wait like 2 hours, have to lay down.(falling asleep every 2 hours. If i fight this, i will dream with my eyes open, just like 1st stroke. My 14yr old daughter who has Autism, mental retardation and is totally blind with self abusive behaviors has had decreased irritability and anxiety with an increased happier mood. I have been on Viibryd for almost a year was doing good til about 4 months ago, went to dr less than a month ago and was given Abilify, it has turned me around and happier. no thoughts of suicide and I have interests now. OMG.  It made my extremeties jerk suddenly.  I also developed anxiety out the wahzoo.  I was suddenly afraid of driving, which I had to do no matter what, so I spent a lot of time on the road with white knuckles.  I was afraid to merge, afraid of merging cars, afraid to drive too fast.    On top of that, it affected my NIGHT VISION.  I had just bought a new car with darker shaded windows at the time, so I thought it was the windows, but even the ones in front seemed hard to see out of.      At one time, I was driving into a nearby down on shiny wet asphalt roads.  The streetlights were shining on a hill that I was about to ascend after a red light. Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I started taking this medication in 2011, and with it came a 40-lb weight gain...talk about depressing!

I do believe the Abilify did help (mixed with antidepressant) with the severe depression.  But, when I began taking Abiliby I immediately began gaining weight (with no change in eating habits or exercise).  I gained 70 lbs in 1 yr.  When I expressed my concerns and being horrified at the weight gain to my Dr.   He said, it could not have anything to do with the Abilify.  Then, because of a change of insurance companies - I had to switch Primary Care Dr. And as he looked my list of meds over he said, did you know there is a pound in every pill of Abilify? I said, "I knew it"!!!  He took me off it and I have lost 40lbs - (with no change in diet or exercise) in the last 4 mons.  Also disturbing , is the cost is OUTRAGEIOUS, and my ins. does not cover it, and I am a widow on a fixed income. Read More Read Less

for the last 3 days...im beside myself....but don't wa nt to do anything....its very unconforable....I wanna jump out of my skin...jump off back of golf court...just for fun.....I stopped taking it two days ago...im still ancy....but not near as much...I keep running or walking , anytype of exercise.  what I believed helped me, in my last episode of manic depression...was getting answers from my doctors, and I had no doctor, actually.....didn't know what to do with me...I DIDNT KNOW....I HAD PINWORMS AT  THE TIME....try proving THAT AT THE SAME TIME...THEY THOUGHT I WAS CRAAZY....I WQAS SEEEING THINGS....I HAVE PICTURES...DOCUMENTS.......THEYDID NOT KNOW WHAT THETY WERE DOING,THEREFORE, I HAD TO DO MY OWN HOMEWORK....SHEEEEEEESH...........PARASITES ARE SO MUCH FUN..Read More Read Less

Out of nine other drugs to accompany my paxil, seroquel, and depakote; Only this one had wonderous effects for my mood, got me up and moving, positive, exercising, etc, with no apparent side effects and even reduced the negative side effects of the regimen I was on; stopped trembling, thinking and focusing clearer (for the first time since my thyrotoxicosis 4 yrs ago) much stabler, and most of all, I feel so much more in control of myself... wonderful!

I had a manic episode in 2012 and I am now in remission. I'm now on 2.5 mg of Abilify only (no other meds). It seems to be working fine for me, but I did gain 20 lbs on it. Avoid it if you can, but take it if you must.

I feel like this drug helped save my life. I take a very low dose(2.5mg) 5 nights per week. I take other antidepressants and mood stabilizers but the addition of ability is what really has helped my bipolar II stay in remission. I felt the benefits from it almost instantly, just 30 minutes after taking the first pill. I have no side effects.

Then I learned Medicare pays $683 to the drug-maker for this poison. Apparently, my doctor needed me on this drug to pay for the mags on his Porsche. Do NOT take this poison!

I have gained 50 lbs in just a couple of months time. This is all water weight gain. I stopped taking Abilify 4 wks ago and still have swelling and hot flashes. Not sure how long it takes to get this med. out of your system, but it is sure taking it's sweet time with me.

I started Abilify to augment the Effexor XR 300mg I have been taking for past 10+ years. Prior to the Abilify, I was in such a deep depression I did not cook, clean or even shower daily. I was angry most of the time. Stayed in my house unless I HAD to go out. Major anxiety, panic attacks were a routine part of my life. My psyche doctor suggested Abilify a year ago, but I was so afraid of all the potential side effects, I delayed trying it. Finally decided something HAD to change in my life. Started it about 4 weeks ago. The 4th day after I started it, I woke up and actually was excited about living again. Had energy, motivation, wanted to go out of the house and became interested in life again.  Now the downside. Am taking only 2mg and am restless, feel like I am manic, am not sleeping more than 4 hrs a night (broken into 2 2hr intervals)Starting to feel like a walking zombie. Difficulty doing simple tasks like balancing my checkbook. I have a position which requires critical thinking and I feel afraid that I won't be able to think clearly and make the right decision. Worst is the sleeplessness. When I started abilify, I was told to take it a night. I did and woke up with no depression, but felt like I was "electrified". Paced, went from one task to the other without really accomplishing anything because my mind was racing. Switched it to taking in the morning to help with the insomnia and saw no difference in the restlessness, talking too much, etc.  Love the overall effect it has on my depression and mood, but after 4 weeks of little to no sleep I am considering going off of it. Paging the MD in the a.m. to see what he recommends. Also noticed extreme thirst and dry mouth and frequent urination. Am asking for bloodwork to r/o diabetes.Read More Read Less

Have been suffering from major depression, PTSD and anxiety for 8 years. Have been on everything, nothing was working. I was on Cymbalta and Lexapro the longest(years),then with Abilify for a 6 month time period. Abilify (10mg) DID increase anxiety for me, but no weight gain.  Side effects were slight tremors and dark urine. Instead of going back to the doctor, I stopped taking it. Then in 2010, I stopped taking everything, but 1mg of Xanax at night. All the side effects went away. About 2 weeks ago, in desperation of not living life anymore, I found my remaining pills and started taking one a day (10mg). After 4 days, it was amazing. I was actually getting a few normal things done again. The tremors are back though, a little more than the last time I took it, so today I only took .5mg and have had very little shaking, but still feel good. No weight gain, yet. Matter of fact, I am losing a little, (no exercise). However, I go to my doctor next Wednesday, so will find out if taking this is ok with nothing but a Xanax at night, which by the way helps with sleeping. I read a review that someone was taking 15mg! That is WAY TOO HIGH!. PLEASE DO NOT AKE THIS WITHOUT YOURR DOCTOR'S APPROVAL FIRST. DON'T DO WHAT I DID. I ALSO TAKE A COUPLE OF TRAMADOL FOR SEVERE ARTRITIS PAIN AS NEEDED AND I HAVE NO IDEA IF TAKING THESE TWO TOGETHER IS HARMFUL. I WILL FIND OUT THOUGH.  I am praying that I can continue this in a small dosage. This has felt so good for a change. If I can continue,and no other side effects develop or the tremors do not get worse, I will feel blessed to actually be a part of life again, not just an onlooker!                     Read More Read Less

I was prescribed this for C-PTSD.  Seroquel worked VERY well for me, but if situational stress increased, I couldn't increase Seroquel due to mental acuity affects at a higher dose.  My doc thought Abilify might be helpful, instead.  Day 1 - nothing.  Felt like I was back to where I was.  Day 2 - agitated, very hungry, and felt a rage that was barely controlled (rage is very unlike me).  Day 3 - feeling almost like the "I hate Mondays" gal who shot up a school yard.  I realized, with the help of my wife and a friend that this was NOT okay, even in a transient sense.  Quit taking it and it took 3 days to return to some semblance of normalcy.  Back on Seroquel.  Abilify is WORSE than nothing.  In fact, I consider it poison.  They should consider using it for chemical warfare.Read More Read Less
I took this medication for my depression and it helped alot better than Zoloft.

This medication ended up putting me in the hospital. It was supposed to add a stabilizing effect to my current medications. I ended up trying to commit suicide and was admitted to the hospital because of this medication. It is not recommended for children under 18, and now I know why.

I have been on abilify for about 6-7 weeks.  I noticed an improvement in my energy and motivation in 1 week.  I have not that this much energy in 10 years.  I use this medication with Effexor which I have been on for 6 years for depression.  I do have a side effect of like a heat flush over my body and then my hands start to tremble. Actually, I am not sure if it is from this drug or another medication I've started.  Everyone is different.  If the medication works for you, great!  If it doesn't, consult your doctor.  Like everything, it doesn't work for everyone.Read More Read Less

Abilify is a horrible drug and my Doc is an idiot.  He had me on 60 (yes 60) mg of Abilify and 450 mg of Wellbutrin.  Each 150 mg of Wellbutrin increase the effect of abilify ~50%.  You do the math.  I should sue this Doc for gross negligence and possibly damaging my liver.  DO NOT TAKE ABILIFY AND WELLBUTRIN! Of course I tapered the Wellbutrin to 0 mg and quit the abilify.  The 3/4" deep pitting from Edema in my lower legs attributed to venous insufficiency went entirely away when I quit Abilify.  The anxiousness and restlessness and sleeplessness went entirely away when I quit Abilify.  I now treat my serious bipolar I with dialetical behavior therapy and CBT.  These seem to be for the past four months far more effective than the medications.  The medications are a bandaid.  The DBT and CBT are ways you get guided teaching to act and not react and accept who you are for what you are.  Moreover you learn you have choices and you can with the help of a therapist that is well trained in DBT and CBT to survive happily and not kill yourself wit these dangerous drugs.  BTW.  Abilify resulted in a 80lb weight gain in 5 years or so, I became prediabetic, and could not sleep.  When I quit I lost 48 lbs in 5 months.  I only have 32 lbs to go!!! I sleep like a baby now.  I have been in remission from BP I for nearly 9 - 10 years.  After quitting the meds there has been no relapse with the DBT and CBT therapy.  Read More Read Less

initial dose of 10 mg, gave me very vivid, destructive thoughts immediately upon use.  Re-started at 1/2 mg, and slowly increased to 2 mg. This was in adjunct to Cymbalta 60 mg x 2.  This allowed me to return to work.  The side affects of increasing blood sugar and triglycerides were also immediate, and so difficult to control, and so affected my physical health, that it affected my work performance and had to go on disability.  Even after stopping Abilify, the physical affects appear permanent and very difficult to treat.  At the same time, while I was on Abilify, I had not found a drug that was so effective at controlling symptoms of panic, anxiety, clearer thinking, self-worth and the knowledge I still have something to contribute to life.  Since being off Abilify, I have not been able to hold down a full or part time job.    It is obvious to me that there is some kind of neurotransmitter dysfunction, but even the pharmacological industry does not understand the mechanism of interaction on the neurotransmitters or why it does have an positive affect, or the negative effect on the endocrine system so many users have experienced.  An interesting drug, wished it could have worked for me, instead of being more disabled both emotionally and physically.  Research into why brain injuries, even concussions can cause metabolic syndrome, the same way mood stabilizer drugs affects metabolism. Maybe there is a correlation between the two, which could lead to safer, effective medication management.Read More Read Less
This medication has been an integral part of my treatment regimen. My moods have been very stable on Abilify.
I took this in 2009 because I was depressed and I got dizzy and threw up.

Within half an hour of swallowing the Abilify, which was right before bedtime as prescribed, my sinuses would close up so I literally could not breathe. When I closed my eyes, I would see weird, swirling patterns and colors and - I know this sounds odd - felt as if my brain was being sucked into a black hole. I had no problems with hallucinations before this. Once I stopped taking the medication, these terrifying problems stopped.

I felt great on Abilify but I gained almost 30 lbs in a year.  Had I kept taking it my weight would have just kept going up.  It's too bad to have such a wonderul feeling but to have to quit the med because of a bad side effect.

Just started my first Abilify regimen and I am already seeing signs of feeling alive again.  I have only been on it for about a week, but if this drug is working already, I will be ecstatic. Fingers crossed!!

This medication precipitated migraines, seizures and at least one stroke.  I have memory loss, excessive weight gain (40 pounds) confusion and agitation.  Involuntary muscle movements, wierd facial expressions, lip smacking, personality change as well.  I do not feel that this medication should be used without large warnings.  The problems far outweigh any benefit.
It didn't help me i gained 117 pounds in about 4-5 months. I dont think i have bipolar but i was prescribed it anyway.

After trying different anti-depressants for my severe major depression, doc prescribed Abilify in addition to Wellbutrin.     I woke up on the 4th day of taking it, and almost jumped out of bed, whereas before I could never get myself out of bed. I was happy! I couldn't wait to get to work.     This drug has been, literally, a life-saver. I didn't have any major side effects, and haven't gained weight.

i took abilify with lexapro i gained so much weight i felt out of it in a fog i was so medicated and continued gaining weight i think my doctor should of changed treatment after 20lbs but did not weight gain adds to the depression DO NOT TAKE ABILIFY

Abilify has literally saved my life.  I have been misdiagnosed with depression and anxiety disorder when I was 15.  I tried committing suicide 3 times with almost 2 successes just because I couldn't handle the depression anymore.  I found a wonderful psychiatrist who really took the time to work with me and now I am diagnosed with Bipolar disorder.  I am currently on 5mg of Abilify with 250mg of Lamictal and I never felt better!
wasnt sure how to update already posted side effects but also had lightheadness a lot of tha times when id stand up or even while standing

not really sure what to say or how to rate this medication, for it was tha first pill i took when i first got diagnosed with schizophirnia, i didnt hear voices or have any halutionations, no need to git into detail of how i got diagnosed, but after taken this med. in a mental hospital for a couple of months an returnin i figured i didnt need it since i really had no symptoms of tha voices or seein things, and after i stopped takein it is when i started to hear voices, so really not sure how to rate this or what it did for me or even to meRead More Read Less

This medication is toxic.  I stopped taking it two months ago, and am experiencing hot flashes, muscle twitches, swollen tongue and headache.  Not recommended!!!
Too soon to tell. Only on it for one week.

I keep trying to review this drug abilify, but it is hard because the fingertips and toes on the right side of my body are numb.  I forgot to take abilify over the weekend and noticed feeling coming back to my fingertips and toes, so I stopped the drug.  Each day more feeling comes back.  It is mostly on my right side but was beginning to m0ove to my left fingers.  Doctors were baffled.  It's the abilify.  It is not worth it.  The first time I tried it a few years ago I nearly lost my vision.  No one connected the dots.  It was not until after I stopped taking it over a period of months did my vision return to normal.  Do not take this drug.  It makes you feel better in the beginning then y9ou have side effects that make you think something is medically wrong.  I pray I get full feelinmg back in my toes and fingers.  I can hardly type as I can't feel the keyboard.  Read More Read Less

I started taking abilify a long time ago along with some other depression meds.  The med was expensive, so had a discount card to help pay for it.  The discount card had expired so i decided to stop taking it in the summer when lmy depression is not as bad.  Since stopping abilify I have lost 40 lbs and feel better.  while on abilify I was also diagnosed with type 2 diabeties, another reason I stopped taking this drug.

Was given as a helper to my Lamictal for bi-polar, manic depressive dis. Worst drug ever, within days, I went from bad to worse! Thoughts of hurting myself were no more-they were actions! Scared myself, my husband, and my young children-this stuff was bad news!
weight gain.

Abilify 1 mg was added to Lamictal 400 mg and after about 2-3 months I started feeling less depressed than only on Lamictal. And I have only had 1 migraine in 9 months!  I used to have migraines 2-3 per month. I will now start tapering the Lamictal down and the Ability up.
I am experiencing no sex drive

I have been taking 15 mg of abilify for one month. It was added because Cymbalta wasn't helping my depression. Within 3 weeks I had gained 10 lbs!! And I am so antsy and fidgety, I feel like I am going crazy. I can't sit for more than 5 minutes at a time. I have to get up and walk around. Then I get bored and try to sit again. It is an endless cycle. This med does not work for me at all!
THIS MEDICINE HAS BEEN GOOD FOR ME EXCEPT FOR THE WEIGHT GAIN.
This drug hugely intensified my anxiety to the point where I wanted to die, and I started to become suicidal when I never have before.

This medication has caused uncontrolable "jerking" when sleeping. It has also caused a sleep disorder that I did not have before taking this drug. I could not stay awake and was falling asleep while working and actually talking to people. I would also fall asleep while driving. I now HAVE to take a drug to keep me awake during the day. And I only took it for a very short time and I "felt" as though I just had to stop taking it. My whole body hurt - all over in all of my joints. i've been getting a lot of headaches and nausea and i wasn't sure what was causing them.  abilfy can cause both.

I had tried, lithium, Risperdal, Depakote & they never worked but Abilify actually works for my anxiety, depression & most of all -Borderline Personality Disorder (from childhood trauma) which they say meds don't help, well that is NOT true because I am finally the person, daughter, mother & wife I have always wanted to be. I actually stop & think rationally in negative situations, when I used to react inappropriately with anger & then regret what I said or my actions. I am happy for the first time in my life. A Dr. prescribed it to me about 4rs ago & I guess it was fairly new & I did not have insurance at the time so it was going to be $425 (too expensive) for a months supply & didn't get it & that is one of the biggest mistakes of my life so far. I have been on 5mg for 2 months (with other meds that I have been on for years) but it was not until the Abilify that everything changed.Read More Read Less

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: This medication turned my life around. I'd probably be in jail right now had I not taken abilify.

After taking Abilify, I experienced Acute dystonic reactions(contractions of the tongue, face, neck, and back) and oculogyric crisis(eyes locked upward). I can't begin to describe how terrifying those experiences were for me. My mom had to drive me to the emergency room because I was having these 'episodes' too frequently. I thought I was epileptic or something, but turned out it was from Abilify. I couldn't believe my psychiatrist never once mentioned the side effects associated with Abilify. As a nurse take my advice and check the side effects before taking a drug. Sometimes the risks outweighs the benefits. Read More Read Less
I will say I WAS satisfied until my friends and family told me I was like a zombie and would just walk slow and basically seemed "mentally impared" It may have been too much of a dose.

My mom passed away in April 2012 and I had been her care giver for 7 years.  I thought I was doing pretty good until about two weeks ago when I just couldn't get it together. I couldn't stop crying and I just wanted to curl up in a ball.  My counselor said I was in such a depressed state that I needed to see my doctor.  He started me on abilify 5 mg. and it's been 10 days and I can't believe how wonderful I feel.  More energy than I've had in 8 mos and back to my fun loving self.  I do have a problem sleeping, but I take xanax at night and that seems to do the trick and celexa in the mornings for anxiety.  Thank youRead More Read Less

Abilify gave me hand tremors that persisted even after I stopped the drug. Psych then prescribed saphris which works very well for me, but I only take it at night because it's very sedating. It's corrected my sleep/awake cycle. I fall asleep in 15-30 minutes,get up 8-9 am. and stay awake all day. Give it a try--it may work for you.

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed

Easy to take. Has helped with severe deppression.

I started with 5mg, then 10mg and at last 15mg.  At that stage the tremors were so bad that I could not sign my name.  It help me with my maniac episodes of compulsive shopping but I had to stop it because of the Tardive Dyskinesia.

Prescribed 5mg daily and took for a month.  No effect or side effect noticeable so we discontinued it.  One time I took 25mg to see if it would still be ineffective.  Very tired the rest of the day.  Not really a lowered mood, but tired and more unmotivated than usual.  Overall, Abilify was ineffective for me in the little time I was taking it. my wife was prescribed abilify for depression and it has been the worst thing see has ever been throughshe has not lept in over a week has the worst case of restlessness i have ever seen she cannot sit or lay down for more than 10min without havng to get up and walk around the house which doesn't sound to bad until you add in the fack of extream panic attacks and no sleep for a week.then you basiclly get a zombie walking around who's having hallucinations and freaking out because she no longer knows what day it is or whats going on.she and i both agree that we wouldn't wish this on our worst enemy.for the people it helps you are lucky but for us it has been the worst experience of our lives and it's not even over yet this is day 8 and she hasn't taken it in 5 days and the side effects have not let up yet.i cannot leave her alone because i'm worried she might kill herself to get relief from this.if you are thinking about this medicine please follow all other possibilities first you may end up with more problems than you started withRead More Read Less

I am now on day 7 of starting Abilify in addition to my long term Zoloft 150mg of 10 years. The Zoloft wasn't as effective as it used to be, so the Abilify is being used as an adjunct.  So far so good and, as expected, I am getting a few minor side effects that i am monitoring like a hawk!  So, I have been taking 1mg up until last night when I (under psychiatrists direction) took 2mg. He wants to slowly up it until we feel it is effective for my depression -- oversleeping, zero motivation, indecision, low productivity. So far so good, the side effects I had experienced from about day 3 to day 6 have almost completely gone (headache, dizzyness, little bit of drowsiness).  I did develop a little bit of hand tremor if i really look for it when i hold out my hand.  On the positive side my motivation has increased some, my indecision has improved a bit, and i have no need to nap in addition to a 10 hour nights sleep!  I think I have a ways to go in terms of improvement, but its been a good start. I will post again in a few days and if interested you can view my post of Nov. 10th.  Good luck.  From, huck   Read More Read Less

I was on Abilify for over a year as an adjunct to my anti-depression medication.  It worked well and was effective.  Then I started getting a lot of symptoms that were diagnosed as Parkinson's.  I was taken off of the drug (not easy thing for me) and it left me with a tremor in my hands (particularly the right hand) and some gait problems.  The neurologist I see now prescribed a beta blocker for the tremors and they are much improved.  We are still working on the gait. Make sure you understand the side effects before making the decision to take Abilify. Read More Read Less

makes me able to concentrate  trouble sleeping stay awake longer then i usually do, normally i require 8 hrs of sleep, now i am staying up later and getting 2-3 hrs less sleep.  slight trembling feeling
