I am a little drowsy with the 1 mg of Abilify so will start taking it at bedtime versus in the morning.  Already I have a bit more energy, so we'll see.  Hopeful, but cautious.

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: From the reviews, people either love or hate abilify. For me, it wasn't very effective and it gave me the "shakes." I even had a respected neurologist diagnose me with Parkinson's. After going off the drug for a month, went back to the neurologist who then said I didn't have Parkinson's (because the hand shaking decreased)but had essential tremor-a slight shake that is difficult, but harmless. I notice it most when I'm trying to hold something still, like a phone receiver or papers. Still, I went through a month of worrying about having Parkinson's and I didn't have shaky hands before Abilify. Try this med cautiously. It might work for you, but it was bad for me.Read More Read Less

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I went from 5mg to 20mg over the course of 1 month. It worked just fine at 15 mg except I had a depressed mood in general. When increased to 20mg I had a very bad reaction to it. Increased mania, high fever, muscle aches and stiffness, severe dizziness, prickly, painful sensation over my entire body, every symptom listed under the "allergic reaction" warnings basically. I was confused because I was on 10mg for over a year (2010-2011), and did just fine. I have been off the 20mg for 2 days but am still having the "dizzy spells" where every 5-10 mins I get that "headrush" feeling. I even spent several hours in the ER this morning trying to explain these effects to doctors who wouldn't take me seriously. My opinion: A bad medication in high doses.Read More Read Less

Spent my days trying to get out of bed for a long time, the last 3mths. had worsend till I'd just cry while even taking a shower. No shopping, no cooking. Lost, at least, 40lbs. laying in bed! So, yeah I was down. Within taking Abilify for 4 days, I began to notice a change. I could stay up for longer periods of time. Then by week two, I was actually "wanting" to do housework, stay up, talk to my family again! My doctor had tried several other meds, but nothing worked. She kept trying and I grew more depressed, thinking there was no hope any longer. So, to those of you who feel like there's nothing that can work for you, please at least ask your doctor about this medication. Don't know how long I'll be on it, because it is very expensive without insurance. But, right now, I'm blessed to be helped with being able to take it!   As far as side effects.....the main thing I've noticed is that I get fidgety for a few hours, but if I get up and do some more work or a hobby, I don't notice it so much! I've been severely depressed for 3 yrs. now. So, yes, this is a God send to which I thank Him for.Read More Read Less

I had a bad reaction to Lexapro and this was my doctor's solution. If the purpose of this was to make me physically depressed without the mental symptoms of depression, then it worked. Once I figured out that my sleeplessness, nightmares, lack of motivation, overeating, alcohol craving, apathy was how I feel when I get depressed, I REALLY got depressed mentally too. I think these are side effects of this medication. They are reminders to me of being depressed. If you feel like that when you are depressed you might want to pay careful attention to how you are feeling and check your weight at least once per week. I gained 2 inches around my waist in 45 days. I don't have a scale.    I am now taking Latuda and that had an immidiate positive effect on my brain. I have seen testamonials from Ability users saying the same thing.Read More Read Less

The abilify helps me stay focused and helps to decrease my episodes of "manicky" behavior like shopping online charging up all my credit cards. The dr. seems to believe I am bi-polar lond with my depression and anxiety.

I was in shape and eating right when I began taking it. I ended up unfocused in this weird starving and uncomfortably hungry state with a swollen salivating tongue, gained 20lbs in 4 weeks! I broke down and began to cry at the point I realized I could't deal with the side effects any longer. This is yet another 'miracle' antipsychotic that was DOA.

I suffer from Depression, Anxiety, and a horrific mood disorder. Taking for mood disorder and depression with Effexor XR. Definitely helped mood disorder, may be helping depression w/other med but cannot tell. My moods do not fluctuate as much and I don't rage any more. Taking 4 mg in a.m. daily. Noticed that I cannot tolerate  heat in summer and sweat horrifically. Even if I hydrate myself, seems I sweat even more.  Always feel hotter than before taking Abilify. It's a small price to pay tho for a med that helps my mood disorder.  I had no side effects, but am not one to ever get side effects from meds. Maybe a little dizziness at first, but I know that one must take a medication for some time for the side effects to diminish and go away.  DO NOT STOP TAKING THIS MED W/O YOUR DOCTOR'S INSTRUCTIONS. Have heard of many who just stop this med cold turkey and have all kinds of problems.  Always follow your doctor's instructions and discuss any side effects with them also.  I feel 100% better mood-wise after being on this  medication.Read More Read Less
it does not make me as tired as do other anti-pschotics.  \

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: Started off on low dose after years of trial and error with other meds (lithium, Epival, Risperidone).  Within the first week on 2mg my melancholic depression dissapeared and my episodes became less mixed.  The only thing is that while my body was getting used to the drug I would feel quite restless in the morning after taking it and that was on 4 mg.  I'm now on 15mg (with very few symptoms) and have little to no side effects whatsoever.  That said, I don't think you should try this drug right away. There are lots of other drugs to try first.  It's just that it's expensive and very powerful(I'm lucky I'm covered). That said, if you try it and it doesn't work for you you shouldn't knock it, because like all drugs it works for some people and doesn't work for others.  It all depends on how your body metabolizes the ingredients.Read More Read Less

I've been on Abilify for 2-3 years. It dosen't really seem to work as well as Lithium as I was on Lithium prior to Abilify. It may be the drug for bipolar, but I still don't trust it. It can trigger diabetes and tardive diskenesia or something like that. I don't like these risky side effects. I still have breakthrough episodes although they are mild, I still don't want to experience them. Considering going back to Lithium as a mood stabilizer. Drug is too risky in high doses.
I feel the drug helps me in general. I don't  notice any side effects. I take t he drug with other drugs.It combats anxiety and DEpression.
this drug caused complete body tremors in which could only be controlled by anaesthesia the outcome...death

I think this medicine is helping me with my depression. The one thing that I cannot stand is the uncontrollable foot tremors. I feel like I constantly have to move my feet or else. Also, I have an increased appetite which as someone who suffered from an eating disorder I do not like.

I have been taking between 2.5 and moved up to 5mg of Abilify over the past month. i am very pleaed with the motivation and enjoyment of life that it has helped bring back. My only problem is that I am very restless and have to get up and move around a lot. This occurred at 2.5mg as well as 5mg with no difference in degree of restlessness. Good luck everyone!Read More Read Less

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: Was on it 8 yrs along with lexapro/celexa  gained a TON of weight. I was up to 15 mg a day and when I would complain about the weight doc said I was depressed and increased that med.  Switched docs, got off that crap about 5 months ago. Dropped from 200lbs to 160 in that time. I am now having issues with my PTSD and flashbacks/night terrors but my biggest issue was I slept all the time on abilify and I had tardive dyskensia, flat affect, no emotion at all. I couldn't deal with things while on it and have gone through with feeling angry that I did not deal with things as they occurred as it all came flooding back.  On saphris now for about 2 weeks.  Horrible tasting but I see a huge difference. Moods are stable, more outgoing, get things done, etc. Bad thing about saphris is it tastes very bad( sublingual) and my mouth is sore. I take it while in bed cause it knocks me out so quick. But I sleep normal, no night terrors, and I am generally in a decent mood in the morning instead of crabby.  I am a certified peer specialist and a social worker and I know everyone responds differently but I defiantly would not recommend ability unless it's your last resort.  Only plus about it for me was it surpressed all the childhood trauma memories and I am working on that now.Read More Read Less

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: My husband took this drug for bi-polar disorder. He began to think people on tv were talking to him. He forgot who I was, even that we were married. He absolutely could not function. He was awake night and day, requiring almost no sleep. I have known at least three other patients who had the same sort of side effects from this med. I would warn patients to avoid it, and caregivers to prepare for a siginificant loss of sleep!

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: gave me tardive dyskinsia
abilify, in the past, has helped my depression.  but, i've come to find out that i have developed type 2 diabetes, having to use to meds. and diet to control it.?

First off, my main complaint for Abilify is it is ridiculously expensive.  I had to beg samples from my PsychD for a while because she insisted I stay on it, but had no insurance.  At first it seemed like it was the perfect drug, but after a couple weeks I had to knock the dose from 5mg to 2.5 mg (just broke them in half)  It made me hyper and edgy at 5mg, and I had nerve and joint pain.  After time, even the 2.5mg made me edgy if I took it daily.  Another doc added Zoloft 50mg and it seemed to help.  I had insurance for a while from my job, but ended up losing it once again, so I tried to get OFF the Abilify, and ended up in the hospital, after being on it for over a year.  If taken alone, I had to take it at maximum every other day, then add Cymbalta, and I had to take it EVERY day with that to counter the effects of the Cymbalta.  It's just been a screwed up ride.  All told, I was on the Abilify for almost 4 years.  Once again without insurance, I can't afford it, can't take it more than 1-2x a week or I get edgy and nasty, so doc has switched me off of it.  It can be an amazing aid when combined with something else but watch your blood sugar, and your weight.  I gained 60 pounds while on it, and it is nigh impossible to get back off.  Read More Read Less

My husband suffers from major depression.  His doctor added this, and increased the dose over two years.  Everybody PLEASE note how they've changed Abilify's commercials and the warnings.  There's a reason for this!!! My husband has now been weaned off this drug and may be facing permanent disability.  His therapist tells me she warns all her patients against using it.

I took this to help with depression. Like many have said, it changed my life and I finally felt motivated to do things, and it gave me energy to get up and get going in the a.m. The PROBLEM (very important here) was that I developed uncontrollable foot tremors and then tremors in my right jaw.  Toes clenching and jaw clenching.  Went off of it, but still have it.  This is PERMANENT.  Don't use this drug!

It feels odd to review a drug, but I have had such a positive experience with this one I thought I should share it. I have tried many different combinations of meds to treat my depression and hypomanic episodes. I have finally found a combination that works for me, and it was Abilify that changed my life in the most profound way. It was as if I had been looking through things through a dirty window my whole life, and all of a sudden it was clear as day. I feel capable of doing things I had been previously intimidated by. I am on other medications that are equally important to my symptom management. I just happened to be especially impressed with how easy this drug was to take, and how quickly and effectively it improved my quality of life. Read More Read Less

Added Abilify to Cymbalta to replace Geodon, because I continued to have urges to hibernate and overeat, missing 20-25 hours of work per month. Abilify worked very well, but as a diabetic it raised my A1c from 6.9 to 9.7 and I gained over 50 lbs in 6 months despite remaining on my diabetic regimen. Insulin needs skyrocketed and insulin resistance stayed high for over 9 months after discontinuance; A1c now finally back to 7.1 as of 4/2012. Psychiatrist replaced Abilify with 20mg of Adderall which I take at 6am with great effects, no jitters and no addictive feelings (but still sleep all day if I don't take it). I've been prescibed this medicine for anxiety. I was taking clonazapam but did not want to be adicted or develop a tolerance. Zoloft and other anti-depressants made me nervous and gave me tremors. This drug, while helping reduce anxiety, has increased my energy level to the point where I've doubled my workout (intense bicycle exercise, 30 miles every other day) and have a lot of spare energy.      Caffeine doesn't seem to affect me, but I have almost too much energy. I sleep less, work more, do more physical work. I eat more, up to 3k calories a day (I monitor myself) and still lost weight and size.     I feel like I'm jumping over things, looking at things symbolically at times. Example: where things I type make sense even though mispelled. I've never been diagnosed with any of the reasons this drug is prescribed for; this is a test by my doctor and it seems to work out.     But instead of nervous energy it seems as though my physical energy levels have increased ten-fold.     I do not take any other drugs nor drink alcohol at all and am very active physically. My blood pressure at a rest after walking is 130/70's, heart rate is higher than normal while at rest but during workouts is average (70% of 220-my age).     I am still debating the overall effectiveness but willing to go for 3 months on this drug to see if it works for my anxiety.Read More Read Less

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: Abilify's use 2X in my life hasn't at all been the answer for my daily regimen of medication treatment. It like other newer anti-psychotics might bring about a clearer sense of conscious awareness; but for me the side effects are so aggravating and difficult to handle that another anti-psychotic with less side effects, was well worth making the switch. I now take Seroquel XR 200mg nightly. All anti-psychotic meds can cause weight gain and I've just about been prescribed everyone of them at different intervals. Having bipolar 1 disorder which in my case the manic stage is more prevalent does not allow for meds that would be prescribed for depression(i.e. Prozac, Zoloft, etc.). " Different strokes for different folks" is the bottom line in all medicinal treatments! June 2012 will mark 40 years of known dealing with manic-depression and even longer with anxiety issues; I'm 54 now. There's always hope; don't give up. It's the sign of a Champion to keep on keeping on. I wish I could have been of more help to whomever reads this. Have a great day!            Read More Read Less

Two separate times I've been prescribed Abilify 20mg or more per day for Bipolar I Disorder as an anti-psychotic and for mood swings.     This medication caused me much extreme high anxiety both times. Already having some issues of social anxiety, inherited tremor, and some tremor possibly induced by years of medicinal treatment for differing aspects of manic-depression, I really was at a severe disadvantage by taking Abilify. For me a vicious cycle results between tremor and anxiety especially when taking Abilify. I was taking after breakfast 20mg per day this last time then stepped down to 15mg with no let up in either tremor or anxiety. Having been completely off of Abilify now for 15 days hasn't caused me any negative side effects or concerns of psychosis or mood swings. Hopefully I will now have less anxiety and tremor as the influence of the medicine leaves my body.  Manic-Depression(and in particular Bipolar I Disorder has been part of my life for over 35 years. I highly advise against Abilify if one deals with anxiety of any nature or does not realize that Abilify can be the source thereof. Hang in there!          Read More Read Less

I wasn't even on it for 3 weeks.  It has taken over a yr. to get mobility back.  In the first month of quitting ablify, I could not use my hands.  My mother had to feed me, bathe me, dress me.  I could not do anything for myself.  I couldn't walk down my stairs, so I was house-ridden for an entire month!  I did not sleep for several days.  I could not lay, or sit.  I had to stand up 24 hours for 3 days. My mother finally got me to sit on the sofa. I could not lay in my bed. I am not 100% back to normal yet.  I am in severe pain.  My muscles still spasm especially legs, shoulders, glutes. I was taking remeron along with abilify.  I would not recommend this drug to anyone. My cousin's girlfriend had a bad experience with this drug as well. I lost over 100 lbs in less than six months after stopping abilify.  20 pounds in one week. Read More Read Less

My daughter is 14 years old and has Bipolar Disorder.  Abilify has changed our lives.  She tried other meds (risperdal, trileptal) before Abilify because of insurance reasons and they did not help her.  She takes it along with Lamictal and the combination helps to put her in remission.  She recently was triggered by the unseasonably spring-like weather and an increase in dosage did the trick almost immediately.  She normally takes Abilify 10mg and Lamictal 150mg once daily.  To deal with her current relapse she is now at Abilify 15mg.  I hope that this review can give some other parent hope.  When we were struggling for a year to find the right medications for her, I was desperate to find good reviews among some of the bad ones.  This medication has given us our lives back.  I only hope that she will be able to continue on with it for a long period of time.  As far as side effects go, when she goes through med increases/decreases she may experience painful headaches and overwhelming nausea.  This always passes within a 2-3 days.Read More Read Less

My mom took Abilify and Seroquel for over two years. (She had taken Risperdol before that and had a relapse.) She developed severe tardive dyskensia-mouth twitches, head and hand tremors-and her psych told her that she had Parkinson's. She had become so oversedated that she was nearly catatonic, and had lost all desire to eat or do anything except slump in her chair in front of the TV. She developed aspiration pneumonia and ended up in the hospital, where they had to put in a feeding tube because she could no longer swallow food or liquid. She was seen by a neurologist who correctly diagnosed her with tardive dyskensia--NOT Parkinson's--and put her on Clozeril. After 8 months of suffering, and intensive speech therapy, she is now home, eating regular food, and is more alert and lucid than I've seen her in years.  Please, if you are on either Abilify or Seroquel, and if you are having any symptoms like hers, tell your dr and don't take no for an answer! It's a miracle she's still alive. Read More Read Less

Well I struggle with depression, anxiety, and hallucinations.  I went to my primary doctor and he first prescribed me Zyprexa, and something with both Prozac and Zyprexa in it, and then Abilify.  Abilify worked the best for me, I felt happy all the time, I didn't find myself constantly thinking about horrible things, my hallucinations became pretty mild and less consistent.  I was on it for about a month or two when I began having a bad side effect.  I find it a little funny, but I started to develop facial twitches.  My upper lip would pull the "Elvis Face" without me wanting it to and my smile would twitch on the sides as well as having other random facial twitches.  This sort of scared me out of it and I did not refill the prescription.  I'd take it again, if not for the facial twitches.  It worked really well, especially for anxiety, but it's been over a half a year since I was off of it and I'm still experiencing facial twitches.  It was helpful, though, besides the twitches.Read More Read Less

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I am finding that I actually have emotions now and feel like I can find a calm at times.  I have been getting a few stomach cramps, not too bad.  I find that I am a lot less angry.

I have been taking 2mg-5mg of Abilify to "amplify" my Effexor 150XR BID for almost 3 years and it works very well for my "Major Depressive Disorder".    The variable that has changed how much Abilify I take is whether I am taking generic Effexor XR or the Brand, in my case and in my opinion.  Thus, I need more abilify if I don't have the brand name drug.      I also notice more side affects at 5mgs.  For example, the company warns in their side effect literature that diabetic type symtoms are possible.  I have noticed these very symtoms, such as increased hunger, thirst, urination, swelling of extemities, craving sweets, etc.  Have others noticed this?  I gained 10 pounds in the last month so I am going down to 2 mg. after I check with my doctor for his approval in our overall treatment plan.  (Anytime I have tried to play doctor by myself it ends up in disaster!)    I will be checking back if other people have these symptoms that lead to weight gain.  I can loose 10lbs. quickly so I am not going to stress over it, this combo of meds works the best out of sooo many I have tried.      Good luck to everyone else our there!  Read More Read Less

I am on my 10th day.  I am feeling better.  I feel more calm & it is helping me sleep.  I do feel a little more tired & sometimes a slight headache, but I can handle it.  I have never been able to take SSRI's because of the side effects.  This doesn't have hardly any side effects on me.  It is a good drug for me so far.

This a terrible drug. So far, it has made me sleep for 12+ hours of the day, feel like my stomach is trying to crawl out of my body, become depressed (when I was not), cry uncontrollably for 3 days and unable to concentrate. I also got the shakes after only day 4 and I am having a difficult time driving, due to blurred vision and lack of concentration. For those of you interested, it also ruined my sex drive. This drug has not helped me for what it was meant to treat. It is more disabling than helpful. Abilify? More like Dis-Abilify. Read More Read Less
Worked great. I felt so much better and able to do so much more on life. One problem I put on 5lbs but my Doctor did warn me of this problem.

I took this drug for about 2 years. This drug was added to another drug I was taking. While taking this drug I would have to force myself to get out of bed. I had to force myself to do just about anything other than sleep. I gained about 30 pounds as well. I also became more depresed than I was when I started the drug. I found this out by forgetting to take the drug for a few days. I felt much better off of it that on it. Both myself and my doctor decited this was not the durg for me. I had an awful time on this drug and had thoughts of suicide and just didn't want to do anything. If you are on this drug, make sure you watch your moods and keep a record of how you are feeling. If you start going into the dark hole, you can catch yourself before you get so lost you can't see your way out. Read More Read Less

My doctor added this to my effexor and I finally am feeling much better and it really helped with my depression.  The cost is an issue as I am on Social Security Disability and when I am in the "donut hole" my insurance company wanted to charge me $700 for a 3-month supply.  Luckily my doctor is giving me samples until the first of the year!
Feel kind of aloof. Disengaged. Don't cry anymore. Just here.

Abilify is HORRIBLE!!  I was on it for a year and it made me feel restless, anxious, and nervous.  I was totally unable to sit still and felt like whatever I was doing, I wanted to be doing something else.  So, I was never happy with what I was doing.  Abilify also gave me an insatiable appetite.  Although I only ate 1400cal/day and kept a daily dairy of my calories, I still gained about 15 lbs.  My doc put me on Chlonipin because of my anxiety, which made me 10X worse.  I ended up in the hospital Oct 2010 suicidal.  I had had a problem with Chlonipin about 10 years prior.  The doc there took me off Abilify and Chlonipin and put me on Seroquel and Prozac.  I've been on this combo for a year and feel better than I've ever felt in my life!  I also lost the Abilify-related weight gain and have a normal appetite. I can't believe that I withstood a year of taking Abilify.  It was a nightmare!Read More Read Less
This medication saved my life.  I was hitting rock bottom before I took this for bipolar.  After a week or two of taking it my depression went away.

I've only been on it for 2 weeks. I felt much better after 1 or 2 doses. (2mg)I have battled depression for many years and so far this seems to be a miracle pill. I am also taking prozac and ritilan. Side effects are tolerable. The first week I wanted to eat everything in sight, but after 2 weeks it's not so bad. I eat very healthily so I have not gained any weight, I just eat more. The bigger issue is waking early; I wake up at 4:30 am like I've set an alarm clock. That's 6 1/2 hours of sleep with no naps. I am however enjoying the quiet time to read and pray. Overactivity was an issue for about a week but that seems to be susiding, although I've cleaned out the garage and basement! My spouse has noticed the difference in mood and energy level. Overall I'd give it a 9 out of 10! Thank God for the person responsible for developing this little pill!Read More Read Less

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I've taken Abilify for a long time at high doses and low doses for bipolar disorder I. It's a great drug for the prescriber, it cuts down on your phone calls to him. I am so glad, I took myself off it and all other chemical straitjackets. It robs you of your soul. Your cognitive function suffers tremendously, but you don't realize it unless you have to function at a high level and deal with complex problems. It's touted as the only atypical that doesn't cause weight gain, not true! It's just another me too drug in a poorly understood class of pharmaceuticals. Yes it has a better side effect profile than Haldol. If your doctor suggests an antipsychotic for you, maybe you should ask him why he thinks you need an antipsychotic. Short term therapy maybe 2-3 days of Zyprexa are enough to take care of crisis situations. Taking this drug routinely is like taking chemo to prevent cancer. Don't think of this as a mood stabilizer. I predict it will be off the market in 8 years. Educate yourself on this class of medication, be an informed consumer. Oh yeah, I'm a pharmacist too with 34 years of experience. Is this pill really worth $600/ month. That's 3 hours of good therapy you could be getting instead. Big Pharma at it again !Read More Read Less
seems to work& I have less anxiety with this med&celexa :)

I was very hopeful when I started this medication for the first few weeks or so, but then the side effects kicked in. Everything the commercial spoke about as it relates to side effects, I experienced and had to be hospitalized. I did begin to feel better taking Abilify but after what I went through witht he side effects, I am afraid to take anything else as an antipsychotic.

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: Abilify has been very helpful to me to ease my depression, however, I would not suggest running out of the medication or walking off of it as it has thrown me into a deeper depression when doing so.

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I was diagnosed for bipolar, i need more information about this drug
Using Abilify with another depression drug has helped me so much. Without the Abilify I am back to being very depressed and crying. Don't think I could make it without Abilify.

I have been on the dosage of 20mg of abilify for years. I am a white female, 5"3',weighing about 135 LBS, 53 yrs. old.  I also take Cymbalta 30mg. I have found just recently, that this medication SHOULD BE DISOLVED ON THE TONGUE, and NOT SWALLOWED!!!!!  I found this out by reading the white dosage information inside the box.  This medication has really worked for me very well. I just read some disturbing comments from other readers on this web site, concerning the adverse side effects. I have been diagnosed with fibromyalgia in early June of 2011, and I just read from another patient, that THIS DRUG MAY CAUSE SERIOUS NEUROLOGICAL SIDE EFFECTS, HENCE MY FIBROMYALGIA????????  Just worried now.Read More Read Less

I reviewed this drug a year ago and noted that it was effective, but that the weight gain took its toll on our son, socially and emotionally.  The 40 pounds of flab are slowly fading, but his self-image has been wounded.  At the time, being desperate, we thought the benefits outweighed this side effect, but I would now advise parents to consider very carefully how negative it is for a teen to be fat.  Proceed with caution.
DEPRECCION

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I HAVE BEEN TAKING THIS MEDICINE FOR ABOUT A YEAR. I STARTED GAINING WEIGHT REALLY FAST & I STARTED FEELING REALLY BAD ALL OF THE TIME. MY DR ORDERED BLOOD TESTS AND MUCH TO MY SUPRISE MY TRIGLYCERIDES (WHICH ARE SUPPOSED TO BE 150) ARE NOW AT 744. MY DR CALLED ME THE SAME DAY AND SAID TO STOP TAKING THIS MEDICINE IMMEDIATLY. NOW I'M HAVING HEART PROBLEMS AND ALSO DIZZY SPELLS WHERE I LOOSE ALL SENSE OF CORDINATION. I CAN NO LONGER DRIVE OR GO OUT BY MYSELF. THIS MEDICINE HAS REALLY DONE A NUMBER ON ME & I WOULDN'T RECOMMEND ANYONE TAKING IT. IT HAS TURNED MY LIFE UPSIDE DOWN.Read More Read Less

I was impatient. I felt like my body was going, going, going, but my brain was off. I started having involintary muscle movements of my neck, face, legs, etc. It was horrible. It made me feel so uncomfortable. I couldn't rest. I couldn't stay still.

I have been on 2mg almost 4wks. now and I can't remember the last time I have been this happy. I use it as an add on to cymbalta 60mg. Did have a few muscle cramps, but that has gone away.  Just wish it wasn't so expensive.

The medication made me paranoid.  I would not drive on the freeway or not night.  I couldn't work.  As soon as I was off the medicine I started feeling much better.  I was taking effexor with abilify.  I am now taking effexor with wellbutrin.

I'm very happy with Abilify. This medication has given me a LIFE I could only dream of...I never realized just how depressed my life really was. I had and that was HAD side effects but they went away in a couple of weeks. I had muscle spasms in my arms and legs but i was happy. To me it was a small exchange but they went away. As for the cost, my Dr. gave me a discount card and with my insurance i only pay my co-pay of $15. The company helps with the cost as long as you are not on state insurance. If anyone is depressed and wants a life get Abilify, it gives you the ability to Live.........Read More Read Less

Worst bipolar drug ever! It makes me depressed and overly sensitive and I was crying almost every day. Plus, I hate the side effects particularly weight gain. Why I gained 9lbs in less than a year and I can't get it off because the medicine won't let me. Do not take this drug.

The medication helped with my depression but, unfortunately it caused severe swelling(3+ pitting edema) in my feet and ankles. I had to stop the medication because diuretics did not reduce the swelling.

I have been taking Abilify for around a week now and I'm having trouble with the side effects. First I feel weak all the time, but at the same time, when I lay down I feel restless. The other and more serious issue for me is that I've been uncontrollably peeing in my pants. Its happened twice in two days. This last time, as soon as I felt the slightest urge to go, I went straight to the bathroom. Before I even got the door closed or my pants undone however, I was peeing with no warning. Both times it's happened I didn't need to go that bad and then suddenly, There's pee running down my legs. It's always a big accident too, like my whole bladder, and I don't even feel it coming till it's too late. I don't know what to do other than to talk with my doctor.Read More Read Less

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I think i had every bad side effect on the long list from the drug store except death.  Really, this was very bad experience for me and i kept calling the dr. but he had no time for me.   finally he put me on seroquel, (i was gaining weight by leaps and bounds now) and i tried to shoot myself in the head.  Was put in the psych ward by the police.  I was doing fine until the DEA got involved and pulled all the xanax from the drs who were prescribing it.  Thank you gov.

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I felt good taking the medication, but stopped because of getting blood clots in the lungs and leg. Read on the internet in britain medical journal, that blood clots have been a side effect of this drug along with other antipsychotic drugs especially seroquel. I had a lot of neck pain.  I have to say it's not worth dying for. DO NOT TAKE THIS DRUG

This medication has worked very well managing my depression and anxiety, I have notice that I have developed some of the more sever side effect, Such as Extreme sweatting, fever in the night, sore joints and blood pressure irregularity. I hate to change because it works so well and its really hard to find the right medication. My side effects come with a some times a rare but fatal neurological disorder.
abilify has helped alot with my anger issues

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I've tried literally every psych med out there for bipolar, and I finally found that just 10mg of Abilify, in conjunction with my depakote and effexor, totally cleared up my head. I'm so productive now, I finally feel like my old (good) normal self. I see things in a much more positive way. I'm really shocked how quickly and well this drug is working for me. Just a note, tried 15mg and felt too sluggish. 10mg worked better for me.

My daughter (now age 9) was diagnosed w/ADHD at age 5.  She has been treated for ADHD, but was still suffering from mood swings.  She's had been on Abilify for about 4 months and it's been a huge change.  Besides the weight gain (1 full clothing size) she has had no side effects.  She takes the medication before bed to avoid any daytime sleepiness. She is SO much happier, which in turn, makes the entire family happier. She's a little clingier, I think, but the mood swings are gone. I'm hoping that this med is a long-term solution for her and does not wear off in a year.Read More Read Less

Started with 2mg, up to 10 and now on 15mg a day. I have had good luck with this med although i seem to be having some eye problems, like blurred vision that last a few hours. I won't go any higher in dosage but so far I am pretty happy with it. I have it as an ad on to Lamictal, Zoloft and Ativan...not sure which it is adding on to so I am keeping them all!! First time in 4 years that I FEEL happy and not just floating through the day until time for bed. With a husband and 2 small biys, it is not possible to be laying around all the time. This med has me up walking the doc, playing with the boys and finally giving my husband some attention! You just have to find the right dose for you!!Read More Read Less

I was just given this med by my doc.  After reading a lot of posts here, I decided not to take it (i.e.DO NOT TAKE THIS MEDICATION).  There seems to be a lot of side effects that I can't deal with.  I gave these rates one star because I couldn't post this with out doing it:   Effectiveness  Ease of Use  Satisfaction

I am 32 yrs old & have Bipolar I & am paranoid schizophrenic.  Ambilify along with Lithium & Klonopin was a great combo for me. Side effects of ambilify were minimal but I had to stop taking it due to cost. I lost my insurance & for a 30 day supply it cost almost $600.  Im on day 3 without it & wish I was still taking it.

I AM CINCERNED FOR THE SIDE EFFECTS INTHIS MEDICATION AS THE PERSON I SUPPORT IS AUTISTIC.Abilify did change his behavior for the better.
having trouble with upset stomache, having headaches also

I have been on abilify for 3 weeks and it has helped me tremendously. I also take wellbutrin and effexor. I am 53 and have suffered from depression for most of my life. The abilify has worked better than any other drug. I can now function like a normal person. I have much more energy and my anger and constant sadness are gone. The only down side is the cost, even with insurance it's $80 a month. My husband says it's a small price to pay for a miracle. I hope it continues to help me, because I don't want to go back to the dark place that used to be my life. Read More Read Less

It's been 3 month's now. Since adding it onto Cymbalta it's done wonders. I have worked at a bar, went to a pool party, spend the weekend with a wonderful guy, and am no longer to take the trash during the day time!     It may effect you differently, but as for me I am starting to enjoy life again. After 8 months of adjusting medications I think i have found the right combination.     Personal warning: The abilify makes me very sleepy. A simple solution to counteract this is to just take your Abilify at night get a restful nights sleep. Read More Read Less

I am bi-polar 1 and have been since my late 20's. nothing up until abilify worked. This has been the best med. for my problem EVER!! I am now going on 3 1/2 yrs. and actually have enjoyed life. For the first time along with my other meds. and they do not interact or have any side effects with abilify.  I would highly recommend this one RX. I am happy again after so many years of being miserable.  The only drawback is slight weight gain and I have diabetes.  So I have to keep close watch on them.  Good Luck and I hope you find this helpful.Read More Read Less
abilify has helped me due to nonstop crying and no energy

I took abilify for two weeks in conjunction with Celexa(which I have taken for years). I am 56 yo, w/f and have had a heat stroke which came out of nowhere. I'd advise people not to take this drug at all. Going to 4th Dr. If you start to feel dizzy at all call your Dr.

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I was on this drug for around 3 years for bipolar disorder. At first, the symptoms went away, but after a few months, they came back. I went back and forth during the majority of the 3 years, and I was recently taken off this drug. I may be a special case, but it didn't work as effectively as I hoped it would.

I dislike taking pills of any kind but have given in to what my doctors are advising me to do.  I don't see any real effect yet but hope to soon that may change my mind about having to take another pill.

Doctor in hospital diagnosed me with Schizophrenia, but my doctor has said he is prescribing it for Bipolar...and put me on 15mg to start...I read where this might be prescribed at higher doses for Bipolar and lower doses for Schizophrenia...at 15mg I was gaining about 1-2 pounds per month, but at the same time was actively walking outside every day...I got so that I became very dizzy and had an abrupt feeling of faint at times...I spoke to my medication prescriber's office about the dizziness and abrupt feeling of faint and to see if lowering my dose would help...went to my MD at their request to be cleared for medical reasons in order to do this and found out my blood pressure was above borderline and he wanted to put me on Lisinopril... I read online that Abilify can cause High Blood pressure or Fluctuating blood pressure...my prescriber's office still would not lower my dose...I felt this med was doing more harm than good...I then went to see a neurologist...I was told this medication can cause the dizziness and went back to my prescriber...reluctantly my dose was lowered by 5 mg...the abrupt feeling of faint has not returned by I do still get a feeling of vertigo or dizzy at times...my blood pressure went to borderline...I was told at some point if I could drop some weight this might help...I've been working out in a gym on a treadmill and lifting weights for over a year...the most weight I lost was 10 pounds...I am trying dieting now...I feel I need to ask for my dosage to be lowered again to see if my blood pressure will drop...read online in NY Times article on young adults taking Abilfy...that lowering the dose does not help with weight loss...I will continue to diet and exercise even still...and see about getting the dose to see if my blood pressure will go down...Read More Read Less

I took abilify for about a year along with another depression medication. After about 6 months I ended up having involuntary muscle movements in my neck that became so bad that I had to hold my face to take a straight forward picture. I told my doctor and he did not believe me and told me to see an eye doctor and a neurologist. I spent a lot of money on the tests and they found nothing. I finally convinced my doctor to take me off of it and about 3 months later all the involuntary movements were gone.Read More Read Less

I have been taking Abilify for 2.5 months officially for depression but suspected Bipolar ( with mostly depression). I've had good energy boost. Waking in the morning is so good that I go to bed looking forward to the way I will wake in the morning. I've upped to 5mg. Tried am, pm, and am/pm split. Not sure which is best, yet. I am am also in Suboxone treatment for opiate dependence from chronic pain treatment. Almost off Suboxone, but -- and here is my major concern -- I still find it hard to concentrate well enough to write. I'm a professor and am having trouble writing scholarly material.  Find it hard to put complex argument together.  I know what I want to say, but I can't seem to get enough clarity ini my thinking to make it happen. Will go back down to 2.5 to see if this helps. I had good results at that level and thought 5 would "seal the deal." maybe the lower dose is right.  I all quite pleased but need to be able to complete my work.  I have, I should add, weird sleep things. Dozing off while trying to read, though as soon as I move around it's clear I still have the good energy level. I think I've learned, as doctor indicated, that regular sleep patterns to manage energy levels is critical.  Gaining some weight but could eat better, a lot better! I short, quite good, but not "perfect." Read More Read Less
I'm treated with Abilify for psychosis related to mania for bipolar disorder.
This medication has caused me very significant weight gain and possible swelling of my foot and leg.

I have not noticed any difference with this drug.  I have been on this for 2 months and the only thing it has done for me is make me gain weight.  I am also on Cymbalta,Lamictal,Trazadone and Topamax.  My family has not noticed any change in my moods or behaviors and neither have I.  I am diagnosed as depressed and bi-polar.  I am going off this drug asap.

Took Abilify 2mg with 90 mg of Cymbalta for about a year. Gained 20 lbs and started smoking about a pack a day. Decided to get off when I was plagued with extreme restlesness. I wanted to run away, to do anything other than what I was doing. I had impaired judgment and lost the "soul-check" one gets when they have irrational or sporadic thoughts. My advice is to make sure you are being honest with your doctor when taking this medication, because your mood and demeanor can flip in an instance. It worked for me for about 8 mos and then it back-fired.Read More Read Less

I have been trying diffent antidepressants for past the 8 months.  Just not quite able to be back to normal.  With Ability added to symbalta & Wellbutrin, I am now back to my normal self.  I had been given too many steriods and had spiraled clear to the bottom.  Tried everything to get back to my normal self.  But, now only after 6 days have returned to my normal self.  No side affects as of yet after 2 weeks of Abilify.

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: Just to let everyone know...make sure you DO NOT lay in a tanning bed or expose yourself to heat and sunlight.  I went into annafalactic shock this afternoon because of doing so and taking Abilify.  My Dr did NOT warn me of this and for some reason there was not an information packet in with my medication informing me of any of this.  Wished I would have looked at WebMD FIRST!!!!
it seemed to really help, along with the Effexor, I would love to go off all meds,since the reason I was depressed is a thing of the past,,,

took this along side Lexapro. let me just say both drugs are HORRIFIC!! i was shaking in my hands and legs, had 2 seizures, was confused all the time, couldn't feel regular emotions like crying or feeling bad, gained 40 pounds, felt awful, couldn't drive a car, lost my job, couldn't interact or identify with others, hungry all the time, became a shut in, obsessive thoughts, and so much more...oh and detoxing off both medications almost killed me-sweats, throwing up, anger, twitching, i felt like i was addicted to it. it ruined my life for 2 years and ive been trying for the last 9 months to recover. be aware. please explore all options before taking and don't be afraid to question your doctor and speak up if you have similar problems. i was naive. I feel better now that im off that poison.Read More Read Less

I am 28 and have suffered from depression since I was 12.  I have been on and off meds.  Abilify is the first to make me feel this good.  I have amazing energy, decreased obsession with eating, and feel happy to be alive.  The negatives (which I will tolerate since the med works so well for me): jitters if I don't take my pill at the same time everyday.  I feel jumpy if I sit too long.  I get very tired in the afternoon, but a 10 minute rest and I feel great again.  I had severe headaches the first week, but they are gone now.  This drug has probably saved my life.  Yes, its side effects aren't fun, but the benefits outweigh the negatives in my case.  I hope they soon come out with a generic or reduce the price.  I take this with Lithium.Read More Read Less

I didn't help me.  It made me feel totally numb.  I had no emotions: no tears even though I was sad; no laughter even when I knew something was funny.  I was just blah.  I had zero libido.  I also had terrible muscle stiffness.  I used to be very limber and I was just horribly stiff.  Then I got tremors.  My head would start mildly shaking and I couldn't stop it.  When I got off of it, the tremors stopped, and it took a little while, but the muscle stiffness went away.  Would not recommend this, unless there is just no other alternative.Read More Read Less

OMG. I have been depressed and suicidal since 1980. My father killed himself as did my son. I have been on anti-depressants since 1993. All helped for a while keeping me out of the deepest black pit most of the time. But I never felt really good, just blah. I tried Zoloft, Lexapro, several others, all of which were less effective over time. I have been on Effexor XR 150mg for 4 years. I felt, as usual, blah and hoped I would not wake up in the morning. Suicide was not a logical possibility as I couldn't put my wife thru a second one after my son. The only way I thought I might kill myself was suddenly, in anger. One month ago I went to a new doctor who suggested I try Abilify. I has seen the ads but never thought I could get better and had no energy to try. Doc gave me two weeks of free 2mg tabs and after about 7 days Abilify switched my life back on. It is amazing and I almost am scared at how good I feel. I have not felt this good in 30 years. I have been on 2mg for 6 weeks and notice no adverse side effects. Right now, I see no need to bump the dosage. Read More Read Less
can thius med cause acne break outs?

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I normally wouldnt take the time to post this but I think I have some valuable information to offer.  My sister and I are both bipolar.  Having gone through the various mood stabilizers and see her reactions to mood stabilizers, I can tell you that there isn't a single med that works the same for everyone.  So my advice would be to try as many meds as you can giving each atleast 4 weeks to get the full effect then decide which has the least bad side effects.  For me, its abilify.  Granted I went from 120 to 170 and I eat healthy and got a Y membership but cant get the weight off, but I'm sooo much more of a pleasant stable person now than I have ever been.Read More Read Less
no side effects
I was very depressed and suicidal before I started taking Abilify.  It gave me my life back.
i get dizzy and tired and slight tremors
Horrible!! Did nothing for depression, weigh gain, and naseau and dizziness when you stop taking it. Don't take this drug!
I didn't like it it made me angry all the time and it got worse the longer I took it.  High anxiety attacks.  Trouble sleeping.

When I first started taking this I felt a difference within the first 3 days.  I had energy, I was up and doing things, it was great.  First day I noticed my face was hot and flush...this continued each day.  I also had an episode that scared me so bad I went to ER.  This medication made my heart beat irregularly and my blood pressure was way above my norm.  These symptoms subsided once the medication was in my systen for several weeks.  I might add that my psychologist said she didnt believe these symptoms were from the medication so I continued to take it (I still think it was the med...new to my system, etc.)  I felt uplifted for about 6 weeks and then back to my old self, no energy, not interested in things, etc.  I have a review coming up and will more than likely be bumped up on the milgrams, crossing my fingers.  And I have gained about 5 pounds in the 8+ weeks Ive been on it.Read More Read Less

I have severe back problems,and fibromyalgia which led to severe depression.. I kept telling the Doctor that the Cymbalta 60mg x2 was NOT WORKING  she wanted to keep me on it because it has been approved for fibromyalgia.  Finally went to another Psychiatrist for a second opinion. She put me on 2 mg ABILFY in the AM WITH the Cymbalta and it has WORKED wonders!!  So far knock  on wood NO NEGATIVE side effects!!  Hope this helps...

I take 5 mg of Abilify daily to supplement 225 mg of Effexor, which I have taken for over a year.  After 3 weeks on Abilify, I have seen dramatic improvement in my mood and energy level.  No more weepiness, and I feel more optimistic about the future.  Increased appetite is a problem, though, and I am trying to eat healthy food.  Have never woke up hungry at night before taking this medication, so we'll see if the appetite issue eventually gets under control.

I  like this, I no longer have racing thoughts, or talking to my inner self hardly as much. I will say that at first it was great now, it makes me really restless and I have to take it before bed. I'm tired a lot.

I have been treating my depression and anxiety symptoms with Prozac and clonozapam for the last 7 years but it didnt help enough. I am also affected by SAD so in the spring my Dr started me on Ablify 5mg and I had immediate energy increase, more interest in life, needed less sleep where as before I was sleeping 10 hrs and did not feel well rested. Worried about weight gain, up 5 pounds, working out daily now :) 3 weeks so far Ive been taking it.
Worked okay.  Did gain weight.  Also have migraines and after weaned off the migraines substantially got better.  Doctor reported that I was the fifth person to make that observation.

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: By using Abilify, I seldom have bad mood swings and episodes!!!  It has an easy dosage of one time daily so it's hard to miss a dose.
was not my self, couldn't hold things together very hyper no consentration at all.  would never try again hated how it made me feel.  wife say a big change in me and helped me get off it!
I've just started taking abilify and the dosage is conservative. I also know that when my dosage increases I'll most likely feel even better.

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I have been on it for a few months, I really needed it for my racing thoughts, depression and anger. I have no side effects and I wish I would have had this drug years ago.

Medication was very helpful but it increased my appetite even at 2 mg.  I am now breaking out in itching spells and hives/welts that come and go.  I think it's the Abilify.  Has anyone else had this experience?

I was on Abilify for over 7 years. In that time I gained 80+ pounds that I was unable to loose. I found out that I am at high risk for diabetes. I now have to check my blood glucose levels multiple times a day and have lost feeling in most of the fingers on both hands. The FDA should take this drug off the market, no one should ever be exposed to this medication.

I'm Bipolar 1 and I had an anxiety attack about two years ago. My psychiatrist put me on Abilify to quell the attack. I don't remember the dosage. I was also takibng Lithium and Lamictal as the time. It worked well for a while but then I felt emotional numb and had cognitive clouding. I was going through a horrific custody battle for my son and was earning more time with him and I figured this was how things were going to be. I was communicating to my psychiatrist and psychologist that I was having a hard time talking to people and remembering things but my psychiatrist didn't recommend a change for almost a year which of course I was scared to do because I was gaining more time with my son. My psychologist never told me she though my meds were off she just said she thought we could move to meeting once a month as I didn't have much to say! Luckily I told a guy I was dating that I was BP and he did research on Abilify and said it was a nasty drug and that I needed to get off of it. I talked to my psychologist again and she said I think you are having cognitive clouding and that you need to talk to your psychiatrist and have your meds changed. I got off it and I'm a new person. I have emotions and can talk to people again. I've since switched counselors and she said I was probably on too high of a dose and that it's not a bad drug, but for me it robbed a year of my life. Hopefully this will help someone else and you won't have to lose so much time in your life.Read More Read Less

This is the most horrific drug I've ever taken.  My doctor let me try this because the Risperdal I was taking had caused a lot of weight gain, and Abilify is known to cause somewhat less weight gain.  I took it for several months.  It was a terrible experience.  I had one of its most common side effects, which was anxiety and insomnia.  I had constant anxiety just gushing inside my body, and I would be awake all night, over and over again.  I started making fewer and fewer meals and just ate handfuls of peanuts instead just to stay alive because I felt too bad to cook a balanced meal.  I did lose some weight, but the situation got worse, where at 15 mg. I was starting to hear voices again, and I was afraid to ask my doctor to increase the dose because the awful anxiety might have gotten worse.  I finally switched back to Risperdal and later Invega (a slightly improved version of Risperdal), and it was the biggest relief I have ever had in my lifetime.  My sleep immediately went back to normal, no more voices, and the awful gushing anxiety just stopped.  I wish it was easier to lose weight on Invega, but I have had some success in doing so, since it's not like it causes me hunger all the time.  The weight just sort of creeps up on me with these drugs, and it's possible to eat healthy and keep a healthy weight, it just takes some effort.Read More Read Less

I was given Abilify (.5 ) to aid my Wellbutrin 300 in treating my severe long -term depression.(I am also bi-polar)With one dose I started to feel better!I have LOST weight,my energy level is thru the roof and I enjoy the things I hadn't done in a long time.No insomnia,no weight gain,just a bit tired the first few days, and a feeling of being cold. This med is a Godsend,anyone in depression should at least give it a try.I have never felt so good! Good luck to all who try.

My son was put on this medication for his Autism. It put him in a Catatonic state and he was hospitalized. Kids with Autism should not be put on Anti-psychotics, they need help with focus and with behavior..

I was put on Abilify to treat Bipolar Disorder. The Doctor I was seeing at the time kept me on it for 3 years because he could not accept the fact that the muscle movement problems I was having, and still have, could be Tardive Dyskinesia caused by the Abilify. He claimed my symptoms did not match the "criteria" for TD, but according to the drug manufacturer & the FDA it DOES. He also claimed that because the possibility of Abilify causing TD was so low there was no way I could have TD!  I fired the Doctor, found one who knows what he's doing & got off Abilify. Now, 3 1/2 years later I STILL have Tardive Dyskinesia & it affects me daily. I'm glad it seems to help some people, but PLEASE BE CAREFUL!  When I was on Abilify I had MANY other side-effects (panic attacks, agoraphobia, problems maintaining my body temperature, skin infections, hair loss, forgetting how to do things, OCD/hoarding, and more, even an autoimmune disorder that has since gone away), thankfully most of those have gone away completely (except the weight gain, skin infections, & while the hoarding tendency is better, it's still there), or at least have become tolerable, but the continuing muscle problems are very frustrating & debilitating to say the least! On a GOOD day I might be able to walk 2 blocks without trouble, on a bad day 10 feet can be a huge struggle.  Abilify also caused my personality to change & I'm still trying to learn how to overcome that (I had a friend who won't speak to me now because of it).  Now that I've been off Abilify I've realized that it was magnifying my moodswings.  I am now on a totally natural/vitamin-based treatment program & I'm doing MUCH BETTER than I ever did on antipsychotics!  PLEASE, if you notice ANY muscle problems, or ANYTHING else UNUSUAL FOR YOU, NO MATTER HOW SMALL, talk to your Doctor immediately! And if they won't listen & take it seriously FIND ANOTHER DOCTOR!!!Read More Read Less

My doctor when contacted said to take Benadryl and Cogentin, which stop these spasms.   What i had is called an acute dystonic reaction.    For obvious reasons, I can't take Abilify. I've taken many atypical antipsychotics but I took Abilify for more than 10 years in doses ranging from 10-30 mgs. I've had one permanent side-effect that has not been mentioned in this forum but has been reviewed in medical journals.  I started making uncontrollable noises and singing, bobbing my head, rocking, and moving my fingers simultaneously as if playing the piano. I cannot control this, I would even wake up at night humming and doing my fingers.It gets worse when I'm under stress.  A neurologist diagnosed Tardive Tourette's Syndrome. It is a result of long-term use of Abilify. This post is to warn others that this can happen, occur suddenly without warning and be permenant. I am glad that so many people are finding relief with Abilify and are able to live their lives, but be careful and maybe take a drug holiday.Read More Read Less

I began Abilify over a year ago as an adjunct to Effexor XR. I started feeling less depressed and was even able to do all my yard work for the first time in years. After a few months I began having a very uncomfortable sense of restlessness inside and my Dr. lowered the dose and increased my Klonopin. I began having tremors in my hands which got so bad people were constantly asking why I was shaking so badly. I knew it was caused by the Abilify and took myself off of it by lowering dosage gradually, with my Drs. approval. I've been off this med for about six months and the tremors have not improved and have been told this may be permanent. I regret ever taking this med. I found out that my niece had been taking it for 2 years and developed terrible Parkinson's effects and is now on a Parkinson med she will have to be on for the rest of her life. She is only 31 yrs. old. Her Dr. told her the same ingredients are in it that were used in high concentrations by the Nazi's to torture Jews in concentration camps. I can relate, as it can be somewhat torturous to go through what we both are now. For this reason alone  I would recommend anyone beginning to have even the least amount of tremors report to your Dr. IMMEDIATELY, as it only gets worse, not better, with time.Read More Read Less

11 yo son started manicing at 3 yrs old, very angry, violent, 6 to 8 hour long destructive rages.  Up and down multiple times daily. In and out of hospital, day treatment school for over a year.  Started Abilify end of July while in hospital, felt nauseated for 3 days, then completely amazing.  I have my son back for the first time in years!  He is more revved up than "normal", is I believe in a mild manic state, always (still) obsessing about one thing or another, very busy, busy, busy, but happy, not aggressive.  Furniture isn't flying across the room, knives aren't grabbed and directed at himself or others anymore and the suicide talk has disappeared.  He started public school today!  Very satisfied with this med.  Tried Depakote, Lamictal, Buspirone, Risperadol, Seroquel, Wellbutrin, Celexa, Ritalin, Adderall, Strattera, and 4 others that I cannot remember the names to.  Is now on Abilify, Buspirone, and Luvox combo....LOVE IT.  Hope other kids can get as great of a benefit as my son.  Good luck and parents...don't let others tell you what's NOT wrong with your children.Read More Read Less
i had to stop because my ins ouit paying for it when i stoped i started having trouble relaxing my hands and mouth i bite my toung i had none of theese before

My teen son took Abilify for one year for severe anxiety and OCD.  Dose started at 1mg, then 2.5 and then 5.  At 5mg, his coping skills were quite good, but throughout it all, he had a 40% increase in weight (40 pounds).  Metformin was given to suppress his appetite, but the fact is that the weight gain was not in proportion to his diet; his metabolism changed.  So, due to the sluggishness he feels with the extra weight, and teasing he's had because he's "fat", he wants to go off Abilify and we support that.  Now that he is recently off, we are reminded just how effective Abilify had been.  We are trying to find alternatives that don't cause such big weight gain.Read More Read Less

This has worked out great for our 13-yr old son.  He takes 1/4 of a 2mg pill at night, so he's getting .5 mg a day, along with Wellbutrin for his anxiety/depression issues.  This combination has been an enormous help for him.  We were lucky - this is the first and only meds combo we've had to try, and we saw improvement within 3-4 days.  After a month, his doctor increased his dose to half a pill, but that made him sleepy during the day.  We took him back down to 1/4 pill a day and he's doing great!  His doc also suggest that he take an OTC Melatonin as a sleep aid, so he hasn't had any insomnia issues.    He has been taking it for 4 months, so I don't know what the long-term outcome will be for him.  I just hope it keeps working!    Cutting the already tiny pills into fourths is kind of hassle, but absolutely worth the effort.Read More Read Less

In 1st 3 weeks I lost 5kg in weight and my appetite reduced from its previous level, other antipsychotics had really increased my appetite. I have been on 2mg of Abilify for almost 2wks now along w/ 300mg of Effexor XR, 200mg of Lamictal and 1mg of Ativan. The first thing I noticed was I cannot sit still. I'm constantly shifting myself while sitting and fidgeting alot. I also noticed the insomnia. It takes me forever to fall asleep, and when I do, I wake up every few hours. My doctor actually told me that this would help me sleep better. I've also not been able to focus or concentrate... It's hard for me to even do crosswords which I enjoy doing. The worst so far is the "zoning out". My boyfriend always thinks something is wrong because I seem out-of-it, spaced out. Driving home tonight I thought my contancts were blurred and I kept trying to make my eyes water, apparently it was blurred vision which is a side effect of the Abilify. I also read alot about people gaining weight. It took me 2yrs to lose 30lbs and I feel great. Now that weight gain is one of the major side effects, I do not want to go through that again. It seems like the cons outweigh the pros in this case. I am debating whether or not to stop taking it.Read More Read Less

I started taking Abilify while already taking Paxil and I got pulled over by the police and had a manic meltdown. My license plate bulb was burned out. A previous person following me into town was an officer from a neighboring town and when I fumbled with my cell phone, I crossed the yellow line and I'm sure it looked like someone impared but guess what? He was wrong. I was not drinking anything but a cherry coke, so he radioed ahead and when the city police officer pulled me over, I could tell he was confused. Anyway, I broke down. I had just started taking that ablify so now I'm scared of it. My whole life has been turned upside down because of what one person assumed and then of course my reaction. It was my first manic breakdown that bad. I didn't get violent or touch anyone, it was that I said something out of the way to the officer and now I'm facing 18 months to 3 years in prison. I'll loose my license ,my house and if that happens, probably my marriage. I need mental health, not a jail cell.  Southwestern Indiana AreaRead More Read Less

I was taking Abilify 5mg, then down to 2mg for almost a year as an adjunct to Zoloft for depression. It truly was a wonderful combination. I was happier, and nicer, than I'd been in years. Major problem: I developed Parkinson symptoms..Falling, tripping up and down stairs, unsteady on my feet, shuffling walk, mild tremor in both hands, and restless leg syndrome. These symptoms developed gradually. At first, I didn't even notice them, until it peaked almost overnight.I'm off the abilify and the zoloft for two months now; and am happy to report these symptoms are 99% gone, just a little wobbley at times. Tomorrow I will begin a medicine called Savella. It's an SNRI Rx for fibromyalgia (which I've suffered with for years)AND it is also used for depression.."two birds w/one stone" hopefully. I hope you find this review helpful; and will be on the lookout for the symptoms I've described. I miss what I called my "be nice" pill; and am so thankful my side effects were not permanent!Read More Read Less

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I've been taking 10 mg Abilify at night for 3 weeks. I have some intolerable side effects: insomnia (5-6 hours sleep/night), constipation, and pounding and rapid heartbeat.  I also developed such a bad sinus infection that my lymph nodes all the way from the back of my neck into my head are infected- causes much pain.  My primary care physician wants me off this medicine ASAP. I find it difficult to get an emergency appt. with my prescribing ARNP.  Abilify has been effective in stopping racing thoughts; however, the side effects are dangerous and I am stopping the medicine.  I read on the "side effects" list that acute sinus infections and rapid heartbeat are severe symptoms.  I wouldn't recommend this medicine to anyone who is sensitive to medications.  I've also gained 10 pounds in 3 weeks. Read More Read Less

Reviews: I started Abilify about 3 weeks ago and immediately began noticing side effects I didn't like.     The shaking and tremors I already get from lithium got worse. I felt jittery and tired at the same time (not good when you really need/want to sleep). I think the worse side effects are the weakness and feeling like it's hard to catch my breath. So this morning I didn't take it and it's only been around 5 hours but I am feeling a difference. So my next appointment with my psychiatrist I'm going to ask for something different to address the issues with my Bi-polar disorder/Borderline Personality Disorder that haven't been addressed with my other meds (Lithium, Paxil, Lamictal. I'm also on Trazadone but that's for sleep.)     I'm not going to say I don't recommend this as someone else might have a different experience because it did indeed help my symptoms but the side effects just were not worth it.  Read More Read Less

To start off, I am a firm believer that every medicine can have different affects on different people.  I was prescribed Ambilify at the lowest dose made (I can't remember how many mg). This drug is the closest thing to a miracle that I've medically encountered.  I have been on both Lexipro and Wellbutrin for a couple of years to treat my depression.  Both helped considerably, but I still had residual symptoms of depression, and I was still, for lack of a better way to describe it, only operating at 50% my normal self.  I saw the commercials on TV and I asked my psychiatrist if I could try Abilify.  He put me on a trial, and within 2 weeks, I felt my old self again.  I no longer feel depressed - and I'm actually feeling cheerful - something I've not felt in a few years.  My work performance has improved remarkably, which is good, because I was slowly digging a hole for myself there.  While I have a way to go there, I'm actually catching up, rather than falling farther behind.  But here is the kicker: For many years, I've suffered from Restless Leg Syndrome (RLS).  My RLS got considerably worse when I went on anti-depressants.  I've been taking Mirapex, which helps some, but it just makes it milder, it doesn't get rid of it.  Within a week of going on Abilfy, my RLS is GONE.  For the first time in 30 years, I can sleep without my legs waking me up several times a night, or preventing me from going to sleep.Read More Read Less

I was put on Abilify 2mg in addition to Pristiq recently.  The drug was fast-acting (meaning I felt better in less than a week) but I am unfortunately having to stop it due to 2 side effects.  It causes insomnia (which I read about here) although for those new to the drug, taking it at *night* instead of in the morning helps a *lot* to curb the insomnia.  However, my major complaint is constipation.  I have never had such a problem in my entire life--Miralax, milk of magnesia, even prescription constipation medication was not working and I have been resorting to suppositories each and every day for two weeks to manage this.  This is on top of only 3-4h of sleep each night.  It is to the point where the side effects are worse than the benefit I am receiving.  It is a shame b/c the drug has helped me mentally but for new users, please be aware that the side effects *may* severely affect your quality of life. :(Read More Read Less

As a physician I feel that this med is potentially a very good medication. Based upon my specialty, I do not prescribe it, but I will say that it is important for patients to be aware that Abilify was grouped with many other atypical anti-psychotics and given a black box warning about potentially common and significant side efects (Especially severe elavations od blood glucose/potential development of type 2 Diabetes, rapid weight gain, and a host of undesirable side-effects).    However, recent clinical research indicates that this drug may be far safer than the others it has been "grouped with" (i.e. Zyprexa, Geodon ; And by no means am I stating that the benefits of the above mentioned drugs do not significantly outway the risks).    Abilify is different, apparently acting primarily not only within the dopaminergic system, but specifically within the "D2 ans D3" sunsystems, exhibiting both inhibitory as well as stimulatory effects.    Because I have always believed that many depressive disorders can be linked to the dopaminergic system, yet we keep hammering away at the Seretonergic and Norandronergic neurotransmitter systems, this drug may not only proove helpful to some, but more significantly may lead towards far more future research into the dopaminergic system and perhaps breakthroughs in the treatment of depressive disorders.Read More Read Less

Abilify is a miracle drug.  In 15 years trying all sorts of bi-polar meds, I've never really been stable.  Today, I am stable, don't have mood swings at all, can think clearer and am not depressed or manic.  It has promoted an overall sense of wellbeing.  I no longer have panic attacks either and got off Klonapin.  I feel much more involved in everyday life and my relationships have greatly improved as a result.  I was suicidal before taking Abilify and it has turned me around 180 degrees.  I love life today.  It's no longer and uphill battle.Read More Read Less

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: PAIN, PAIN, PAIN! I have terrible joint and muscle pain from the Abilify. It blows my mind how bad it can be at times, along with neuropathic numbness and tingling at times. I was managing my BP1 with cognitive behavioral tools and xanax for episodic agitation, because I didn't want to be on any kind of daily head meds, but after a manic epidsode that went on for days and days and crashed into full blown psychosis, I crawled back to my Doc horrified and willing to do whatever it took to never ever feel that way again. All around, Abilify has made me feel GENTLE. There is no other way to describe it. I feel easy-going, compassionate, hopeful... but also utterly undriven. My house has gone to hell, and I'm just not bothered. I have a disabling writers block (this is how I make my living, peeps), and I just feel like, oh well... it'll clear up. I have no sense of urgency.  I'm kind and loving and patient with everyone in my life, but I can't deal with the constant physical pain and the total lack of give-a-sh*t. When I have stopped taking it for a few days to "just see," the physical pain resolves, and I'm able to feel angry again, but I feel like the crazy rages are out there waiting for me. My blood sugar is through the roof, so I can't see worth a damn and I'm peeing all the time. I love feeling so fearless and gentle, but I don't think I can stay on this wonder drug. My son was first diagnosed with ADHD. His reactions to other medications led us to try Abilify and to question ADHD as his sole diagnosis. This medicine has been a god send for my son who is 8 years old. 2.5 mg a day of Abilify is all the medication he takes. It has made him more able to interact with other children and form and maintain friendships. He is much less reactive and irritable and is happy at school and doesn't complain about it anymore. The only down side so far is some weight gain. We have to work extra hard to get in plenty of physical activity and make healthy food choices to offset the effects of the medicine. Not the end of the world and so far managable. Things are not perfect but I would say they are 80% better for him on this medication and we are thankful everyday. Read More Read Less

I have had clinically-diagnosed depression for 30+ years.  I have taken many, many, anti-depressants. Most would work a while, then stop, necessitating going to another. My latest is Lexapro.  I am also taking Lamictal to smooth out the edges (signs of bipolar II). I take Xanax for anxiety and Ambien CR to help me sleep. One day I woke up and there was dead silence in my head, whereas there's usually some kind of noise or static. It was unnerving! Talked to my shrink, he gave me Abilify, at first 2 mg per night, then after my telling him it was doing NOTHING, he increased it to 10 mg per night. Haven't really been on it long enough to judge. Was fairly happy with drug combination until this Abilify, even though it's very easy to take. Price is A FACTOR:  Both Lexapro and Abilify cost $100 each. Lamictal costs $50, but at least I do have a good insurance. My mother is paying for all the medications at the current time, which helps me out enormously, while I pay off my credit cards. When they are paid off, I will resume paying for my own meds.Read More Read Less

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I am 28 and have bipolar disorder with mixed states, and had been medication free for several years.  This led to instability in work and living space, as well as relationships and health.  I decided to go back on meds, and take 1500 depakote ER at night for racing thoughts and hypomania.  But it made me depressed and I still felt overwhelmed and anxious.    Abilify gave me the worst side effects, but I am thrilled with it.  I take 10mg in the morning.  Nothing has worked as well on my mixed-state depression without making me a total zombie.  All other anti psychotics and anti anxieties I've tried either haven't been helpful enough or have zonked me out so I can't work.  This one made me very sick, I threw up for a few days and got chills and aggitated states.  But after sticking it out, I feel calmer and better and clearer than I have in my whole life.    If you have issues with mixed states, don't write this one off because it sounds scary or the side effects are bad.  I would definitely say its at least worth considering!  I am really really glad I went with my gut feeling and tried this medicine despite its bad reputation.Read More Read Less
