Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: My son is 17 and diagnosed bipolar and has adhd. After taking 3 dosed of abilify his jaw began to clinch so tightly I could hear his teeth grinding together and he couldnt stop. Then all of a sudden his mouth opened very wide and he couldnt close it. His tongue actually twisted inside of his mouth and he had no control over it. He couldnt speak during this but said later that the pain and spasms in his jaw muscles were terrible. He was in extreme physical and emotional distress. When I took him to the E.R. they said he had a dystonic reaction to the abilify, which is in the phenothiazipine family of meds. He was told to never take anything in that family again. After a heavy dose of benadryl in an i.v. He acted like nothing ever happened..Im glad it works so well for some people, but it looks like its back to the drawing board for us. It was such a bad experience that he really doesnt want to take anything at this point. Some people are just very sensitive to certain meds. He had a very strange reation several years ago after starting resperdol where his head turned all the way to the right side and he couldnt move it..same deal, we went to the ER, Got Benadryl, and he was fine...Hopefully one day we can can find something that will work for him without the reaction. Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed

Reviews: I have been on Abilify for about 5 months now.  I had my third depressive episode in six years.  I couldn't believe it was happening again.  I have been on Lexapro for those six years.  The first episode I went on Lexapro, the second was because I tried going off of it.  This third time was triggered by a tough break up.  However, I was shocked that I could become that horribly depressed while on medication.  That was the first time I started seeing a psychiatrist.  I can't recommend it more!  I have realized that primary care physicians don't have the knowledge to treat people with more complex situation like me.  My depression was so horrible.  I was on Depakote for a month, which stabilized me, but I gained way too much weight.  Abilify seems like just the right thing for me.  I feel so much better.  My doctor is suspecting that I could have Bipolar II now based on what I went through.  I am weaning off the Lexapro and only take 5mg.  I take only 2mg of Abilify at night.  That is amazing to me that someone soooo depressed could be okay on just a little medication.  That is why it has been so vital to for me to meet with the psychiatrist.  My PC physician just had me on such a high dosage of the Lex and I had insomnia for two years and times of horrible anxiety and panic attacks which I didn't know what cased by that dosage of Lexapro.  I wanted to write something positive about the mental health field and the drugs that we take on here.  I think sometimes these boards draw in people that just want to complain and tell horror stories.  Yes sometimes there are horror stories but don't give up.  Drugs really work.  If I just took a hand full of vitamins and exercised more I would probably be dead now.  Keep at it!  I know trying different things is frustrating, but you can't stop fighting for yourself.  I am a mental health victory.  If Abilify stops working like Lexapro, then I will start fighting to find something again.    Read More Read Less

I have been taking Effexor for years, and, from time to time a secondary med. In the last two years, Effexor has been upped to 375mg/day, but I have had several life-altering events, and depression remained severe.  My doc started me on abilify about six weeks ago, and the difference is AMAZING. Gradually, depressed thoughts (to which I am severely genetically predisposed)have disappeared! Now, no matter where I look in the corners of my mind, there isn't one scrap of depression visible.  It is truly lifesaving.  I have been doing very poorly for very, very long time. Now I laugh and laugh - which I've missed more than almost anything - but it is very natural ... nothing manic about it.  I am also diabetic (type 2-on insulin) and so far the Abilify has caused no problem.  The ONLY drawback may be that I get too BIG to fit through the doors in my house!  It may be a "small" price to pay, but still ...    I hope this helps -- I would LOVE knowing others have been as helped by this med as I have.  God Bless all.  Jamie in No. Cal.Read More Read Less

My two sons with Asperger's Syndrome are on Abilify.  (Yes, I know this is off-label and it's dangerous to give psych meds to kids, but they are under top-notch medical supervision and I thought it worth the risk; read on to know why.)  It has made a huge difference in their lives.    Before the meds, one son was full of rage and constantly hurting others.  The other had no idea where his body was and once tried to jump out a second story window without even knowing it.  They were stimming all the time.  We tried other treatments like sensory diets and social stories, but it was too difficult to keep up with the needs of both of them plus my other two children who have multiple food allergies.  Our home was a living hell and I was totally exhausted.    Since they've been on the meds, they've been calm long enough to start learning how to deal with their Asperger's and they've made lots of progress.  The older child has learned social skills and now has a circle of friends.  The younger child has moved from violent rage to merely saying he hates us, and is learning how to recognize when he's getting mad and withdraw to his room.    The only thing I don't like about giving Abilify to my boys is that I have to cut the pills in halves and quarters to get the right dose for them.  It would be really nice if they came in juvenile-size doses.  But that's a petty complaint; I'm just grateful the drug is available in the first place.  It has transformed my sons' lives.Read More Read Less

I know that I have only started taking abilify one dose, but I can already tell a difference.  I was diagnosed as bipolar I in November 08 at the age of 48.  After taking pretty much everything except lithium, I was FAIRLY stable taking 125mg lamictal and .50mg clonazepam with 5mg ambien to sleep.  However, I kept getting more and more hypomanic, with hypersexual tendencies.  My psych added 2.5mg abilify yesterday when I told her I was getting no better, only worse.  The only thing I have noticed today is some drowsiness.  I am to increase dosage to 5mg in 4 days.  If it has adverse side effects I will drop back down to 2.5mg.  After so many months of feeling totally not normal, it is very very refreshing to feel pretty much like I used to feel before the bp diagnosis.  I have gained weight before starting the abilify, about 15 lbs., but I needed it.  I could not eat or sleep for so many months when taking all the other meds that I looked horrible.  I do not need to gain anymore, however, so I am going to do my best to keep the eating under control.  My hope, and my docs, is if the abilify works, to get rid of the lamictal totally and only use the clonopin as needed.  That would be SO wonderful.  Taking all these different drugs when you are already "messed up in the head" is a nightmare.  I have very little depression with the bp, so I cannot speak for the effects on that, but my mania seems to be less today than since over a year ago. I will keep posting here on progress.Read More Read Less

I do feel a little irritable still, but am only on my second week of treatment and still hope to see improvement there.  I do feel dizzy/lightheaded at times, which is a little disorienting but not serious enough for me to be too bothered by it.     Because the other I was experiencing negative side effects with Lexapro and Effexor, my prescriber suggested trying the Abilify alone to treat my depression.  Like I said, so far I am happy with it.Read More Read Less

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I've been taking abilify for the past 8 months (approximately).  The effects of this medicine for me are varied.  Currently on 5 mg, thinking about going up to 10 or 20 mg.  I'll start with the cons first: Iâve gained about 40-50 pounds eating the same amount of food I've been eating for years, I sleep for 10-14 hours a night, it hasn't stopped my depression, I'm less talkative to my significant other, I'm more stir-crazy than normal (I have jittery legs, feel some tension in my calves and shin), I lose my balance once in a while, my memory seems to be effected (more short term), I get hot much easier than normal (notwithstanding I live in AZ), I get little joy our of sex and masturbation, it's difficult to become happy, and I'm more apathetic than I was when I was manic and unmedicated.  The pros are as follow: manic episodes are much rarer, I'm able to control my emotions (when I have them) more than I could, and I've not cut myself for the time I've been taking this medication.  Honestly, there are a lot of cons to this medication, at least in my experience, even though I'm thinking about going to a higher dose because it seems like I'm building up a tolerance.  I still have outbursts at work and home, albeit much lessened (like I'll get pissed off at an incompetent client and will start swearing like a sailor once they're off the phone).  I still get overwhelmed by life, though not as much as before, though I find it hard to become motivated as well.  I guess I'll move to a higher dose, hopefully I don't keep gaining weight (and yes I go to the gym 3-4 days a week).  I don't think I'd really recommend this medication without trying something else first or without taking something else in conjunction to alleviate these negative side effects.  Granted, I'm just one person, however these side effects are pretty serious to me.  I'm like a slug now, with very little personality.  Moreover, I still have racing thoughts and suicidal impulses.  Those haven't gone away.Read More Read Less

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I take Abilify, (in addition to Depakote, Pristiq, Klonopin, Seroquel, and Trazodone) and have taken it for several years.  It helps my moods from cycling as much or as dramatically as they once did.  I have also noticed that Abilify helps rid me of some depressive symptoms.  Most importantly, it helps with some severe anxiety I have, associated with the case of Bipolar I that I have.  Several of my symptoms were gone within two weeks of starting Abilify, which was a pretty dramatic and much needed change!  I may have gained some weight while taking Abilify, but it could also be attributed to lifestyle or other medications.  I also know that my body "can't handle" a higher dose than 10 mgs or I get mild tremors.  Overall though, the positive effects definitely outweigh the negative.   Read More Read Less

Although it took a few months to adjust the dosage of my Abilify, I have been more than satisfied with how the medication has helped to control my bipolar disorder.  After living with severe mood swings for all of my adult life, I was finally diagnosed and prescribed Abilify almost three years ago.  It is like living a different life.  I am practically symptom-free!  I have not had a major manic episode during this time.  My psychiatrist has adjusted my dosage twice during depressive episodes, but overall my moods have been VERY stable!!  I also take .25 mg of Klonopin at night to relieve anxiety and help me sleep. My daughter was in the car wreck with me that has disabled me for life, and she has her arotic & mitral valve replaced. Things for my daughter have not gotten better. The car wreck left me with 7 broken ribs, two budgling discs, torn ligaments, and a broken hand that no one ever noticed.I am completely disabled in my left arm & hand. I haven't done anything but  go to the doctors, hospitals with my daughter. The rest of the days I stayed in my Pjs and in a dark room and cried all the time. I still can't run a marathron, and have to be VERY careful with daily activeties. I'm not going to say that I'm never depressed, because that would be a lie, but life is truely getting better. I have no insurance for myself, so I can't get the medical attention I need for my discs and neuropothy and broken hand. I wish everyone the best, give the medicine a chance.Read More Read Less

To begin, I have no physical health problems and am a normal weight. I took only one low dose of Abilify before going to bed and I fell asleep within minutes. It was very hard to wake up, and when I did I felt like I had been hit by a bus. For the next two days my chest was pounding, I had a fever, every cell in my body was in pain, I could barely move, couldn't eat, I would burst out in tears for no reason, and I had to miss two days of work because of it. I also had strong suicidal urges for those couple of days (and never did before until that one pill). If I took one more pill I would have either died from pain or killed myself. I don't suggest anybody take this medication based on the horror I went through, but then again everybody's body reacts differently.  Read More Read Less

However, I have had some really nagging nausea...so much to the point that I don't want to get out of bed for fear that I will "spew" everywhere. I have been battling depression and anxiety problems for half my life. My doctor added Abilify to my medications (Wellbutrin SR, Xanax, Topamax [for migraine disorder] and Nexium [for GERD]). I felt no change the first few days, but didn't expect to because he started me on the lowest dosage. After a couple days I started feeling general achiness like the flu was coming on. By day four I was curled up in a ball crying because every bone and muscle in my body ached and I could hardly move. My boyfriend grabbed all my prescriptions and the pharmacy leaflets and took me to the ER. Good thing he read the leaflet for Abilify while I was being triaged and pointed out the list of "rare but dangerous" side effects that should prompt you to "seek immediate medical attention" to avoid "life threatening and/or permanent injury". The ER staff had no idea what to do for me, so they started an IV, flushed two bags of saline through me, and ran labs to make sure my liver function was still normal. I was there a total of three hours, and all they said was don't take any more of the Abilify and come back if you get worse. And they reminded me to call my Doctor. It took nearly a week for my body to return to normal, and it was the most painful week I can remember having.Read More Read Less

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: *****CAUTION:PLEASE READ*****  i took abilify about a year or two ago...so its been a while but i feel its my responsibility to warn people that you can have a dystonic reaction on this drug! its extremely rare my doctor said...apparently im special...i was 15-20 min away from dying...im only 19 and i was left with post traumatic stress disorder...i still have nightmares...this drug is a nightmare...ask your doctor if you have medications that may mix and result in a dystonic reaction...a dystonic reaction is when all the dopamine in your brain depletes...dopamine controls muscles...my blood pressure spiked,my tongue swole up making it almost impossible to breathe,my trachea would close shut repeatedly,i couldnt control any part of my body,my face contorted,my neck went as far back as it can possibly go,i was doing back bends,i couldnt speak all i could say in a muffled voice was "help me" it was traumatic for my parents and even my dad cried...its a very scary thing to watch someone you love go through...needless to say i was left with PTSD on top of my depression and bi polar...still haunted to this day...i beg you to check with your doctor & educate yourself further about the side effects...as my doctor did not...and i did not...take it upon yourself...dont let this happent to you!!!Read More Read Less

I was experiencing anxiety, poor concentration, and manic behavior when taking the prozac alone so my psychiatrist prescribed Abilify to "help the Prozac work better".  I honestly feel great!  I have only been taking it for a couple weeks, but I do feel that it has greatly improved my concentration, leveled out my moods, and alleviated my anxiety.  I have a lot of energy also.  One downfall to Abilify is that it doesn't have a generic yet, so it costs a lot more for me to use.  Another downfall to Abilify is that it makes me VERY sleepy.  I take it at 10:00pm and I am asleep by 10:30 and i sleep a full 8 hours.  I tend to be fairly sensitive to medications that make people sleepy and this medication is no exception.  Overall, I am highly satisfied with this medication.Read More Read Less
The drug worked wonderfully for me, but I had excessive sweating and a pounding heart beat. I eventually had to get off of the drug.

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed

Reviews: My son's Dr. prescribed Abilify for us and it worked wonderful for him.  But he had an extreme reaction that looked just like a seziure.  It was a dystonic reaction where the muscles in your body stiffen and spasm..he was even unable to close his mouth.  It was the scariest thing we had been through.  It took staying in the hospital on meds to flush his system to get the 'spasms' to stop.  I don't know if there is a way to tell if you are 'allergic' to this med or not..but this was a hard way to find out for a 10 year old.  Read More Read Less
It has been working for me. I have severe anxiety and depression.
Abilify worked great for about a year. I never gained weight or had any serious side effects but I started to need more and more of it to help with my symptoms.

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: For awhile abilify worked pretty good in combination w/xanax.Over the past six months started to shake really bad in my hands,to the point that I can't sign my name anymore,trouble brushing teeth.I was taking 40mgs a day.The first year was good....down hill from there.Now starting to take Geodon,will have to see how it goes.
I use 2 be very angry and drpressed but abilify along w/ my prozac has evened me out a great deal.

I have been taking this for about a month and have experienced about a 5 lb. weight gain. I also find myself feeling restless, almost hyperactive.  It seems to be treating my depression better than with Effexor alone.

Follow-up from my post of 3/15. (56 year old female). I am now cutting my 5 mg. pills in half and doing fantastic on 2.5 mg a day. No restlessnes, insomnia, or nausea.  Taking right before bed seems to work best for me. I am happy w/ no depressive moods for the first time in 35 years and I have a social life and keep in touch w/ family/friends. Before I frequently isolated because of the moods. This medication has a dramatic effect on my life and I feel so blessed to have it. Good luck to all.

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I developed Tardive-Dyskenesia (spelling?) with facial tics (grinding teeth, weird tongue-lip movements) after taking this for 18 months.  Also had a bizarre reaction after dosage increased - pacing, couldn't sit still.  However, it did a great job controlling my moods.  I discontinued Abilify and switched to Depakote and all symptoms vanished immediately.

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I took Abilify for about two years, reaching 30 mg a day. It was very effective in managing my depressive episodes and the pill was easy to take. However, I gained over 30 pounds (over 1/4 my original weight) in two years. I also had the extrapyramidal side effect oculogyric crisis, in which I lost control of my eyes for periods of time and would look as far up as my eyes would go, regardless of what action I was doing. This was eventually balanced out with benztropine.    I ceased treatment due to the incredible amount of weight gain.Read More Read Less

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: Less manic/depressive episodes. Weight gain has been a nasty side effect though.
Just started taking and wanted to see other reviews
I am on a very low dose but it is still enough to keep my symptoms almost non-existent.
Because I have no Rx medical coverage, I rely on my doctor for sample packs for now.  It is priced too high!

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: SO FAR THIS MED HAS BEEN GOOD FOR ME AND I HAVE NO SIDE EFFECTS.

I am 56 and have suffered from depression for 35 years. I stay on maintenance dose of Prozac. Since menopause began several years ago I have suffered increasing depressive episodes. I recently started on 2 mg Abilify to increase to 5 mg after 3 days. Noticed a positive difference imediately. The first 3 days were awesome! I was able to concentrate, remember things,and I felt a burst of energy. I accomphised more in 1 day than the entire previous month! I actually went right to sleep at night and sleep well. I felt happy and SERENE. I had never felt that before. I increased to 5 mg and now I can't sleep and I feel hyper. My husband noticed a tremor in my hand and I feel nauseous right after taking. I will call my Doc first thing Monday to talk about decreasing back to 2 mg. At 2 mg it was a wonder drug for me. Perhaps some problems others have experienced are due to the dosage. We are all different and it may take some time to find what works, i.e., provides the benefit w/out nasty side effects. In spite of some of my concerns I am so grateful that I have a chance at a normal life. Good luck to all.Read More Read Less

Abilify in conjunction with Depakote was an absolute miracle for me in the treatment of Bipolar.  Unfortunatly my husband lost his job therefore leaving us uninsured and the cost of my miracle med was way too much about 400.00 per month.  Since I have been off I have noticed many symptoms of bipolar return making my life unmanageable.  My hope is for a generic or an act of God to get this medication again.

I started this med after a huge wave of depression in early December.  It has changed my life!  My husband says he has his wife back.  The only issue is the weight gain.  I already weighed 250 lbs and gained 10 lbs in a month.  I have to really watch what I eat and try to exercise more.  I also have had to watch my blood sugar as it runs in the family and the fasting was 116.  Overall I will take the weight yo-yo and watch the blood sugar because the benefits outweight the bad.

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I started taking Abilify about 8 months ago and have gained around 30 pounds or more. I noticed in the beginning the change with my moods but now am struggling with it again. I also can't seem to get control of my tounge. Has anyone else experienced this?

Consentration has improved, moods somewhat more manageable, suicide idelaions have faded. more clear in thoughts. no extreme highs or lows. calm during the day hardly any destractions. Sleep has been somewhat normal hours during the night. All together it works well.

i have been using Abilify 30mg for about 3 years for fibromyalgia and "rebound pain" it was started with another drug for a month to reduce tremors and other side effects until it got into my system.this med has changed my life!i have also always battled depression,and now my mood swings are gone!i don't know where i'd be without this drug.unlike several other meds, i only have to take it once a day.i also take cymbalta,but cymbalta by itself didn't do much.this drug combination works.
i have taken abilify since it first came to be. it has been a big help to me.  with managing my bipolar disorder.

My daughter has been on this medication for about 8 months.  She was having mood swings and Has ADHD.  Since she has been taking this medication she has gained over 25lbs in 6mths.  She's 12yrs old and went from 86lbs to 115lb.  Every week she adds more weight.  I love the results but can't have my daughter gaining like this.  Think it's very unhealthy, even giving her healthy snacks.

I've been taking Cymbalta for a while, and am happy with it. I found myself dazing off into the wild blue yonder for way too long, and staying in my dark room. I was put on 2 mg of Abilify, and I can't sit still. I go out, it has made a huge difference.

My daughter (8) has been on Ability for almost 1 year.  We have tried several different doses to find the right one.  She had rapid weight gain,"fuzzy brain", and just not our girl with 7 and 10 mg.  She had been taking 5 mg for about four months. Her weight leveled off but she did have periodic nose bleeds, hot flushes.  She started making a funny noise when talking so we reduced her dose to 2.5 mg.  The noise went away but her ability to cope with her anger and impluse control was not there.  We went back to 5 mg and now we are dealing with nose bleeds, hot flushes, and increased appetite.  We just started giving her 3.75 mg to see if that is the magic dose.  It has been a rollercoaster ride and I worry about the affects on her overall health. We have scheduled a Dr.'s appointment to have her thoroughly checked out. It is comforting to see her have impluse control which has allowed her to develop friendships and have a more positive attitude.  Read More Read Less

I take this with cymbalta, it is absolutely the best. When combined with cymbalta it has drastically helped my outlook on things. Im positive and dont obsesse over negative circumstances. I feel like its a miracle drug. In the past my energy was low and now I can do everything I want. As a result I have more confidence in myself. My family can see the difference. Its Great

Abilify did nothing for my Fibromyalgia. The side effects caused the pain center to immediately take me off the drug. They didn't say why they did it so fast. My guess is the side effects could have caused me a sever reaction worse than I could imagine.

The first tablet I took made me shakey weak and light headed. My heart rate increased, I did not take another one. I have been on Wellbutrinxl and was hoping this med would help with my depression, but it didn't.

Reviews: The Dr put my 14 yr old son on this. In the beginning it was great he felt wonderful. After being on it for several years we started to notice his eyes rolling up in his head. Dr said it was Muscular Dystonia caused by Abilify. Med was stopped and thankfully so did eye rolling. My Mother is 83 and has developed tardive diskenesia in her facial muscles which is irreversible. Please report all side effects promptly to Dr so some side effects dont cause permanent damage.

since taking this medication I am able to function emotionally and mentally.  I am so grateful to have this medication and be able to function. I do have increase of appetite and urges to smoke tabacco.

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: OMG - I took this med for approx. 6 months - I try very hard to give something a chance.  I developed a tremor in my left hand that was never there before - and now I have neuropathy, in other words permanent damage from it.  I sit here and cry thinking of this, and wondering just how much damage these other psychotropics do.  I am so frustrated I would throw the whole messy cocktail down the sink, but now I'm old enough to realize there is *something* in that nauseating mix that keeps me relatively sane.  Bottom line is that I will avoid this med at all costs.  I'm not only speaking from my looong experience of dealing with bipolar I and meds for it, but from friends who are being treated for bipolar and depression.Read More Read Less

I'm not liking the negative results here. My doctor told me that it breaks the depression signals and allows you to adjust to the surroundings. I spent a summer just sleeping, yes sleeping. There's more to that, so go and have fun but make yourself realize that you are having fun! If not find out why

I tried every anti-depressant in the book, along with every other treatment possible. I been on Celexa for about 3 years and recently added Abilify (w/o any side effects). I've been fighting this major depression for almost 18 years.  Abilify is the first sign of real hope I've found in all these years. Beginning to laugh more, dance more and just overall feel better.  But, I still lack energy and would love it if the Abilify would do about triple of what it's done so far.  Maybe, I would truly find my old self again.  I miss her a great deal.  And, my 14 year old daughter has never met her, only seen this person on old home videos.  Good luck to all of you out there who have been suffering needlessly.  AJRead More Read Less

Had been taking Zyprexa and Cymbalta for years and was looking for something to replace the Zyprexa (due to a lot of weight gain).  Took Abilify for 1 month and my condition deteriorated daily.  Had every bad side effect: anxiety, extreme restlessness, inability to lay still, insomnia, extreme fatigue, sore and tender muscles, carpal tunnel in my right arm, crying spells, no motivation, extremely tired, but unable to sleep. Abilify has worked great for me.     Started taking it two weeks ago to augment the Zoloft and Remeron I am currently taking.  Even though I was taking the maximum dosage of Zoloft I was easily overwhelmed by routine daily tasks and spent periods of up to five days in bed sleeping most of the day and had lost all desire and interest in family activities.  day.    Since starting the drug my motivation level has increased, I have been able to cope with the stresses of daily life and have stopped isolating myself from my family.    The only side effect I experienced was nausea, but that went away after two days. have been minimal.    The only downside of the drug is its price, which may be a barrier for many people.  For me it is money well spent in terms of improving my quality of life.Read More Read Less

I need to know if anyone out there has a young child on this.My daughter doubled her weight in less than a year on the Abilify.We are looking into her taking something else but not sure yet.She may be bipolar,as it runs in the family.

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I have been on a variety of medication for over eight years now; I was without meds for almost five months and could not sleep and the irritability and sadness to apathy was horrible.  Last week I visited with a new doctor who prescribed me 15 mg abilify and 50 mg trazadone.  Yay, I already feel better overall except not sleeping as well as I should.  The medication is helpful so far with little side effects at this writing.  I was prescribed a coctail of topomax, zyprexa, depakote, lamictal; then on lithium and gabapitin; then on seroquel with depakote and zyprexa. My anxiety level was horrible.  Feeling less anxious now with the abilify and trazadone.  I'm hopeful but having this disorder is a nightmare even between episodes.  I hope you find what works for you.Read More Read Less

My 16 yr old son was prescribed this med for bipolar and we went 2 weeks without due to an insurance mix up and he and I are so glad he will be back on it.  Between him manic and depressed and suicidal thoughts and actions it has been a long 2 weeks.  This med is not perfect but with it I have my son and he can have a better life.

about 5 weeks ago my dr started me on 2mg abilify & decreased my adderall xr from 20mg to 15mg. increase in hunger(weight gain),decrease focus/concentration. dr increase abilify to 5mg & decreased adderall xr to 10mg. few days later had spell of good/bad thoughts,anxiety,racing heart,extreme weakness,feeling very bad. my dr gone for the weekend. i came off abilify & back on adderall xr 15mg. feeling better but not completely. i don't know how long abilify stays in your system. my dr gone until next week, oncall dr said to do what i'm doing until i see my regular dr.  i'm tired of trying expensive meds & they seem to work the reverse on me.  i did see some comments that were similar to mine. disappointed. I have schizoaffective disorder, depressive type, and abilify caused extreme tiredness, sleepiness but wake up once a night, extremely hungry (major weight gain) serious memory problems (short and long term) forgetfulness, loss of concentration and focus... the only benefit I experienced was lessening of paranoia and anxiety plus the voices were quieted. Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I took abilify for about two years. It controlled my mania and suicidal thoughts.  After a while I started getting side effects that were hard to deal with.  I would sweat profusley, become tired to the point that I would go to bed very early in the evening or fall asleep at a friend's house.  Then I began to have uncontrolable lip movement called tardive dyskinesia.  It was very noticiable and was the last straw. Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I have been on abilify lexapro and trazadone for about 2 weeks.  this stuff is better thn lithium and wellbutrin i was on. i do have some tremors, but not enough to be bothersome yet. on my recent meds i was constantly manic, but the abilify calmed that sown and the lexapro helped my depression greatly.  the trazadone i took for sleep and i haven't felt better.  if your side effect arent too bad, i highly recommend this stuff.

I suffered from severe depression and nothing seemed to work until I received Electroconvulsive Therapy (shock therapy)and was then placed on abilify (10MG).  I have only been on abilify for two weeks, but I have already noticed a major improvement.  I also take other meds for depression and anxiety (lexapro, Remeron,&  Clonazapam), but none seemed to work until my Dr. added Abilify.  I am 44 and feel the best I have felt in 20 years.  I now wake up by 7:00a.m. and am excited about starting the new day, despite the fact I was laid off from work on 12/2/08.  My wife use to have to beg and then literally pull me out of bed.Read More Read Less

I have been on Lexapro, 20 mg/day for depression. It helped a lot, but adding Abilify brought my mood up to a whole new level. I haven't felt this good in years. I am only on 2.5 mg/day. (I cut a 5 mg pill in half)..and have been on the drug only about ten days. I feel a huge difference already. I had trouble getting out of bed and starting my day before, now I am up early and anxious to get the day going, excited about life again. I feel more energetic than I have in years.    A couple of downsides I have noticed: It seems like most reviews say that the drug makes them tired, but I seem to be having the opposite issue, insomnia. I now take it in the morning, and hopefully that will help. I am also experiencing constipation, which is one of the possible side effects.     As far as I am concerned though, it's all worth it, this drug is a wonder drug for me!Read More Read Less

I was always happy as I remember, but I also felt that I was "not right". I never really told anyone because they would just brush it off, or tell me that I'm imagining things when I tried.  When I was 24 everything finally caught up to me. Attempted suicide, but someone found me and took me to the hospital. Obviously I was saved.  I was put on Zyprexa 7.5mg. It worked good.  But I gained 40 lbs in less than two months!  I was then switched to Abilify but honestly it did nothing for me.  I felt like I wasn't even taking anything. So I was switched to Geodon, which made me very very ill, throwing up for over a month before I switched Dr.'s because mine didn't believe that the vomiting was a side effect. I lost all of the weight I gained, which was great! But it was just horrible living off freeze pops and in and out of the hospital many many times for I.V's. for dehydration. I am now on Seroquel 400mg. Works great but I'm back up to the 40lb gain again. I have a Dr. appt coming up soon in which I will discuss alternatives.  But all in all, Abilify might be a great solution to other people so don't take my word for it about not working.  It just wasn't the right one for me.Read More Read Less

Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: Like all meds they affect ppl differently.  I must take mine in the AM as it works as a definite "pick me up". Was all the way to max at 30mg and had symptoms of Parkinson's Disease, sent to see neurologist twice, then lowered to 20mg, then at 10mg where I have been stable at for over 3y with little reoccurance of manic swings, voices, hallucinations or depressive suicidal idealation, ect.  Also take Prozac, Colodipine, and Remeron to make my strange cocktail......  took almost 1y to figure correct amount. Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: I have been on alot of different meds, but this med, so far... has been working. Each day I feel more like the person I once was. Knowing I am bipolar, Dr. put me on Zoloft, and only Zoloft alone. No mood stabilizer or anything. I feel into the worst case of depression. Finally, I was put on this drug and Depakote, and I'm feeling great. I've been on this combination of meds for about one month. Getting used to Abilify was a challenge. I felt very manic. Couldn't sit still, had to move my feet and legs, and couldn't sleep at night. I was put on  med to help temporarily with sleeping problems. Now that I'm sleeping, and the meds were increased, I'm doing better, for now. Everyone needs to remember, being bipolar isn't a choice. It take alot of tries to get the correct meds, but hang in there. You will be strong, and will be back to the things that you once loved.   Read More Read Less

I had dry mouth, sore throat, dizzy, confused, lethargic, unfocused, chest pain, slurring,cough, shaky, queasy, vomited, stomach cramps, my tongue felt like it was an inch thick, increased thirst/urination, loss of appetite, swollen nasal passages and started getting very sleepy again!!! Condition: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
Reviews: My attorney is preparing a malpratice lawsuit.  My psychiatrist apparently did read the manufactor's prescribing instructions.  I could not afford this medication at one point in time.  10 days later,  akathisia set in.  Akathisia is one gigantic horror experience.  Then I contacted the physician explained my symptoms, for which he never ever mentioned akathisia.  This guy is nothing more than cruel.  At the second to last visit, I was complaining about not being able to get off this drug.  He replied in a very LOUD VOICE, "Oh, for God's sake, you're not even on a therapeutic dose!"  Iwas stunned.  Why would doctor prescribe a non-therapeutic dose?  I think I have Bipolar II not 1.  Last session, he bowed his head, using a humble voice said, "I think you are right to get off Abilify.  After all,  tardive dyskinisia could have been growing, becoming more permanent."  I have been diagnosed with permanent tardive dyskinisia and akathisia by a neurologist.  Why is it that the sheriff doesn't simply make an arrest as other criminals?  I left a voice mail for him saying, "Have you ever heard of a word, akathisia, just google it and then you will know the definition.  Then do you mind sending information to my home address, please?"  No response.  He took 2 months to send my records to my primary care doctor when it was suppose to take 3 days according to his office staff.  There is much more to my story but my advice is NEVER, NEVER EVER TRUST ANY HEATH CARE PROVIDER FOR ANY REASON!  DO YOUR HOMEWORK AND GET A 2ND OPINION.  THE CODE OF ETHICS HAS DISAPPEAREDIN ALL PROFESSIONS.  I could write a book.Read More Read Less

I'v had MDD(Major Depressive Disorder) for several years, sometimes associated by delusions, even suicidal thoughts.  Abilify turned me into a zombie, I could barely hold my eyes open.  I could not mother my own child.  In a month & half I gained 25lbs, went from 120 to 145, with no change in eating patterns.  I made myself exercise to no avail.  All in all, I remained depressed and suicidal. if it helped any, I was too lazy & tired to act on it. This drug SHOULD NOT be used for bipolar II!!!!!! I was a part of a clinical trial for this drug and the side effects were horrible. I had nausea, slurred speech, irritablity, severe restlessness (could not sit for more than 2min), increased manic thoughts, rapid speech/thinking, along with several other less severe side effects. Also, my depression was not helped by this drug and I had to take lexapro to control that. I also had to take something else to help me sleep and I still did not sleep for very long. I do NOT reccomend this drug for anyone dealing with bipolar II. The risks simply outweigh the benefits. Also there are many other treatments such as seroquel that, for me at least, can be much more effective. (Note: some of these effects take a bit longer to show up than others.)Read More Read Less

Although I feel that Zyprexa is the most efficacious anti-psychotic on the market (it just has very serious side effects, such as diabetes related to weight gain), in my opinion, Abilify is (perhaps surprisingly) a close second.  Abilify has very minimal side effects (unlike most of the other anti-psychotics); however, it didn't completely quell my symptoms - I still experienced some psychotic feelings.  This is not surprising, however, because Abilify is the newest (and "weakest") anti-psychotic.  By "weakest" I am referring to the fact that it is only a partial dopamine agonist, which, in some cases, facilitates the manifestation of some psychotic symptoms.  However, for many people, Abilify is a highly efficacious drug.  For me, however, it just wasn't quite strong enough, so I switched to Zyprexa (which quells my psychotic symptoms, but has its own related side effects *see my Zyprexa posting*).  In sum, Abilify is a very gentle drug that is well tolerated by many people.  Given the potential side effects of other anti-psychotic drugs, I would try Abilify as my first line of defense.  Who knows?  It just might work.   Read More Read Less

I was diagnosed (full blood work up, endocrinologist determination, even had a stomach boroscopic biopsy ruling out cancer) as a far advanced Pernicious Anemic brought on (likely) via 40+ years as a Type 1 Diabetic.  This was 8 years ago, and I spent the next 6 years self-administering my prescribed cyanocobalamin shots.  However, despite injecting twice as often and 3X the monthly prescription (30 vs 10 units), I never reached the top 20% of the normal blood range.    Curious as to why, and not receiving a viable answer from my Endo or IM doctors, I visited Dr. Google to learn that patients elsewhere in the world (e.g. England, Japan) are being treated now with sublingual doses.  I also learned that the methyl form of B12 does not require an internal conversion to a useable form. So, 16 months back, I STOPPED the injections and daily sublingual doses of Methylcobalamin.  Within 4 months, my blood results were "off the charts," a point approximately 2X the upper normal range, or greater (i.e., <1,999 pci/l).  Since then, under doctor support, my 2-3X per year assessments have been the same except for one coming in about 1,700.    My radical dosage?  I take one 5,000 mg sublingual methylcobalamin per day (though I fully suspect the cyanocobalamin dose would produce a similar result).  My one "lower" test result - still more than twice what I received from the shot approach - was obtained after an experimental 4 months taking 1,000 mg sublingual dose (thus, an effective dose level for me).    And yes, I experienced subtle, but NOT scientifically confirmed improvements regarding specific damage neurological system.  Your doctor won't buy in?  Continue the shots AND take the supplements - in moderation, continuing your discussion after your next test results.    Best of luck!Read More Read Less

Reviews: I have been on baclofen for several years. I have scoliosis which causes severe muscle/bone pain and muscle spasms in my back and neck. The neck muscle spasms also cause frequent migraines as well. The chronic pain has caused me to be suicidal and depressed. Baclofen has helped. Iâm prescribed 10mg 2 times a day along with methadone, naproxen, clonidine, trazodone, and mitrazipine. My pain level is more manageable but still quite severe most of the time. I still cannot work or properly take care of all my responsibilities but the edge is taken off when I take baclofen. I have not had any noticeable side effects. My partner has taken it as well with very good results. Personally  I would recommend baclofen just be aware that itâs not a magic pill and it wonât take all your discomfort away for everyone, especially if your condition is severe but if you have exhausted other options such as massage, chiropractic work, or exercise try it out. Auditory hallucinationsâ¦walking like some communist military manâ¦huge exaggerated steps, neck spasms to the point of having to be held down on the way to ER. 

Best of luck my brothers and sisters in pain. 

The pain it was prescribed for, was managed. But what happens after for me was terrifying. I was nearly placed on a 72 hour hold inpatient hold. 

PLEASE USE WITH EXTRME CAUTION IF YOU HAVE ANY MENTAL HEALTH ISSUES!!! 

Actually, Iâd recommend not taking it at all.Read More Read Less

Condition: muscle spasms due to multiple sclerosis
Reviews: After trail and error with many different medications, I've found the combination of a long-acting opioid, valium, lyrica, and most recently baclofen added to my regimen. I suffer from severe, irretractable, chronic pain, due to MS which has caused and continues to cause severe nerve damage and issues with pain. At first the valium was enough for the spasms and pain related to them. Then my neurologist and PCP started trying different meds to control spasms such as robaxin, flexeril, and other musculoskeletal relaxant drugs. Baclofen however was most effective. I'm still very slowly increasing my daily dosage. But this med, by far, has been more helpful then others I've tried.Read More Read Less

Intermittent and painful muscle spasms in back. Prescribed 10mg baclofen to take when these spasms come on and if they persist for longer than a day. As such, use this medication sporadically: maybe twice a month at most. 

Is extremely helpful. One pill usually settles persistent muscle knots but I've found I don't get too drowsy or sleepy, and can still go about my day without feeling the siren call of a nap. However, I Have noticed that I've developed some tolerance of drug: whereas when I first took baclofen, 10mg would knock me out, now I can function normally with it while getting okay results for spasms. 2 pills (only used in extreme cases of spasms), however, now puts me in sleep mode. So far this isn't a problem but I am concerned that I've developed a tolerance 

I have been very happy with this medication in tandem with massage therapy, PT and stretching. Read More Read Less

I was prescribed Baclofen from my local emergency department because my lower back is hurting. I cant bend over, cant pick up my 10 month old son, cant laugh, cant cough and cant sneeze without it hurting my lower back. The doctor did NO scans of any kind, just prescribed me the Baclofen and sent me on my way. The doctor didnt tell me anything about the medication, the pharmacist didnt tell me anything other than it could cause drowsiness. The medication has made it so i can bend over a little bit, but i still get sharp pains if i try to lift up my son, stand up to quickly, straighten my back to quick, laugh, cough or sneeze. Ive experience false sense of euphoria, a bit of confusion, slight dizziness, ive cried over everything imaginable and ive been getting extremely nauseous about 4 hours after taking the medication. I take 20mg every 8 hours as needed. which its been needed because im still in pain. I dont know if i should go back and request a new medication because they didnt care enough the first time i was there, why would they care now?  I dont recommend this medication. Do your research and look into any other medication that would fit your needs.Read More Read Less
This was very helpful for me . Within 30mins or so the spasms and muscle pain weaken.

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease

I take up it for fibromyalgia. Itâs one of several medications, but baclofen is the one that allows me to more easily stand each morning. Prior to my new dr prescribing Baclofen, it took about 30 minutes for me to deal with the tingling, burning sensations in my feet and calves each morning. Now theyâre gone.

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: I have a C4 incomplete spinal cord injury (walking/wheelchair using quadriplegic) and IÃ¢??m three years post injury with a lot of spasticity in my lower back, that recently has stopped me from walking due to the extreme stiffness and potential spasms. I started taking baclofen for two days and I noticed my spasticity was getting worse to the point that I couldnÃ¢??t transfer into bed. I stopped taking it and after a couple of days my body went back to normal with the the same spasticity I had before the baclofen. I tried lowering the dose to 5 mg three times a day and my spasticity was out of control, if I reached up to turn off the light from my wheelchair my back with nearly spasmed, when I got into bed I was unable to stretch out without spasming I had to stay in the fetal position for 30 minutes before I could even begin to roll onto my back. I stopped taking it after the third dose and IÃ¢??m still waiting for it to get out of my system. This is the worst tightness/spasticity that IÃ¢??ve felt since I was in the hospital and they had me on baclofen in the hospital for about eight months, IÃ¢??m wondering now if my spasticity was so terrible because of the medication. I must have some sort of allergy? IÃ¢??ve seen some other reviews saying the same thing, and IÃ¢??m actually glad to hear because my pharmacist told me that thereÃ¢??s no way it would be the drug thatÃ¢??s doing thisÃ¢?Â¦ I know it is, I could tell after taking the first 5 mg.Read More Read Less

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: I have suffered with neck and back pain for many years.  I just thought I had to live with excruciating pain every day.  I reached a point where that's it, I've had enough and went to my doctor.  She prescribed Baclofen and it is a "miracle drug". Right away I felt my neck muscles start to relax. I have had the best nights sleep in years.

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: I have been on baclofen for several years. I have scoliosis which causes severe muscle/bone pain and muscle spasms in my back and neck. The neck muscle spasms also cause frequent migraines as well. The chronic pain has caused me to be suicidal and depressed. Baclofen has helped. Iâm prescribed 10mg 2 times a day along with methadone, naproxen, clonidine, trazodone, and mitrazipine. My pain level is more manageable but still quite severe most of the time. I still cannot work or properly take care of all my responsibilities but the edge is taken off when I take baclofen. I have not had any noticeable side effects. My partner has taken it as well with very good results. Personally  I would recommend baclofen just be aware that itâs not a magic pill and it wonât take all your discomfort away for everyone, especially if your condition is severe but if you have exhausted other options such as massage, chiropractic work, or exercise try it out. It may really help. Read More Read Less

Condition: muscle spasms due to multiple sclerosis
Reviews: I have MultipleSclerosis, The doctor has prescribed me three times a day for pain or as needed.  I donât need it very often so I try not to take it anymore than necessary. But when I do, I take one tablet at night before going to bed.  But that is mostly my personal preference, this is due to the fact that I donât like taking medicine.  I only take medication if absolutely necessary.  But it does help me.

Taken for severe alcohol use disorder after several other things tried medically and behaviorally. Used to go to ER for withdraw three times a year. Been taking Baclofen for several years now and haven't had to go back to the eR for withdrawal. Hasn't completely eliminated problem, but it gave me space to breathe. Anxiety, panic disorder symptoms greatly reduced. Can hold a job now. Changed my life. Doesn't work right away, think you need behavioral support, but this can even just help you get to treatment classes, when before it was too overwhelming. Read More Read Less

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: I have suffered with neck and back pain for many years.  I just thought I had to live with excruciating pain every day.  I reached a point where that's it, I've had enough and went to my doctor.  She prescribed Baclofen and it is a "miracle drug". Right away I felt my neck muscles start to relax. I have had the best nights sleep in years.

I have degenerative arthritis in my neck and back, and Osteoporosis. I also have a sleep disorder and haven't slept more than 4-5 hours/night since November 2016.  Baclofen does not even touch the pain, BUT - I got my FIRST 7.5 hours sleep in 6 months.  5 stars for sleeping and no stars for pain.
I found when I do take this medication I have to make sure I have nothing to do or I will fall asleep standing up.

Trying to come off low dose Xanax after 12 years was impossible for me. Then I got a Dr who gave me baclofen & gabapentin and they took away the withdrawals immediately.    Without them, I would be an alcoholic or a drug fiend. In hindsight, I should have tapered on them. I'm on 20mg twice a day and Ive been able to cut back some on it and the gabapentin.

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: this has to be taken exactly as doctor says!!!! this is not a drug to mess around with...

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease

Reviews: i was trying to recover from a bout of trigeminal neuralgia and the meds i was on [trileptal & neurotin] were causing me to have minor jerks in my arm muscles.  i mad the error of saying this to my neurologist who gave me baclofen.   i had to start out at a very low dose and work up to the full dose over a month's time.  at the end of the month ALL my major muscles were in spasm and it has caused almost permanent damage to the pirformis muscle in my left hip [as this was over a yr. ago and i am still suffering].  the neurologist said she had never heard of it doing that and sort of shrugged it off !  but i will never take this drug again.Read More Read Less
this medicine made my husband not able to walk on his own and very mean. people thought he was on some kind of street drug, it is a very dangerous drug i will never let him take it again.

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: I started out on 10mg in 1992 - am now on 60 mg.  It is very effective - allows me to sleep pretty well without spastic legs.

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease

Reviews: I was forced to change from flexeril to this medication by my insurance company.  After taking this medication for just two months I was extremely weak, confused, slept constantly, short of breath, dizzy, depressed to the point of suicide. I also experienced nausea and vomiting. I had been taking cyclobenzaprine for years with no problems. If it hadn't been for my ill Golden Retreiver, I know I would have attempted suicide.  There was no one else to take care of my beloved dog, so I suffered.  I was so confused two days, I forgot to take the baclofen. My confusion cleared enough to realize that it might be the baclofen. I went on the internet to find that I made it out easy compared to a lot of people. Since when are insurance companies allowed to dictate Rx to people that are auto immune, have extensive drug allergies, and are not even consulted. Actually, anyone for that fact. Sounds like a deal between an insurance company and drug company to me.  Read More Read Less

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: ONE 10mg pill put me OUT for TWO days and NIGHTS, NEVER ever would risk taking it again. I can see what part of this drug can cause such a powerful reaction. When I did get up I was dried out like a prune. Had to start drinking small amounts of water, and work up to 16oz glass in a weeks time, they should condem this junk.

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: Very drowsy, sometimes feel sick to stomach but would rather feel these than how I feel without the medication. I though might ultimately end up getting the baclofen pump.

I was prescribed this drug by a Brain & Spine specialists, following an auto accident which further aggravated my spine & neck plus created additional, new damage including ligament damage, herniated discs, and pinched cervical & spinal nerves.  The overall body pain (joint, nerve, muscular) was so strong & constant for 4 months I could not sleep.  The Spine guy prescribed this as a muscle relaxer, and it worked!  I take only 10mg at bedtime.  It takes the edge off and I'm largely now pain free.  Another benefit other than pain relief is that the left-sided muscle twitches at bedtime have subsided (similar to RLS, only the arm is involved too), and it mellows me out nicely.  Side-effects in me is increased urination & occasional loss of balance.  I can live with this.  For me, the drug has been a great relief.Read More Read Less

I have MS for 20 years. Been taking Baclofen 25mg x 5 or 6... 125 to150mg per a day to reduce spasticity and help me walk.  Too many gives me visual hallucinations and am tired but that is MS anyway.  Can't imagine being able to bend anything without this drug. My legs and shoulders are still very stiff

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: i have tried d all other Muscle meds. I take methadone for severe spine damage with rods/this 20 mg. three times aday has saved my physical well being. I am so greatful for Pain Doc. to prescribe it.

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: I have had leg spasm due to a bad disc and bone spurs.  I no longer have them and as soon as my back is healed from the disc surgery, I probably won't need them.  Baclofen has been great for me.  Some doziness and a bit unsteady but have had the first good sleep in two years.  My legs are no longer having spasms and the pain is gone.
The drug has not helped and is causing more pain and anxiety. I'm sorry that I did not consult with the pharmacist before taking it.

this is causing me too much pain to fill out because it keeps resetting. the first time i was well over 1100 characters both my shoulders need replacing and all these quacks will give me is this kind of crap that doesn't work with my hands tripping out and my mind going crazy. I'm can't shut up talking to any one else and i do a good job of talking to myself. i spent almost 8 years taking 120 soma and 120 norco a month for shoulder pain from rotator and 2 bycep tendons repaired. at least i could stay calm and keep my mouth shut without my arms jumping all over the place and my hands dropping things! AND I WAS PLAYING GOLF TWO OR THREE TIMES WEEK!!! i could drive my truck and  stay on the road too! I sold my clubs because i can't swing one now without yelling a whole lot more than "fore" and i am all over the road when i drive. i haven't taken BACLOFEN very long but, i feel like i'm going to hurt myself or someone else because i'm out there when i take all of these fabricated drugs that seem to do everything except make me better. WE THE  PEOPLE SHOULD PUT OUR FOOT DOWN AND TAKE CHARGE OF OUR HEALTH AND BE ABLE TO TAKE MEDICATIONS THAT ACTUALLY WORK!!!   Read More Read Less

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: Im very sad that Im not able to take this medication, it does work very well to treat my spasams due to my SCI, it really helped me sleep and relax my back muscles.  But Im not taking it anymore because it really upsets my stomach and the results are not worth the benefits.  Looking for an alternative.

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: This will reduce my muscle spasms and cramps, but I have resorted to taking it prn for MS flareups rather than routinely. I titrated off of continual dosage, noticed no increase in spasms and cramps.

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: I was taking 5-7 20mg per day and still having leg spasms at night caused bu my MS. Have had a pump for over a year now and the situation has greatly improved. The dosage had to be adjusted 4 times. Still have some spasms but they are minor and I can live with the situation. Cognitive functions have improved as a result of lower dosage.
Taking for pain, back, shoulder , end stage arthritis. My b/p up, eyes blurred, need new glasses, but can't get checked correctly. Too may things, is not worth it. Very fatigued too.

I have rare incurable neuro disorder:Cervical Dystonia. Baclofen 10mg x 1 or 2 tabs 3 times daily wasn't helping control constant neck muscle spasms so asked pain mgmt MD to increase dosage. MD complied upped to 1 or 2 20mg 3 times daily. Instruction from PA was to double my current 10mg prescription until she could make sure pharmacy would fill new script with old 10mg script not yet eligible for refill. I DID double old 10mgs (4 each, 3x daily) and when I got new 20mg script I continued to "double" as I had with the 10mg. I was then taking 240mgs per day! Even with doubling the 10mgs I was still taking 120mgs daily; maint doses are normally up to 80mg daily, but I'm sure there must be guidelines in place to allow higher dosages. My pharmacist of many years didn't flag the 20mg prescription (she's called me at home before with questions, explanations and other things). For two days I doubled up on 10mgs, then DOUBLED UP on the 20mgs (1200mgs in all)! I developed insomnia, only able to sleep avg 20 min pockets of time and became MANIC and delusional. All this from Dec 20 thru 25th, when I finally collapsed from exhaustion from insomnia and manic behavior practically 23-24 hours per day. I haven't call MD yet due to Christmas week office was closed. I'm now taking the 120mg dosage and the only new symptoms I have are feeling stiff body movements, loss of strength, muscle weakness, feeling anxious & worried that I could have a gastric bleed-out, etc. I was in such intense pain from my CD, I also took WAY over ibuprofen, the otc NSAID recommended dosage. Afraid to get medically checked out. What do you guys think? Have you heard of anyone dying from something like this?  Read More Read Less

I take 40 mg, only at night. It has made my spinal injury, fibromyalgia and TMJ much easier to live with. The muscle tightness is gone and I sleep much better. I function fine in the day, except for the one time I took 1 tablet in the daytime. I was not safe driving and my husband took over after 2 blocks.   Baclofen has greatly improved my life. Best of all, I don't need narcotics for the pain anymore.

Since taking baclofen I have noticed a major change in my muscle tightness. Although I suffer from a few sight effects including tiredness and naseau. They are not as bad as me not being on this drug. I take 10 mg. a day, three times a day. I'm not bother by this because of the result of the baclofen. I recommend baclofen to anyone with muscle admoralities because it really can help.

I have a chronic muscular/spinal cord injury in my neck. The muscles get so tense that I have severe migraines and the muscles rip or tear if I turn my head to far. I started taking a 20mg Baclofen 3 times a day and found it was the only thing that would loosen the muscles enough for me to get comfortable. The only real negative thing that I found is that my eye movements are slightly off or slow. When driving for instance sometimes the road would skip or jet forward for a second instead of coming towards me. They just couldn't keep up while watching the road. I can't 100% blame the Baclofen since I also take Tramadol and Clonazepam for the pain and muscle stiffness. If I only take Baclofen that day my eyes are fine, or if I take the other two my eyes are fine so maybe it was the combination of to many meds that tend to slow you down. Otherwise Baclofen has been quite the life saver! It gave me the ability to enjoy life easier since I wasn't in so much pain.Read More Read Less

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease

Reviews: I have fibromyalgia and get strong muscle spasms as a result of it sometimes, so the doctor prescribed me baclofen to take when needed. I find they help. When I first started taking them, I found myself sweating more and I had a dry mouth, but other than that, no side-effects. The 2 side-effects I did have no longer bother me when I take this medicine.
Makes me too sleepy

I have muscle spasms due to ALS. Before I began this medication, the spasms were horrifically painful. Now, baclofen has them under control almost perfectly. I don't know what I'd do without it. My 20mg pills are a tiny bit difficult to swallow, but it's worth it to me.

I have terrible chronic back and spinal pains, numbness in my fingers to the point of not able to use them and I type all day for work.  I have weak left leg and arm, doc prescribed this for me and it works but works better when paired with Dilaudid.  I cannot take OTC pain relievers due to stomach condition, so these two have to also help for headaches of any type reg. or sinus. Dilaudid and Baclofen seem good paired for now.
after a few days, notice eye focus is off.  waiting to hear from my doctor if I can continue use.  Didn't take it after 1 pm yesterday, had terrific spasms during the night last night.

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: Warning - Do NOT take this Medication if you have already been diagnosed as having a Sleeping Disorder an Anxiety Disorder or already have problems with Constipation. While this Medication did alright taking the Stiffness out of my muscles and allowing me to move more easily it also gave me the scariest Anxiety Attacks I've ever had in my life and I'm currently in the process of beginning Therapy because of how bad these Attacks scared me.  I haven't slept for more than 3 hours a night in well over 2 weeks now.  My Bowels are still a mess well over a week or stopping taking this Pill.  I was on 10mg 3x per day for 10 days and then because of how scary it was making me (no sleep a LOTS of anxiety) I stopped it cold Turkey.  9 days later and things are still not back to normal yet.  I'm praying that they return to normal soon.  This was one of the bigger mistakes I've made as far as Medicine goes.Read More Read Less
I feel this medication helps in spasms, i had a massive stroke 11 years ago.

After using for a yr., my side effects (below) have progressively worsened to the point that my Dr. Now has to find a substitute, which means I have to be guinie pig AGAIN, since he can no longer prescribe SOMA, which works extremely well for me. Another instance where legislators COMMAND doctors in how  to practice medicine. I'm in my 60's & don't need to be going through this. Side effects not listed: 1) LOSS OF WORDS - I know a word, however, it won't come to me & I have to describe what the word means, before I, or someone else,  comes up w/ the word. 2) UNCONTROLLABLE SPASMS - started w/ my hands, steadily worsened (have dropped many things), has progressed to arms legs & the MOST PAINFUL, my torso & neck. All can sometimes affect a nerve & cause severe radiating pain that may last hours. The ones in my neck invariably trigger a migraine. Since the efficacy of reducing muscle spasms in my spinal regions is nowhere near that of Soma, and causes so many other spasms, I have no other choice than to titer off Baclofen & TRY yet another medicine. I have continued using Baclofen for so long because I have a history of not reacting normally to many medications & since stopping usually involves withdrawal symptoms, I dread trying new meds, ESPECIALLY when I, & my Doctor, know there is a perfectly legal & efficacious med (SOMA), that lawmakers have used their power to INTIMIDATE my Doctor ( an anesthesiologist MD who specializes in pain management), to the point that prescribing certain meds may put his license & medical practice in jeopardy. If that is not an ABUSE OF POWER, lawmakers dictating how Drs. should practice medicine!!! In case I have left any doubt in you readers, YES, this state of affairs, which I have no control over, has left me EXTREMELY ANGRY, & the one suffering from these OVER REACTING State (TN) lawmakers! I'd be glad to sit in their comfy chairs while they STRIVE to make it through ONE DAY of my chronic pain!!Read More Read Less

This medication not only helps with spasisity, I have RRMS ,my migraine headaches which I had suffered with since childhood disappeared. Not one in the last 16 years. Highly recommend for both conditions.
esophagus

Recently diagnosed with trigeminal neuralgia.  Two days ago I went through several hours of excruciating right temporal sharp pain attacks (at least 7 attacks in a 5 hour period).  I call neurologist office.  I was put on Baclofen. On day 2 I became increasingly nauseated.  I also was dizzy and had generalized headaches.  By evening of day 2 I was vomiting; had trouble breathing and trouble swallowing.  I stopped taking Baclofen and by morning of Day 3 was feeling better.  I presumed to be having a reaction to the Baclofen.  I'm on several other medications for hypertension, fibromyalgia, cardiac stents (Plavix)so I don't know if the reaction to Baclofen was caused by a combination of drugs or if it was solely a reaction to Baclofen itself.  However, the reaction almost put me in the hospital.  Hope this experience helps someone else.  If you are on multiple meds I suggest taking the lowest dose possible at first to see if you have a reaction.Read More Read Less

My legs started to get this tingling and buzzing sensation as well as the tops of my hands and my heart started to palpitate. I went to Walgreens and asked them to take my vitals and oh my. My BP was 163/96 and my HR flew to 118. I was taken by ambulance to the hospital. I have discontinued taking this meds and I do not recommend it. Read More Read Less

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: I had MS for 31 years. baclofen over the years has helped my muscle tightness. With out it my handwriting is almost unreadable. I have always had good penmanship. During my college years I use to address & sign them for extra money.

1991 right side went numb and stayed for 4 month. 1998 started having full body spasms (now called spasticity. MS has never been diagnosed by MRI, spinal tap or other. Spasms would last up to 45 min and leave bruises, lots of pain. Neurologists tried Neurontin (up to 3600 mg daily), flexil, Ultram. Internal Med Doc saw my spasms and put me on Baclofen. Miracle drug, Started me on 3x10mg daily; was too much. Got down to 1-10mg at nite only and extra when needed. Has worked wonders for 10 yrs. Was told no pain associated with MS by several neurologists. Was dismissed by every neurologist after MS not found thru tests, even at MAYO CLINIC in MN. So frustrating, PTL for my Internal Med Doc who wanted to help and did some research. Have also been on Oxycodone for 5 yrs (2 x 5mg daily and as needed) for pain but am not increasing Baclofen and getting off Oxycodone because any pain med with narcotic is getting harder to get script for. DEA is now requiring Doc to pass licensing or tests before they can prescribe narcotic pain meds (at least in GA & FL) so many docs just will not issue scripts for these meds any more. Plus, I have found moving and having to get new docs makes it even harder to get pain meds and we are treated like drug addicts. Pharms have taken the older cheaper good non-narcotic pain meds off the market and replaced with new ones with no generics and very expensive! Pharms are no longer in business to help us, they are only there to make money. Anyway, I agree with so many reviews that Baclofen is a miracle drug and cheap! Wonder how long before IT gets replaced for a more expensive new drug?  Read More Read Less

My doctor prescribed this (10-20 mg three times a day) to help me cut down on alcohol consumption. It really does reduce the craving. I am drinking half of what I was before. I may try the higher dose to see if that helps even more without causing side effects.  Check out the book "The End of My Addiction"  by Dr.Olivier Amiesen.

I have a connective tissue disorder and was prescribed Baclofen due to muscle spasms so strong they would dislocate my shoulder. EVERY FEW MINUTES. The pain from the spasms was so excrutiating and had been going on for so long, I was at my wits end. I was unable to work, drive, stay sitting or standing for any period of time, hadn't been able to leave the house in months, couldn't even shower without help.... I was ready to call it quits, this was not a quality of life I could keep up anymore. And then I tried Baclofen, it was like the miracle I've been praying for. The muscle spasms haven't stopped entirely, but they're now barely noticeable. My shoulder still subluxes from time to time, but no full dislocations, and only a couple times a day, not the constant excrutiating pain I used to have. I can care for myself again, I'm back to work, can drive for 15 minutes or so, and am able to spend time with friends and family. I may not be back to a "normal" routine yet, but I have some quality of life back, and it's only been a week and a half on 10mg 3x daily. I have a lot of faith that it'll get even better as it takes full effect, and will give my body a chance to heal since it's not getting beaten up constantly anymore. Read More Read Less

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: This  medicine works very quickly after I take it and resolves the cramping very quickly.

Taking for sever muscle spasm in back from auto accident. My pain was intolerable and twisting me into a pretzel. I took half the maximum dose but ended up going to the maximum. Very important the adjustment period is 3-4 weeks, give it time. There are a lot of strange things you could experience getting used to the medication but after 14 months of physio therapy and pain there was no choice. You will get a bit wired, and after taking it in the beginning you will get very sleepy fast. You may go into REM sleep within 5-10 mins if you eat, take it and sit on the couch. Vivid dreams occur for the first few weeks. You may feel a bit high (speedy) for a short time. After the adjustment period everything was normal. My body takes a min of 40mg and will tell me if I need more, ie: under a lot of physical strain at work etc.  No big deal, I would not think twice about giving it an honest shot if you have the same problems as I have. Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: I had muscle sasms in my lower back left side for  for a long time.  I tried Soma, no relief and naproxen gave some pain relief.  Mydocalm and Norgesic helped some with pain and muscles relaxed some after a week or two.  Baclofen relaxes these muscles 90% after only one or two doses.   If my back hurts I can take one at night and feel better in the morning, sometimes I take one more.  Then the muscles stay relaxed until I twist my back or sleep with my back twisted or ride a motorcycle too long.  I have not noticed any side effects.  Great med for me and I only need very little, maybe 4-5 pills  a month.Read More Read Less

Never again!

I have read through more than 1/2 of 230 reviews and amazed at variety of responses. all initial responses were very favorable and i thought i must be crazy because my experience has been less than positive. i am taking for degenerative disc D/O, spasms, prior fusion in neck, 3 more herniated in neck and 3 in lumbar plus carpol tunnel. i have not slept in 5 days,started taking the med 7 days ago and   spent the past 3 days in a total state of confusion, to the point that during a phone call while at work the other questioned if i was really who i presented as.  I knew i was slurring my words and could not verbalize thoughts.  it really scared me.  I feel better reading comments to no i am not crazy and not likely to have a stroke at any minute and when it wears off the pain comes back with a avengenions.  i also experienced the vivid dreams the 1st 3 nights, not knowing a side effect. needless to say i am contacting my MD tomorrow to get off.
