Was prescribed this drug to help with severe leg cramps at night (jump out of bed at 4am kind). I have been on Baclofen 1 month and haven't had any leg crampsat all! I admit the sleepines and drowsines is a real pain but far better than the leg cramps.

I have had trigeminal neuralgia (TN) for nearly 24 years.  Had GAMMA KNIFE surgery in June 2012.  Going well and pain almost eliminated until had to remove a bad root canal tooth and a broken tooth in the area of TN.  That began to reverse the good effect of the surgery.  Now TN is back full swing to its former state.  Saw my neurologist and have lined up another surgery.  Asked him if there's a med he could put me on in the meantime.  He put me on Baclofen.     HORRIBLE drug!!!!!!!  Not only does it not relieve TN, it causes pain, weakness, and stiffness in all my joints where I've never had pain -- shoulders, wrists, elbows, neck, and finger joints.  Additionally, I began experiencing confusion, lack of eye-hand coordination, blurred vision, and swelling.  Kept getting worse.  Could not finish making Christmas presents for my family. It made me dysfunctional to myself and my family. I hate Baclofen.  I took myself off it yesterday after reading the other reviews.  Will contact my doctor after Christmas regarding it.Read More Read Less

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: I should've read insert more carefully about side effects! I was more concerned with swelling up details! Well, after 3 months, I have finally been taking it correctly, instead of the 3x a day prescribed, I took 1-2 a day when spasms ocurred. I have high blood pressure, and when I finally started to take all 3 a day 3 weeks ago. My blood pressure as well as my heart rate dropped dangeriously low.I have a BP machine at home, and that along with Dr.s' vital checks, I understood why I felt dizzy and like I might faint at any moment. So, I no longer need the blood pressure medication. I also have severe pain and take pain meds.  U C, I was 5'2", now I am 4'9". My discs are deteriorating at an alarming rate, they are bulging, herniated, and I also have a cyst on my spine. They are basically bone on bone,causing pain in my lower to upper back now, numbness, and I have also loss the use of my legs before, due to lumbar stenosis. I had to learn 2 walk again! Since yaking this properly, my spasms have decreased to 1 a day in bed, sometimes none! The only 2 side effects I suffer are the low blood pressure, which actually was cured by deleting 1 medication, and drowsiness, which I don'r mind at nite. I just make sure 2 coincide it with another med. I sleep better than I used to, Finally! U C, I also lost my husband of 15 yrs, so sleep had left me.Read More Read Less

On Baclofen 4 days and wound up going to ER.  Doc prescribed it for shoulder pain that resulted from MRI machine.  I have HBP and am on Diovan.  Baclofen gave me weird dreams, made me loopy,got agressive, made me sleepy during day.  My BP shot up to 219/116 usually around 120/80.  Also had terrible swelling in feet and legs. The ER doc gave me all the tests related to my condition(even tested for blood clots).  He said that blood clots were one of the side effects.  Thank heaven I din't have that.  He gave me Lisinipril and my BP dropped to 160 thank goodness. The moral of this story is watch out for this drug if you have HBP.  It may save you a trip to the ER.Read More Read Less

Reviews: Taking 10 mg 3x daily for muscle cramps from ALS. Only side effect I notice is that I am much more sensitive to caffienne - have had to reduce my coffee intake from 4 or 5 cups to 1 cup (or decaffeinnated).
Has anyone else had severe hair breakage and loss?i take this med for pelvic floor dysfunction

I have extremely severe Irritable Bowel Syndrome, to the point of needing a Fentanyl patch, Hydrocodone, and a neurostimulator to function barely normally.    I was given a Baclofen rx a few weeks ago during an ER visit for muscle spasms caused by the neurostimulator and have found that the Baclofen has cut my use of Hydrocodone in half without any problems with withdrawal.    I have some problems with sleepiness, and notice that others have reported hallucinatory visual or auditory effects. I've studied neuropsychology (phd) and think this may been related to the sleep effect. Lack of sleep can cause hallucinations by essentially causing a person to enter a dreaming-type state while still awake. This happens to me at around 50 hours of being awake.    I've noticed that with less than 7-9 hours of sleep, I will slip into that sleep/dream state since taking the Baclofen. I just deal with emails sitting down after waking up, but think that the hallucinations that others are reporting could be related to taking the medication and not getting enough sleep, or taking a higher dose.    I would suggest monitoring your mental state when going on this drug, and to be aware of potential effects related to sleep, especially when being active. Hallucinations can be an extremely disturbing side effect, but they are less frightening if you know that it is likely a dream-type situation rather than a serious mental health problem. If you do experience these side effects, try getting more sleep before calling a psychiatrist.    But so far it has been a great pain reliever for me, and should be investigated further for IBS patients, especially those who aren't helped enough by Donnatal or Amitriptylene or other -triptylene drugs. Flexeril and Robaxin have no effect on my IBS pain, only Baclofen seems to help.Read More Read Less

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: I have multiple sclerosis and spinal cord injury. I take it 4 times daily (10 mg)and have for over two yrs. It is far better than either methocarbomol or flexaril, as it does not make you sleepy, although it does tend to make you want to stay in bedif you take it before laying down. It made me feel weird and "drunk" for the first month or so, but as I adjusted to it eveything went back to normal. It is a fantastic drug for me. It controls the terrible muscle spasms in my back, neck, and legs that are completely debilitating, otherwise. I still have them occasionally, but they are less frequent and last less as long as they did before. I say ask your doctor about it, give it a try and a chance to get into your system and let your body adjust before juding it. Personally, I do not think I could function well without it.Read More Read Less

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: I am using this to help with muscle spasms caused by trauma to my neck.  I have foramen narrowing on both lateral sides from C-2 to C-4 to include severe narrowing of the left C-3 joint.  Of course the future will be some sort of surgery, but I do want to wait to see if maybe I can get "better" by using yoga and meditation.  I find the baclofen only moderately effective. It does nothing for the neuro-pain, but I don't expect it to given the occlusion of the joint and neural pathways.  I do experience very strange and vivid dreams which are usually not pleasant.  I also remember the dreams, which is bizarre,  given the content of the dreams.  Baclophen seems relatively "safe" but I keep my dosage to the bare minimum.  I have stopped taking it for a while during cycling training and races because I think it can decrease proper muscle function.  I think if you have neural pain that this med is a good thing to try.  I didn't experience any withdrawal symptoms while I was briefly off the meds.  It makes me a bit drowsy but I counter with a small dose of coffee in the morning (about 1/2 cup).  I have not experienced memory loss or recall while using but some people do.  Watch out for that side effect.Read More Read Less
I have been taking Baclofen for 6 yrs now for RLS &  Fibromyrlgia. Before I started taking it I couldn't sleep without my legs waking me up in the night. Now I can sleep all night.

I suffer from severe spasms in my upper and lower back. This medicine has been my miracle drug. I am able to function longer than when I don't take it. So far the side effect has diminished with regular use. It made me drowsy, but helped me sleep without waking up in spasms like I u8sed to prior to using this medication.

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: I originally reviewed this med in mid-2009. My original injury date of 8/5/79 I broke my neck damaging my spinal cord. Back then I was prescribed Baclofen but had major problems with side effects. Used diazepam instead until 2009 when I could no longer function due to the long half life of valium making me continually tired. Went back on Baclofen starting with a low dose. It was ineffective for controlling the spasms. As my doctor increased the dosage reaching 20mg 3x daily. It worked somewhat but gave me insomnia and occasional panic attacks. After reaching 25 mg/3x daily with increasingly worse side effects and less than good spasm control we decided I was better off using diazepam. Exxperimenting a bit on my own while keeping my doctor in the loop I have found that using diazepam (5-10mg) in morn and at night (helps me sleep) and taking 15 mg of baclofen in the afternoon seems to be the happy medium. Read More Read Less

I was originally presciribed BACLOFEN by my neurologist after my Myasthenia Gravis diagnosis in '94. MG is a neurological/neuro-muscular auto-immune disease that's main symptoms is that it constantly works to make the body weak with a low immunity factor. Therefore I took MG meds, (Mestinon & Prednisone), that increased my daily muscle/motor function! My bowels & bladder spasmed 24/7 & Baclofen GREATLY, (still to-this-day), helps regulate my intestinal spasming & discomfort. WITHOUT Drs. orders; I also used Baclofen to relax my bladder muscles during my times of dealing with passing Kidney Stones! Don't use so much that you CAN'T urinate; but if bladder spasms are severe enough...stones will not progress down through the wall passages & make their way out in a more comfortable way.***I'm anxious to speak to my neurologist though, wondering if I increased my Baclofen Rx dosaged; if it could help give me relief for the constant nerve pain in my face. As for any drowsiness I've encountered, one should discuss their decision with their Dr. that prescribed the Rx to you. In the beginning, I felt some drownsiness, but within maybe 2 weeks, as my body adjusted, I was no longer tired or feeling any side effects. SIMPLY PUT.."The benefits outweighed any negative affects that arose". But ever person is different. One things FOR SURE..do NOT attempt to decrease Baclofen Rx dosage or stop Baclofen Rx 'cold turkey'! Please notify your Dr. & have THEM give you a tapering schedule! I learned this from experience!!! Read More Read Less

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: I have alot of problems with my spine and have been in severe pain for 2 years. About 7 months ago I began having muscle spasms all over my body. I have been on baclofen for almost a month now and two days after starting it my spasms went away! I have had dizzeness, headaches,nausea and forgetfullness with this medication, also at first it would "knock me out" and I would wake up in the middle of the night and try to eat or smoke while still half asleep. (Now I can take it without falling asleep) I feel the medication had me too asleep to know what I am doing. All of that has gotten alot better, I sometimes need phenegran for nausea and still wake up and try to smoke and fall asleep with lit cigarettes but I think it is getting better because I don't do it as much. When you start this medication use caution because it will make you fall asleep easily and there will be nausea and forgetfullness but it will get better after a week or two.Overall I am very glad I started taking this!Read More Read Less

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: At 40mg a day, this drug completely relieved my leg and back spasticity and pain.     However, it made me so weak, tired, and forgetful, that I could barely function.  It also caused me to retain fluid terribly and I practically stopped peeing all together.  I was taking Vesicare for spastic bladder, and it interacted badly with Baclofen, so I dropped Vesicare and slowly weaned myself off Baclofen as well.      Now I only take 10mg of Baclofen as needed for spasticity and pain, but not every day.  It works well for me at that reduced dosage, too, but without the side effects.Read More Read Less

Background/ Setting: My husband has very advanced multiple sclerosis. He is in a nursing home and was prescribed either 10 mg or 20 mg Baclofen daily by the nursing home doctor. The doctor did not tell me or discuss this change in his treatment. From May until now I noticed and increasing weakness, slurring of speech and tiredness. It became extreme and I finally questioned any change of medication. I discovered he was on oral baclofen. He has been taken off it now and in two days, his speech is already audible and his ennunciation clear.   He has made it through the morning without falling asleep. He can control the driving stick of his battery driven wheel chair. On Sunday he was practically bed-ridden.  He tried this drug 20 year ago and it had the same extreme effect. I would not have allowed it if the physician had discussed the administration of it with me. The disturbing thing is that the doctor did not follow up and notice what was going on and discontinue the drug on his own.Read More Read Less

I used Baclofen to help with sciatica and lower back pain from a herniated L5. It seemed to help, but I experienced a side effect that has me puzzled. Here's the weird part, as long as I was up and moving about I was a dynamo, but if I stopped, sat or laid down and especially after eating I would literally fall asleep. I finally stopped taking it after my dosage was up to 10mg 3x a day. I haven't been able to find any information that even hints at this side effect. Anyone else experienced this? Injured my spine in an auto accident. Suffered since for over 4 years with spasms, etc, with only being given Soma for it along with pain meds. Then they finally gave me oral baclofen. It helped nearly immediately, and I was angry that they didn't give it to me sooner. However, starting last year I began to have some short-term memory incidents, awakening in the morning and other times of the day when I've been napping, and at first not knowing all sorts of things, like where I am, what year it is, etc, etc, for a few seconds to a few minutes, until I get all my memory back. Then the other night, however, for the first time, I apparently had a severe short-term memory loss while I was apparently awake beforehand, the first time that this ever happened to me, I believe. I then, on a hunch/suspicion researched baclofen online and found out it apparently can cause short term memory problems when mixed with some other meds. Therefore I am interested in knowing if anyone else has gone through this.    I'm therefore going to slowly wean myself off of the baclofen for awhile to see if this is what is causing it, before I tell the doctor and make a big fuss, seeing how much I hate to go to the doctors and so forth, etc. If I still have these memory episiodes after being off of the baclofen, short-term memory-loss episodes which I've had regularly now since Jan '08, 10 months after starting on the baclofen, then I will have to tell the doctor. If anyone else has had anything similar, please let me know.    ThanksRead More Read Less

Reviews: I originally was placed on Baclofen in 1979 for extensor spasms secondary to a spinal cord injury. I had many unpleasant side effects back then. Doctors settled on the use of diazepam which I used I thought successfully for almost 30 years. Then when I started with my current primary care doctor and we discussed the fact I was tired almost all the time I discovered that valium has a very long half life.I could probably have stopped taking it that day and had a blood level months later. I have just had surgery for a torn rotator cuff. This medication was prescribed for muscle spasms due to this procedure and the following lengthy and painful rehabilitation of the shoulder joint. After the procedure, narcotic pain medication was restricted due to an addiction to these medications. Firstly, the Baclofen eliminated the muscle spasms and allowed me to sleep with a substantial anti-inflammatory effect on the healing joint. Secondly I found that, strangely, my usual addictive behaviour when exposed to the narcotic pain meds disappeared. I used them as directed, for pain not recreation as I unfortunately usually would, leaving myself short and in pain. I found the Baclofen accomplished these remedies without presenting an abuse potential of it's own. I will ask my doctor about continued therapy to address my addictive tendencies. Cheers. Deciding now this problem is myopathy or MS, still under testing, specialist weighs heavy on myopathy (adult MD) the drug works wonders. No, not perfect fix, but the spasicity in my legs and feet was severe, now it is tollerable. Yes there are ocasional headaches, but not too bad. Yes a hangover feeling in the morning, and need a nap after lunch. Taking 15mg - 3 times a day, for 6 weeks now. Still more testing to get done, but I am now having my big toes be numb feeling. Doc says more test to narrow myopathy or MS... so far CT scan and MRI all say myopathy but not MS, but symptoms point at MS.  44 years young, so it is possible MS is the answer but too early to be showing in my labs and other test. Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: Have been taking this drug off and on for over 10 years & find it both "somewhat" & "extremely" helpful - it is somewhat helpful with the muscle spams, but I've also been having lots of problems with acid in my stomach caused by stress. After refilling and taking this medication for only a day or two, my acid problems went away. I also like it because I can take it at work & it doesn't make me too sleepy. I'm clear-headed and can function with no problem. I've read the reviews that say people are experiencing hallucinations. In the 10 yrs I've taken them, I've never had one hallucination...maybe a weird dream on occasion, but I attribute that to the combination of pain meds prescribed to me for my degenerative disc disease, arthritis, bursitis and sciatica.Read More Read Less

Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease
Reviews: I was using Skelaxin for my spasms for eight years.  I had to stop working and lost my health insurance.  I started going to the VA for my health care.  The Primary Care Doc originally prescribed Methocarbamol fot my spasms.  It worked fine for a few weeks and then the spasms came back with a vengeance.  The pain doc put me on Baclofen. I have started treatment with Baclofen for severe neck pain related to a bad automobile accident. I have noticed that my left foot is swelling and hurts tremendously when I walk on it. Also, I have been experiencing continuous muscle spasms in my right eye and sharp one-sided headaches that come and go on occasion. I'm starting to think that my doctor might have put me on a medication that is too strong for me. Any suggestions or explanations?

I have been on Baclofen 20mg 3 times a day for approx a month. I was on this drug before about 3 years ago with no side effects. This time I experienced severe swollen feet and ankles predominently the left side. And also my left eye has been swelling up to where it is almost closed shut, and I have also gained weight without changing my diet at all. According to my regular internist he says it is the Baclofen that is causing this. I also take many other meds for pain that I have been on for a number of years, and I have tolerated them with no problem. The hard part is that the Baclofen was helping me with my legs and now I have been taken off of it. Has anyone else experienced anything like this? My neurologist put me on the Baclofen, I have MS and Fibroymyalgia and degenerative disc disease. So for the pain I see a pain doctor. My internest does not like me seeing the pain doctor and wants to blame the pain meds for all of these problems. I am just beyond all of this.Read More Read Less
In three weeks I have been free of pain 90 percent of the time.

My son, now 4 yrs old, suffers from severe brain damage since birth.  Baclofen was added to his list of meds before he was 1 yr old. Before baclofen, moving him & dressing him was a nightmare!  He was stiff as a board & even the simplest of tasks were nearly impossible. The last 3 1/2 yrs with baclofen have been much easier.  Now we can perform his physical therapy without him screaming & stiffening up. He is MUCH more comfortable now & that means a lot to us.

My mother was placed on 20mg 2x day in addition to her other pain management meds, which she had been on for several years and tolerated very well. She was not started on a lower dose and titrated up, as recommended.I myself, was not informed that this med was started...my mother was told "it is a muscle relaxer that might help". She has severe degenerative changes in her spinal area, as well as neuropathy in her legs.She was on Baclofen at 20 mg 2x day for less than 2 weeks. She had extreme auditory/ visual hallucinations and confusion;I thought she had experienced a stroke or cerebral bleed from what she was exhibiting, and from the onset of symptoms. This resulted in a fall where she had fractured both legs and had multiple contusions. She has been hospitalized, was in ICU for 1 week,and is currently STILL in rehab unable to stand or bear weight.She looks to be at least 3 weeks away from d/c and then ongoing home PT to regain mobility.PLEASE use caution in starting ANY new drug, especially in the elderly. This was prescribed by a pain management MD, and I feel that too little caution was taken in judging my mother's tolerance/ ability to use this med in addition to the other med's she was on. Also, too little education re : side effects to look out for...now her and our ability to care for her is very uncertain because of a lack of caution on the guesswork of one patient's tolerance/ reaction to a "starting" dose over another's....I've read the other reviews where hallucinations/ confusion have been experienced, and would be interested in knowing what dosages they were on/ started on, or any other instances of similar reactions.Read More Read Less
I quit drinking using Baclofen I don't feel the need to drink any more.

I have been on this med for about 2 mo for back problems, fybromialgia and a few other things, and it's been interesting, i'm on a lot of other meds too, but this is the new one.since starting it i've got more twitching, dizziness, my hands don't want to work right, they curl up at times and there's nothing I can do about it. I was on Soma before, but my doc said "that stuff will kill you" so we switched meds. Right now I'm wating to try something else. I'm having WIERD dreams, when I can sleep, and I get weakness in my arms & legs, and I get SUPER spasms, where it feels like someone kicks me in the chest, and moves my whole body.I don't know yet if it's this med, or a combo of them, but it seems to be making my life crazier than usual..seeing and hearing things too. I don't want MY experience with this drug to deter anyone from trying it, it CAN help, but watch out for the unusual when you're on it. There are always going to be people that have a problem with a med, but then, there are a lot of people that don't. Don't knock it before you try it. Screen's getting blurry...GOOD LUCK..whatever med you end up on..if one don't work, try another 'till you get the right one. I am a 45yr old male wih a rare disease called stiff-man-syndrome {pc term} stiff-person-syndrome. Condition: Muscle Spasms caused by a Spinal Disease

Reviews: Currently taking 30 mg 3x day for muscle spasms due to spinal cord injury. It helps with the spasms but doesn't eliminate them just makes them tolerable. It does affect coordination as well.
I slept the first night but never again.  Rx doesn't really say what its for, doctor didn't tell me.  I assumed it was for sleep.
I got no relief of my pain and it caused me to be dizzy all the time
Comment on last review: The review was inaccurate. This person stated signs/symptoms of a GI Bleed and were not related to the medication.

Severe diarrhea, black tarry consistency, pain in pit of stomach, atrocious smell, like metallic.  Overall I was getting weak, and could not stand it anymore.  Pharmacist said to decrease it until Dr. was seen.
Capsules are easy enough to swallow but the drugs was 100% not effective in treating my UC symptoms.

This is the first and only medication I've used to treat my ulcerative colitis. It works amazing, but it's operator-error that leads to flare ups. My GI has me taking this 3x a day. If I forget a dose, my UC flares.
I have been on this medication for over 5 years. It has worked for me.

I've been on this med for the past couple of months, so far so good! It's been working to keep things under control for me without any side effects. I agree with some of the others about the trickiness of remembering to take the 3 afternoon pills everyday, other than that, no problems.

The Balsalazide (3X3) completely cured my Crohn's disease/colitis, with no side effects.  I asked my gastroenterologist how often this happens for people, and he said, "It's hit or miss."  So I think I got lucky.
Has any one experienced lower leg pain - including cramps and/or tingling sometimes burning nerve pain?
Lots of weight gain, about 25 lbs. Today had a bout of dark green stool-will have to call doctor to see what's up with that. Hate that the pills are so large too! Been taking it for over a year.
Been taking this for about a month and the muscle pains are so bad I can barely walk.

I am a 65 yr old female with ulcerative colitis.  This drug seems to be effective. but the huge capsules are very difficult to swallow.  I have experienced swollen ankles and weight gain while 6 months on this drug.
I have been taking 3 capsules 3 times a day for a little more than 1 month, So far so good. However, I have been losing hair ever since I started taking this drug.

This medication didn't do a thing for me. Had trouble swallowing all those pills (3-3 times a day). Had to mix them with applesauce in order to get them down. Also had trouble remembering to take them.
Am taking 3x3 pills a day.  Hard to remember the afternoon pills even though I keep them in my drawer at work.  Anyone experiencing any hair loss with this?
I have been on this medicine for almost 2 years and it has been great. I take 3 pills twice a day.
I have been taking this medicine 3 pills 3xday and has worked very effective on bloating issues but has kept my flare ups have been far apart.
I was really hopeing that this medication would help ease my symptoms but instead it gave me really bad joint pain. Apparently I am amoung the 4% of the population that gets this side effect.

I'm 7 years old and been on this now for 3yrs. It worked good at first but now I've been having more symtoms and I guess side effects from it. My Doctors are checking into it.  But over all its worked. I think since I've gotten older I need a change.
I am taking this medication in conjunction with Opremazole.  I can eat all types of food without the debilitating heartburn/reflux I used to experience.  Works for me.
Capsules are easy enough to swallow but the drugs was 100% not effective in treating my UC symptoms.

I've been on Balziva for about 6 years! I don't experience really any cramps at all, no acne, no weight gain, my mood swings are light and so are my periods. My periods last about 2-3 days really, sometimes I don't even have them which is concerning. I guess that would be my only complaint actually..sounds crazy but I kind of miss having a normal period! I've talked to my doctor and she said it was completely normal. Sounds like a lot of people have had problems with this drug, and I get that it's not right for some people but maybe give it some time too.Read More Read Less

I was started on this medication for cyst and heavy periods. My menstruals were perfectly regulated. Now I continually have episodes of bleeding that last from days to weeks. I have no idea what to expect. I hate it.

Started using Balzia for regular periods, cramps and overrall protection. I have been on three different birth controls and can honestly say Balzia was a nightmare. In two months my bra size went from a 38D to a 38DDD. And my pant size went from an 8 to a 12. IN TWO MONTHS. When I realized my weight gain started when I started this pill I immediely switched it. It's been about two weeks since I've been on Baliza and I already lost 5 pounds. It did make my periods regular but did not help with cramps at all.Read More Read Less

I have been on multiple birth controls over the yearsâ¦ this pill was by far the worst. I immediately gained ten pounds, developed cystic acne, experienced a lot of bleeding, vision was blurry, my breast were constantly sore, became depressed and my mood swings were out of control. I tried this pill for two months and could not take it anymore! I do not recommend if you usually take a pill that has a low dosage.

I have been on five different birth controls and this is by far the worst. I recently found out I have polycystic ovaries and my gyno prescribed this pill to help correct my very irregular menstrual bleeding. Aside from the breakthrough bleeding, the worst side effect is the severe moodswings. I struggle with depressions as it is. So this pill really wasn't helping anything. I had my period for over a week when I started it, and doc said it would stop it. It didn't. I bled the entire month I was taking it. For others like me, the only pill that has ever worked (and I was only taken off of by my doctor for it being "too strong") was Mononessa. Ask about it. Different bodies need different amounts of "hormone-control". Find a bc that you're hormonally compatible with. From the looks of other reviews, not many people jive well with Balziva. Don't play guinea pig to whatever your doctor tells you. Pay attention to what your body needs, if Balziva or anything else prescribed for you is only doing you wrong, speak up for yourself and get what works for you. Your gyno isn't there every month going through what you are. You're your only advocate in the end. Read More Read Less

I started this when I was in college due to such painful periods that I'd miss class/not want to move/they were so heavy/nasty.  Not only have I not had a period in like 10 years, but I haven't had cramps or acne!!!  Only problem is I did gain some weight and once in a while I forgot to take a pill.  Ugh.  Now I use it for birth control too.

I've had so many problems with Balziva. Spotting the second week of pills so bad that I might as well be on my period twice a month. It's awful. Also, I've had extreme moodiness. Incredibly happy one moment, completely depressed the next. I have absolutely no sex drive since I started taking it. And since I've started taking it I'm almost always bloated. I'm naturally really thin, so when my stomach starts to bloat I could almost pass as roughly 3 months pregnant. I've had nothing but problems with this pill. Read More Read Less

I am currently finishing up my third month of Balziva and cannot wait to switch. Initially I switched from this from Seasonique because it wasn't regulating my body like it was supposed to and my doctor said a monthly pill is more effective for that.   First month: bleeding during entire 2nd week of active pills and a few days during the normally scheduled 4th week.   Second month: bleeding during entire 3rd week of active pills, ended right before normally scheduled 4th week.   Third month (now): Bleeding started in 2nd week of active pills, has been going for an entire week. Unsure if it'll keep going, or if I'll get the normal cycle in the 4th week.   In addition, within the past month and a half I've been experiencing what a lot of other women said they've noticed - moodiness, tiredness, lack of motivation, sadness, and for me, even a bit of what could otherwise be diagnosed as bipolar. I've been having some vivid nightmares - something that I've never had before - and weeks of nonstop, sharp cramps.   I know each pill works differently with every woman, but I wouldn't recommend this to anyone unless it was a last-chance effort. Read More Read Less
I was on this pill for far too long.  I experienced more negative side effects that included: Always being tired, severe mood swings, breast being tender, weight gain.  I have since switched pills.

I HATE this birth control. It made me severely moody and anxious. I already have anxiety as it is and this just made it ten times worse. I have no sex drive what so ever anymore. My period came every other month only the first few months and now I don't have one at all. I had no weight gain or acne but I also realized along with no sex drive, when I do have sex it is very painful. DEFINITELY switching.

I have been on Balziva for a year or 2 and haven't had any problems. I was on orthotricyclen, brand and generic, before and started having spotting after intercourse so my gyno switched me. On the Balziva I've had very light periods which do last about a week and I too get very VERY emotional the day before I start my period. I am an anxious, emotional person as is, but the day before is noticeably more emotional lol. Just remember, every medication will affect everybody differently. If you're not happy on Balziva, switch, that's why you have a gyno, they know what they're doing!Read More Read Less
Regulated cycle, and keeps menstruation painless and short. Only one day of PMS a month.

I have used Balziva with great success, thus far. I have been on it for just over two years. I have had no physical nor emotional side effects. I have not experienced weight gain, but then I eat well and exercise. I take this drug the same time every evening, as I feel it is most beneficial and is recommended. I was put on this type of birth control for endometriosis, and no longer suffer from the pain I once did. In truth, I have not had any break through bleeding and no period. Also, I have no skin acne, my skin is clear. I attribute that to this drug and good hygiene. As for a contraceptive, I have experienced good results, as well. The cost of this birth control is steep, given it is a generic; $80 plus. I really do not understand why it is outrageous in price. I do have medical insurance, but it does not cover birth control, so I have to pay out of pocket. I wish there was another brand that would work as well, I would switch. I gave Balziva 5 stars across the board, for the reasons I stated. However, had their been a rating for cost, I would have given 1 star. Read More Read Less

I need some information I am on Balziva birth controls. I do take them on a regular but not at the same time. Does that make it more of a risk of getting pregnant. I have been on this medication for since May. I had unprotected sex with my boyfriend and he ejaculated three times in me I am on the second week of birth controls. I want to know my chances.

I have been on Balziva for a few months now. My doctor felt it was the drug of choice to regulate my periods. So far so good. However, on the day before I actually start my period I am an emotional train wreck! I cry and mope around but the next day I'm fine. I have what I call normal 5 to 7 day period. No horrible cramps or extreme bleeding. My husband I agreed that I will continue for a little while longer before we stop all together and try for a little one.

I've been on Balziva for about 5 years now, and I love it. My periods are very light, although they do last for 7 days (same as before I started the pill). I have never gotten pregnant while on this pill. Zenchent is another alternative (same active ingredients) & I do prefer that over Balziva (less emotional on zenchent) but they are both effective.

However, on the day before I actually start my period I am an emotional train wreck! I cry and mope around but the next day I'm fine. I have what I call normal 5 to 7 day period. I've been on Balziva for about 5 years now, and I love it. My periods are very light, although they do last for 7 days (same as before I started the pill). I have never gotten pregnant while on this pill. Zenchent is another alternative (same active ingredients) & I do prefer that over Balziva (less emotional on zenchent) but they are both effective.
Had abnormal periods, once i started his pill, i had my regular menstrual cycles on time.

My doctor prescribed Ovcon-35 (Balziva is the generic) to treat very heavy, long periods. My periods were lasting 10-12 days and I was bleeding through a tampon ever 2-3 hours. Balziva did cause me to stop having periods altogether which was a relief.    HOWEVER, within just a few months of taking it, I'd gained 15 pounds. I was an emotional wreck. I'd cry when I got stuck in traffic and was late to work. I'd cry when my dog peed on the carpet. I'd cry when the chicken came out too dry. I even cried when the employee at my bank told me I needed one extra document to change the name on my debit card after I got married. And to top it off I was ALWAYS  tired and my sex drive totally plummeted.    Finally, after about two years of taking it, I started to have occasional, sharp chest pains and really weird, unusual headaches at the base of the back of my head. They were causing me to be light headed and dizzy. During a routine checkup, my blood pressure was a little high (130/85) for someone my age (25), who works out 6 times every week. Over the next two months it began to rise until it was at 155/100 and my doctor took me off Balziva because she was worried the high dose of estrogen was going to cause a stroke.     Its been 2 months and my blood pressure has come down considerably but I still haven't started a period. I don't know what's going to happen when my husband and I try to get pregnant.     I absolutely do not recommend this drug to anyone. Read More Read Less

I have endometriosis, my symptoms are severe cramps, vomiting, nausea for three to four days to the point of not being able to function, diarrhea, migraine, fever and heavy bleeding. I basically have to take the week off from my life once a month. I took Balziva for three years and I would have light cramps, small headache and my period was just spotting. I would have a bad period every 4-5 months. Eventually it stopped being effective in controlling my endometriosis and I am trying a generic for Seasonique. These past three years have been the best time of my life.  I forgot I had endometriosis. I hope I can eventually take Balziva again.Read More Read Less

I started taking Ovcon (Balziva generic) for lack of menstrual cycle (28 y.o. and never ever had a period), extra hair growth, abnormal hormone/thyroid levels, and birth control factor. I did the quick start method (where you start on any given day.), this was decided by the doctor seeing as how I'd never in my life had a period, I couldn't wait around for a Sunday start. I was told to take 2 weeks of pills before engaging in any unprotected excursions because we had no idea where in my cycle my body was. I've been taking it for 4 months now. After 4 months I can say that my body has adjusted pretty well to these meds. The first 3 months I suffered with very tender breasts, headaches, breakthrough bleeding, bloating, and nausea, but month 4 has been a breeze. Give your body time to adjust to the meds, especially if birth control is new to you, eventually all of the side effects will go away, just wait it out! It has worked wonders for me! I actually have a cycle now and they're extremely regular. It only takes 2 placebo pills for me to start and lasts about 5 days. I've been told over time it will lessen and may even actually skip a few. So, word of advice, give Balziva at least 4 months before you decide to try something different. It WILL take that long for your body to adjust to it! I'm pleased.Read More Read Less

I started taking Balziva because my periods were crazy. They would come every other week and last for three days. So far, they really haven't improved much. I haven't had any side effects, which is GREAT. I just don't think that the hormone dose is strong enough for me personally to hold off my periods. I have only been on it for a few months, but my periods come early, usually at the beginning of the 3rd week of the pack and I will bleed (sometimes heavily) all the way through the sugar pills and have a 2 week long period. I just want to find something that works. I think Balziva is worth a shot. It doesn't personally work for me, but that doesn't mean it won't work for someone else.Read More Read Less
Got pregnant while on this pill and never missed a dose. Had a horrible miscarriage. Hate this pill.

Its effective and I'm not even the best at taking it (I know, I know). Periods are always on time and regular. But I do get on and off nausiation, especially the past few months, which is odd, because Ive been on it for over a year now.

I started taking this medication because I was experiencing very long periods... 3 months long.. started this drug and boom, periods were back on track... However, 6 weeks into taking medication I wanted to kill the entire world.. I had no sex drive, was always tired and depressed... I would rather bleed for 3 months straight than feel like that again... stopped taking the pill 2 weeks ago, and finally feeling back to normal... bad experience for me... wish you all better luck!
Got pregnant while on Balziva. No antibiotics. Took exactly as directed.

I had very painful periods which caused severe pain before I started taking this pill.  My periods would be very heavy at times and would last anywhere from a half a day to two and a half days.  On Balziva, I have no pain whatsoever, and my periods are extremely light (light enough for panty liners), lasting only 1 day. I do not have any mood swings, and my high sex drive is greater than ever.

I started this medicine about 3 months ago. This is the first birth control pill I have had success with. I formed clots with the other three I tried, so because I am able to stay on this one so far, it's a big plus for me. However, I have noticed I am moodier than I was before, and I feel bloated, but overall, having my periods go from 9 days to 4, and from extremely heavy to extremely light, this has helped me a lot. Also, I have not bad cramps since I started. My endometriosis used to keep me in bed for days, but now I can lead a more normal life.Read More Read Less

I experienced non-stop bleeding for two months after I began taking this medication. I was tired, noticeably down, and just didn't feel myself. I have never experienced this with any other type of birth control.

I was on Ocella for years, (generic for Yaz) and loved it. My periods have been getting worse since entering my mind twenties so my doctor put me on Balziva, telling me that switching up would help with painful periods. It has been awful. I gained about 8 pounds (I have a small frame so it might as well be 15) I am a very healthy eater and go to the gym about 4-5 times a week and haven't been able to lose the weight at all.  I developed horrible depression and mood swings, and I lost my sex drive. That being said, I am going back on Ocella. I do believe that it really depends on the person for the birth control but it just was not right for me.   Read More Read Less

I was on this pill for over a year, and it was the worst year of my life. I had severe mood changes to the point that I was clinically depressed and suicidal. I gained about 30 pounds and looked swollen or bloated all the time. My boobs went from B's to DD's, which may sound good, but I outgrew all my clothes and experienced severe back pain because of them. I got headaches all the time and was tired 24/7. It took me a very long time to figure out that the pill was the cause of all of these symptoms, but as soon as I stopped taking it, within two weeks I felt completely normal again. I am also not the only one who experienced this. My friend was also on Balziva and had the same problems. It wasn't until after she was prescribed antidepressants that she realized that the pill was actually the cause. I very very very strongly caution against taking Balziva. I wasn't myself for over a year and almost ended up taking my own life because of it. There are plenty of other options for birth control that work much better, but if you do decide to take it, please just be careful and be very vigilant in watching out for yourself. No one deserves to feel the way I felt. Read More Read Less

I have been take this pill for 5 months now and I have not experienced any major side effects. It made my skin clear, which I am so happy about because I had aweful cyst like acne. My breasts get really tender around the 3rd week before the week my period is due and as far as my periods, the flow is lighter but I am still bleeding for five days. I don't have any mood swings, nothing out of the norm and my sex drive is even better. This is working for me and this is the first birth control pill I have ever taken.Read More Read Less
It has cut my cycle from 7days to 3days and they are much lighter.

I am on this med for hormone inbalance. I was on FEMCON with great results (3 packs from the DR) and was given a rx for OVCON 35..my pharmacy gave me Balziva. OMG!! I've been on this for 9 days and I am ready to kill someone. No joke. I feel like I am in the middle of the worst PMS of my life. My breasts are tender, my moods are horrible. :( Called the pharmacy and they are sending out the brand name OVCON asap..it's going to cost me $30 a month, but my sanity and that of my family is worth every penny.    I suggest you think long and hard about taking this med..I know everyone is different, but this did not work for me. I read the reviews and was sure I wasn't going to have any issues....well, here I am on day 9 and I'm ready to blow my top..for no reason..at all. My kids and dh noticed a difference right away and asked if I was PMSing..I'm not..my period is 10 days away.     Read More Read Less

The reason I'm posting is because so many people have put negative reviews about Balziva as a generic brand for Ovcon or FemCon. I justed wanted to make everyone aware that it's required by LAW that generics have the EXACT same ingredients as brand names. So, there should be no difference in the pills, only a difference in the weight of your pocket. The reason generics can be cheaper is because they had no research overhead and everything that the brand name/original producers did.  It might be real emotional issues and not the generic version of a pill.Read More Read Less

I started Balziva to relieve extreme discomfort during my menstral cycles, and it proved effective in preventing my previous dizziness, heavy bleeding, and a strange hot flash I would get once during each cycle [this was so horrific I would go pale, sweat up a storm, pass out, and wake up ice cold. EVERY month.] I have been on this pill for over a year and its benefits outweigh the negatives. BUT it wasn't always like this. When I first started on this pill, I had bleeding for a month straight. In the following month or two, bleeding every two weeks. I was kind of psychotic for a day or two out of every month back then. After a few months, all these symptoms vanished for me. My period is so light that I'm not bothered when I have a period anymore. I just had it on vacation and I didn't give it a second thought. Now, the only complaint I have is the lack of sex drive, sexual arousal, etc., so eventually switching pills seems like a good idea. Read More Read Less

I tried to kill myself and ended up in the hospital when I was taking this Tri Sprintec. I cried almost every day, and felt very emotional all the time when I was taking it. I don't keep track of things as well as other reviewers on here, so I don't know exactly when it started, but I know that I was on Tri Sprintec for almost a year and cried every day almost every day. Then, when I switched to Femcon and next Balziva, I became a normal person again. Before I took Tri Sprintec, I had been taking Ortho Tri Cyclen Lo and didn't realize there was a problem with my moods, but now that I have the perspective from being on Balziva, I think all the tri-phasic pills cause me to feel like I want to cry all the time, whereas the mono-phasic pills such as Balziva and Femcon make me less upset. Actually, with Balziva, I feel completely level-headed and rarely feel like crying. I don't even have PMS now. Tri Sprintec gave me the heaviest periods I've ever had (Super flow tampons for five days, but without BCPs I rarely have a period and when it comes it's like spotting and nothing more), but with Balziva I wear Regular tampons for four days, and sometimes I can go for several hours without a tampon during my period. Anyway, everyone is different, but Tri Sprintec really messed me up emotionally and I don't ever want to switch from Balziva to anything else now.Read More Read Less

By the 5th day of contacting Covid (best guess of when I acquired Covid from symptoms and testing confirmation), I had developed mildly severe cough, severe body aches and issues trying to breath (oxygen level at 85%).  Lil had just sent out the first 300 drips under a Emergency FDA Release on, or about, November 09, 2020.  My hospital was given 30 of the 300 drips released by Eli Lily.  I Was given the hour long drip with another hour of observation, I was sent home and not admitted into the hospital.  Some 12 hours later I began to lose my body aches and began to breath easier. By 24 hours I had lost all symptoms of Covid I had exhibited. My oxygen level went up exceeding 92% and the emergency room physician who saw me and then introduced the drip could not believe my recovery.  He said I was a day away from going on a ventilator.Read More Read Less

Condition: Epilepsy of the Lennox Gastaut Syndrome
Reviews: My daughter was having tonic seizures every 5 minutes even though she was also taking dilantil, felbatol, keppra, klonopin.  Banzel was added around March 2010.  It is now August 2010.  Once we got to the point of taking 1600mg/day, the effect was amazing.  However, getting there was tough.  Lots of vomiting.  Now, as long as we feed her before she takes the meds, she will not get sick.  She is 30 and disabled since birth with uncontrolled seizures since birth.  This drug seems to work for her.

Condition: Epilepsy of the Lennox Gastaut Syndrome
Reviews: Banzel worked very well for my daughter for the first 8 months.  Prior to starting this med, she was having drop seizures almost daily & we had to make several trips to the ER for head injuries (lacerations) due to falls.  We were able to take her off of three medications (Topamax, Clonidine & Lyrica), but after stopping the Lyrica, she began having tonic seizures.  Now she's back on Lyrica, the Banzel dosage has been increased, and she's starting on Vimpat now because she's still having seizures several times per week.  Read More Read Less

Condition: Seizures with Breaks in Consciousness & Other Symptoms
Reviews: I have taken most of the epileptic medications available since my first convulsion in 1974. With each medication, I either suffered reactions or my system built a resistance to the action of the medicine.   When I began Banzal I feared my seizures were about to return to a non controlled status. At that time I was on Keppra and Lamictal, with my physician removing me from Lamicatal due to reactions. Within 6 weeks of beginning the rufinimide experimental treatment, my seizures had lessened a significant amount - from several a week to one or two a month. Currently, it has been 18 months since my last seizure. I have been able to complete my Bachelor of Social Work degree and will have my MA in Gerontology in May. Prior to this, my seizures have caused me to be forced to discontinue my education since 1979, each time I attempted to advance.   I believe that further studies are warranted to determine the effect of rufinimide upon the elderly and on women in perimenopause and who are fully menopausal, to see if horomonal changes affect the medication on the system.   Read More Read Less

I've been on Baraclude for 3 years. Lab works and ultrasound is ordered every 6-12 months. Since my father died of liver cancer in his 50's, my doctor told me that I might need to be on it for the rest of my life to continue to keep the virus count to zero. It costs $1,200 per 30 days supply. I'm now 32 and if I live to be 77 years old (the US life expectancy), it would cost me about $648,000. I used to have insurance coverage on and off for over the period of those years. If your proof of yearly income is less than $47,000/household, or $55,000/house-hold of 3 members, Bristol-Meyer Squibb company (the manufacture) will send you free Baraclude every month as long as your doctor help sign your application. Thanks to Bristol-Mayer Sqibb for such a helpfull program to help save thousands of average-income Americans that need Baraclude. I've been on Baraclude for 3 years. Lab works and ultrasound is ordered every 6-12 months. Since my father died of liver cancer in his 50's, my doctor told me that I might need to be on it for the rest of my life to continue to keep the virus count to zero. It costs $1,200 per 30 days supply. I'm now 32 and if I live to be 77 years old (the US life expectancy), it would cost me about $648,000. I used to have insurance coverage on and off for over the period of those years. If your proof of yearly income is less than $47,000/household, or $55,000/house-hold of 3 members, Bristol-Meyer Squibb company (the manufacture) will send you free Baraclude every month as long as your doctor help sign your application. Thanks to Bristol-Mayer Sqibb for such a helpfull program to help save thousands of average-income Americans that need Baraclude. If you're one of us, you will surely get it for free from the manufacture.      Read More Read Less

My daughter had a liver transplant in 2011, in 2014 she was diagnosed with steroid resistant rejection.  In early 2015 her Drs at PMH Perth WA, decided that due to such a poor quality of life raised liver enzymes and bilirubin 200 and shocking pruritis they would try Basiliximab.  This had never been administered at the hospital before to a child, so a protocol was written.  My daughter had the infusion day 1 and day 5 with no notable side effects. She was commenced on Valgancyclovir and Bactrim for her protection (her liver is CMV +ve) About 5 weeks later her enzymes started a downward shift, as did her bilirubin.  This plateaued and so she received another one off infusion 1 month later.  This didn't appear to have much effect until 4 months later.  My daughters bilirubin is 23, her enzymes have fallen to almost normal except for her GGT which is still high, her Pruritis has improved and the last 2 days she has not been itchy at all (she was started on Colesevelam 6 weeks ago), she is sleeping at night, and able to go to school full time.  This has to be the Basiliximab working, we were thinking it was the Colesevelam making the difference, but lowering bilirubin and liver enzymes is not part of its actions from what i have read.  So it must be the Basiliximab working.  She is currently on the transplant list for a  new Liver, but as she is at the moment she has improved so much I doubt she would meet the criteria.Read More Read Less
